tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1.5 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Planes
programme.desc: A crop duster longs to be a racing plane, but is hamstrung by a fear of heights. With the aid of a veteran flyer, he learns to conquer his phobia and compete against some of the world's greatest flyers in a round-the-world race. Animated adventure spin-off from Pixar's Cars, with the voices of Dane Cook, Teri Hatcher and Stacy Keach.

programme.title: The Croods
programme.desc: Prehistoric family the Croods find themselves with nowhere to live when their cave is destroyed. They embark on a dangerous trek through an unstable landscape overrun with all manner of dangerous predators in search of a new home, but their domestic squabbles prove as much of an obstacle as the wildlife. Animated comedy, with the voices of Nicolas Cage and Ryan Reynolds.

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates footage of painted wolves on the banks of the Zambezi river, as an ageing matriarch faces a challenge for supremacy from her own daughter, who has grown to lead a pack of her own, which now needs to expand into new territory. With human-occupied land penning them in, the two packs are forced to fight for the little resources available.

programme.title: Prince, Son and Heir: Charles at 70
programme.desc: Observational documentary following Prince Charles over the past 12 months, being shown to mark his 70th birthday on November 14. Film-maker John Bridcut follows the prince at work and behind the scenes and speaks to those who know him best - the Duchess of Cornwall and Princes William and Harry - as he builds an intimate portrait of the longest-serving heir to the throne.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup 2018 Highlights
programme.desc: A look back at the tournament in Russia, which saw France lift the famous trophy and become two-time winners, while Gareth Southgate's England reached the semi-finals for the first time since Italia '90. The Three Lions captured the hearts of the nation during their run to the last four, finally winning a penalty shootout for the first time in 22 years in the process, before a heartbreaking extra-time defeat to eventual runners-up Croatia in Moscow.

programme.title: Big Hero 6
programme.desc: A lonely, orphaned computer genius forms a special bond with an inflatable robot. When a devastating event occurs in their futuristic home city, they join forces with a group of friends to form a hi-tech band of heroes who are determined to get to the bottom of the matter. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Ryan Potter, Scott Adsit and Daniel Henney.

programme.title: Maleficent
programme.desc: A fairy falls in love with an ambitious human nobleman, who betrays her in pursuit of claiming the throne. She swears to get revenge on him by placing a curse on his daughter, only to find herself developing a maternal bond with the girl. Fantasy adventure based on the story of Sleeping Beauty, starring Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley and Imelda Staunton.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies Sketchbook
programme.desc: Ronnie Corbett and Ronnie Barker reunite behind their famous desk to reminisce about their favourite comedy moments from their long-running TV shows. Again they present a selection of monologues, musical numbers and sketches, including the classic Fork Handles.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Scissor Sisters singer Ana Matronic, The Inbetweeners star Joe Thomas, former rugby union player Maggie Alphonsi and restaurant critic Jay Rayner answer questions on the specialist subjects of The Bionic Woman, George Orwell, Denise Lewis and the film musicals of Arthur Freed. Host John Humphrys then puts their general knowledge to the test before winner is announced.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: With just 24 hours to go before the wedding, Mel puts the final pieces of her plan into place, and to avoid Ray getting suspicious, she asks Shirley to distract him from coming home. As the new year festivities get under way at the Vic, Louise gets drunk and makes a scene in front of Keanu and Ray. Tiffany tries to make it up to Bernadette after standing her up for Evie.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: Premiere. Worried about her finances when her book fails to find a publisher, Patsy is given the tip that Kate Moss has left her PR company and will be looking for new representation. Things start to go awry when the plot to approach the model goes horribly wrong and Patsy and Edina find themselves vilified by the entire nation and have to flee the country. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.sub-title: The Graham Norton New Year's Eve Show
programme.desc: The comedian and broadcaster is joined by a star-studded line-up as 2018 draws to a close. Olivia Colman and co-star Nicholas Hoult discuss their new film The Favourite, which follows the battle of two cousins to be court favourites during the reign of Queen Anne in the early 18th century. Actress Keira Knightley chats about biographical movie Colette, based on the life of the French novelist, while Australian actor Guy Pearce talks about new historical drama Mary Queen of Scots, and Catherine Tate discusses her live stage show. With music from Rita Ora, who performs a medley of hits from her latest album Phoenix.

programme.title: Madness Rocks Big Ben Live
programme.desc: Part one of two. Strictly Come Dancing winner Stacey Dooley and fellow finalist Joe Sugg present from the heart of London as the countdown to 2019 begins at Central Hall in Westminster. Madness perform some of their best-loved hits from a career spanning nearly 40 years, taking a break at midnight as millions welcome the new year. With 15 UK top 10 singles under their collective belts, including One Step Beyond, Baggy Trousers, Our House and It Must Be Love, there's no shortage of Madness classics for the Nutty Boys to choose from. Plus, there's a strong chance their only UK number one, House of Fun, will make an appearance before the celebrations are over.

programme.title: New Year's Eve Fireworks
programme.desc: The people of London gather on the Thames Embankment to bid goodbye to 2018 and welcome in the new year. The traditional chimes of Big Ben herald the dawn of 2019, followed by a spectacular fireworks display that will light up the sky over the river, before the singing of Auld Lang Syne.

programme.title: Madness Rocks Big Ben Live
programme.desc: Part two of two. Suggs and the band continue the 2019 celebrations, performing more of their greatest hits from across the decades.

programme.title: Still Game
programme.desc: Festive episode of the popular Scottish comedy, in which Jack and Victor face the prospect of a gloomy Hogmanay stuck in the lift at Osprey Heights, and console themselves by recalling New Years past. As the clock ticks down to 2007, Winston is also in a reminiscent mood, and takes refuge in memories of a legendary holiday season when Craigland really knew how to throw a party. Ford Kiernan, Greg Hemphill and Paul Riley star.

programme.title: Kinky Boots
programme.desc: A man inherits a struggling shoe factory, but salvation arrives when he comes up with a plan for the business to manufacture specialist footwear for drag artists. However, the stunned workforce has to be won over, and the new designs must prove their worth at a high-profile fashion show. Comedy drama, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Joel Edgerton, Nick Frost and Linda Bassett.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather, with Louise Minchin.

programme.title: Planes: Fire & Rescue
programme.desc: A racing plane suffers damage to his engine, and realises he can never compete again. He starts a new career as a member of a firefighting squadron, which proves even more dangerous than he expected when the aircraft have to deal with a massive forest blaze. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Dane Cook and Ed Harris.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: An alien on the run from his own people arrives on Earth and embarks on an adventure with a daring young woman. It turns out to be a life-changing trip during which they begin to understand the true meaning of the word home. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Jim Parsons, Rihanna, Steve Martin and Jennifer Lopez.

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates footage of a tiger in the dense jungles of India's Bandhavgarh Reserve. The big cat has four newborn cubs to protect and is the dominant presence in a prime hunting territory. However, rival tigers are determined to take over, and one of her own previous offspring becomes one of the most persistent enemies the mother and her cubs face.

programme.title: The Archbishop of Canterbury's New Year Message
programme.desc: The Most Rev Justin Welby reflects on the ways communities can be sources of hope in difficult times and how he has been inspired by the community he established at his London home, Lambeth Palace.

programme.title: The Railway Children
programme.desc: Three Edwardian children are forced to leave their comfortable middle-class London home and move to the wilds of Yorkshire after their father is wrongfully imprisoned for treason. Family drama adapted from E Nesbit's story, starring Jenny Agutter, Sally Thomsett, Gary Warren, Dinah Sheridan, Bernard Cribbins, William Mervyn and Iain Cuthbertson.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.sub-title: Planet Earth II: A World of Wonder
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities.

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungle, leading a carefree life with his friends, a laidback bear and a wise panther. The return of a ferocious tiger who hates humans places the youngster's life in danger, and his friends must persuade him to return to the safety of his own people. Disney animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, with the voices of Phil Harris and George Sanders.

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Premiere. Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Viewers have had to wait a little longer for their festive fix of Doctor Who this time around, with the traditional Christmas Day slot moved back a week. As the new year begins, a terrifying evil is stirring from across the centuries of Earth's history. As the Doctor, Ryan, Graham and Yaz return home, will they be able to overcome the threat to planet Earth? Starring Jodie Whittaker, Tosin Cole, Bradley Walsh and Mandip Gill.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents gather for Mel and Ray's wedding, unaware the bride has only one thing on her mind - revenge. What exactly does she have planned and will it go off without a hitch? As the day gets under way, things quickly spiral out of control, leading to an explosive series of events. Meanwhile, Whitney tells Halfway she might be pregnant, but is taken aback by his reaction.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: New series. When a series of monstrous and seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious and public, DCI John Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a complex tangle of leads and misdirection that seems designed to protect an untouchable corruption. But, even as the case brings him closer than ever to the true face of evil, a reluctant Luther is forced to confront the unburied demons of his own recent past. Idris Elba stars, with Wunmi Mosaku and Patrick Malahide. Continues tomorrow.

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.sub-title: Mrs Brown's Boys New Year Special: Mammy's Motel
programme.desc: The doting mother offers Winnie and Sharon a place to stay when the pipes in their house burst, but Agnes and Cathy soon discover that living with best friends isn't as much fun as they thought it would be. As if that wasn't enough for Agnes to cope with, she is asked by Father Damian to do a eulogy for a neighbour she never knew and there's Bono's 13th birthday party to host as well.

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather, presented by Charlie Stayt and Louise Minchin.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Winter Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson presents from Anglesey for the week as he and the Countryfile team return to present more stories that highlight the impact of winter on the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team visit a flat in Liverpool, an old church in Denholme, West Yorkshire, and a ground-floor flat in East Croydon, London.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: New series. Adam Robinson and his family spend a week experiencing what life could be like in Australia, but his wife Kati is not convinced it would be the best move for them all.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A customer thrown out of a bar takes revenge by driving into a group of locals outside, and the owner of a restaurant catches a group planning to leave without paying.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Gary Pe help two teams hunt for items at the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home show, while Eric Knowles explores the Japanese concept of wabi-sabi in pottery.(n)

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: A girl raised in misery by her cruel aunt grows up to become a governess, and accepts work at the estate of a mysterious landowner. Despite being disturbed by strange goings-on in the house, she falls in love with her brooding employer, only to discover he is concealing a terrible secret. Period drama based on Charlotte Bronte's novel, starring Mia Wasikowska, Michael Fassbender, Jamie Bell and Judi Dench.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Actresses Jo Joyner and Sunetra Sarker hit the antiques trail around shops and the occasional farm in Somerset and Devon, assisted by Phil Serrell and James Braxton.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys ushers in another quartet to the black chair to be put to the test on their chosen specialist subjects. Here, the Strictly professional Neil Jones takes on the films of Charlie Chaplin, the musician and presenter YolanDa Brown is quizzed on singer Marvin Gaye, the actor Paul Higgins recalls the Watergate scandal and newsreader Holly Hamilton tackles footballer George Best. The second round sees them tackling general knowledge questions in a bid to carry off the commemorative trophy.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Cycling legend Chris Hoy, England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, racing driver Max Chilton and former Arsenal and Everton striker Kevin Campbell join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On a new year road trip to compete for funding worth millions of pounds, Jac, Ric and Sacha confront some old enemies. Meanwhile, Serena's worst fears are realised when a loved one is brought in for emergency surgery.(n)

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective must confront a demon from his past, as both the police and Cornelius converge on his home. With Halliday convinced that the body in the morgue isn't their killer, can Luther put his own troubles to one side and find the true murderer before he strikes again? Thriller, starring Idris Elba, Ruth Wilson and Dermot Crowley. Continues tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the first Premier League games of 2019, including Newcastle United v Manchester United at St James' Park and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace at Molineux. The reverse fixture between the Magpies and Red Devils in October was one of the games of the season so far, with Newcastle taking an early 2-0 lead, which they held onto until the 70th minute, when Juan Mata began a remarkable fightback for Jose Mourinho's side. Further goals from Anthony Martial and Alexis Sanchez clinched a dramatic 3-2 win, which some claim saved Mourinho's job. Plus, action from Arsenal v Fulham at the Emirates Stadium, Bournemouth v Watford at the Vitality Stadium, Cardiff City v Tottenham Hotspur at the Cardiff City Stadium, Chelsea v Southampton at Stamford Bridge, Everton v Leicester City at Goodison Park, Huddersfield Town v Burnley at the John Smith's Stadium and West Ham United v Brighton & Hove Albion at London Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Lily Allen, Noddy Holder, Sian Gibson and James Acaster to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.

As if that wasn't enough for Agnes to cope with, she is asked by Father Damian to do a eulogy for a neighbour she never knew and there's Bono's 13th birthday party to host as well.

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather, presented by Charlie Stayt and Louise Minchin.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Winter Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson presents from Anglesey for the week as he and the Countryfile team return to present more stories that highlight the impact of winter on the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team visit a flat in Liverpool, an old church in Denholme, West Yorkshire, and a ground-floor flat in East Croydon, London.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: New series. Adam Robinson and his family spend a week experiencing what life could be like in Australia, but his wife Kati is not convinced it would be the best move for them all.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A customer thrown out of a bar takes revenge by driving into a group of locals outside, and the owner of a restaurant catches a group planning to leave without paying.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Gary Pe help two teams hunt for items at the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home show, while Eric Knowles explores the Japanese concept of wabi-sabi in pottery.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.(n)

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: A girl raised in misery by her cruel aunt grows up to become a governess, and accepts work at the estate of a mysterious landowner. Despite being disturbed by strange goings-on in the house, she falls in love with her brooding employer, only to discover he is concealing a terrible secret. Period drama based on Charlotte Bronte's novel, starring Mia Wasikowska, Michael Fassbender, Jamie Bell and Judi Dench.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Actresses Jo Joyner and Sunetra Sarker hit the antiques trail around shops and the occasional farm in Somerset and Devon, assisted by Phil Serrell and James Braxton.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys ushers in another quartet to the black chair to be put to the test on their chosen specialist subjects. Here, the Strictly professional Neil Jones takes on the films of Charlie Chaplin, the musician and presenter YolanDa Brown is quizzed on singer Marvin Gaye, the actor Paul Higgins recalls the Watergate scandal and newsreader Holly Hamilton tackles footballer George Best. The second round sees them tackling general knowledge questions in a bid to carry off the commemorative trophy.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Cycling legend Chris Hoy, England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, racing driver Max Chilton and former Arsenal and Everton striker Kevin Campbell join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On a new year road trip to compete for funding worth millions of pounds, Jac, Ric and Sacha confront some old enemies. Meanwhile, Serena's worst fears are realised when a loved one is brought in for emergency surgery.(n)

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective must confront a demon from his past, as both the police and Cornelius converge on his home. With Halliday convinced that the body in the morgue isn't their killer, can Luther put his own troubles to one side and find the true murderer before he strikes again? Thriller, starring Idris Elba, Ruth Wilson and Dermot Crowley. Continues tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the first Premier League games of 2019, including Newcastle United v Manchester United at St James' Park and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace at Molineux. The reverse fixture between the Magpies and Red Devils in October was one of the games of the season so far, with Newcastle taking an early 2-0 lead, which they held onto until the 70th minute, when Juan Mata began a remarkable fightback for Jose Mourinho's side. Further goals from Anthony Martial and Alexis Sanchez clinched a dramatic 3-2 win, which some claim saved Mourinho's job. Plus, action from Arsenal v Fulham at the Emirates Stadium, Bournemouth v Watford at the Vitality Stadium, Cardiff City v Tottenham Hotspur at the Cardiff City Stadium, Chelsea v Southampton at Stamford Bridge, Everton v Leicester City at Goodison Park, Huddersfield Town v Burnley at the John Smith's Stadium and West Ham United v Brighton & Hove Albion at London Stadium.(n)

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: A divorced father's rare weekend with his two estranged children descends into horror when alien war machines rise from beneath Earth and begin to systematically destroy every human being in their path - leaving the man with the dangerous task of getting his kids to safety. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi thriller, based on HG Wells' novel, with Tom Cruise, Dakota Fanning, Justin Chatwin, Miranda Otto and Tim Robbins.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.

programme.title: Planes
programme.desc: A crop duster longs to be a racing plane, but is hamstrung by a fear of heights. With the aid of a veteran flyer, he learns to conquer his phobia and compete against some of the world's greatest flyers in a round-the-world race. Animated adventure spin-off from Pixar's Cars, with the voices of Dane Cook, Teri Hatcher and Stacy Keach.

programme.title: The Croods
programme.desc: Prehistoric family the Croods find themselves with nowhere to live when their cave is destroyed. They embark on a dangerous trek through an unstable landscape overrun with all manner of dangerous predators in search of a new home, but their domestic squabbles prove as much of an obstacle as the wildlife. Animated comedy, with the voices of Nicolas Cage and Ryan Reynolds.

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates footage of painted wolves on the banks of the Zambezi river, as an ageing matriarch faces a challenge for supremacy from her own daughter, who has grown to lead a pack of her own, which now needs to expand into new territory. With human-occupied land penning them in, the two packs are forced to fight for the little resources available.

programme.title: Prince, Son and Heir: Charles at 70
programme.desc: Observational documentary following Prince Charles over the past 12 months, being shown to mark his 70th birthday on November 14. Film-maker John Bridcut follows the prince at work and behind the scenes and speaks to those who know him best - the Duchess of Cornwall and Princes William and Harry - as he builds an intimate portrait of the longest-serving heir to the throne.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup 2018 Highlights
programme.desc: A look back at the tournament in Russia, which saw France lift the famous trophy and become two-time winners, while Gareth Southgate's England reached the semi-finals for the first time since Italia '90. The Three Lions captured the hearts of the nation during their run to the last four, finally winning a penalty shootout for the first time in 22 years in the process, before a heartbreaking extra-time defeat to eventual runners-up Croatia in Moscow.

programme.title: Big Hero 6
programme.desc: A lonely, orphaned computer genius forms a special bond with an inflatable robot. When a devastating event occurs in their futuristic home city, they join forces with a group of friends to form a hi-tech band of heroes who are determined to get to the bottom of the matter. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Ryan Potter, Scott Adsit and Daniel Henney.

programme.title: Maleficent
programme.desc: A fairy falls in love with an ambitious human nobleman, who betrays her in pursuit of claiming the throne. She swears to get revenge on him by placing a curse on his daughter, only to find herself developing a maternal bond with the girl. Fantasy adventure based on the story of Sleeping Beauty, starring Angelina Jolie, Elle Fanning, Sharlto Copley and Imelda Staunton.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: Bill Paterson narrates highlights of the event held on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle, with the RAF College Band taking centre stage as this year's home service. Others featured include the Combined Bands of the Royal Cavalry of the Sultanate of Oman, the United States Air Force Honor Guard Drill Team, the Royal Marines Band Plymouth, the Band of the Royal Regiment of Scotland, the Central Band of the Czech Armed Forces and the Banda Monumental de Mexico, the Tattoo Dance Company and the Top Secret Drum Corps.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: With just 24 hours to go before the wedding, Mel puts the final pieces of her plan into place, and to avoid Ray getting suspicious, she asks Shirley to distract him from coming home. As the new year festivities get under way at the Vic, Louise gets drunk and makes a scene in front of Keanu and Ray. Tiffany tries to make it up to Bernadette after standing her up for Evie.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Scissor Sisters singer Ana Matronic, The Inbetweeners star Joe Thomas, former rugby union player Maggie Alphonsi and restaurant critic Jay Rayner answer questions on the specialist subjects of The Bionic Woman, George Orwell, Denise Lewis and the film musicals of Arthur Freed. Host John Humphrys then puts their general knowledge to the test before winner is announced.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?

programme.title: Hogmanay Live
programme.desc: Jackie Bird chats to some of guests who will be joining her later in the evening at Glasgow's Old Fruitmarket to see the New Year in.

programme.title: Gary Goes to Hollywood
programme.desc: Tank commander and showbiz personality Gary McLintoch heads to America to meet fellow Scots including Karen Gillan and Ross King, who have left their native country behind for the bright lights of Los Angeles. He explores the ups and downs of life in Tinseltown, what they love about their new home, what they miss about Scotland and the sacrifices they have made to create a life in America. Comedy, starring Greg McHugh.

programme.title: Only an Excuse
programme.desc: Jonathan Watson and the gang return with their now-traditional New Year offering, featuring sketches, spoofs, gags and comic characters putting the boot into the headlines that have dominated Scottish football and life over the past 12 months.

programme.title: Hogmanay Live
programme.desc: Jackie Bird presents music and comedy to see in 2019 from the Old Fruitmarket in Glasgow, with performances by Alesha Dixon, Karine Polwart and Aly Bain and Phil Cunningham. Comedian Des Clarke looks back over 2018 and the Rev IM Jolly is back on TV screens for one night only as Gregor Fisher pays tribute to 40 years of Rikki Fulton's Scotch and Wry. Plus, Bryan Burnett is at the heart of Edinburgh's celebrations with music by Franz Ferdinand and the spectacular midnight fireworks.

programme.title: Still Game
programme.desc: Festive episode of the popular Scottish comedy, in which Jack and Victor face the prospect of a gloomy Hogmanay stuck in the lift at Osprey Heights, and console themselves by recalling New Years past. As the clock ticks down to 2007, Winston is also in a reminiscent mood, and takes refuge in memories of a legendary holiday season when Craigland really knew how to throw a party. Ford Kiernan, Greg Hemphill and Paul Riley star.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.sub-title: The Graham Norton New Year's Eve Show
programme.desc: The comedian and broadcaster is joined by a star-studded line-up as 2018 draws to a close. Olivia Colman and co-star Nicholas Hoult discuss their new film The Favourite, which follows the battle of two cousins to be court favourites during the reign of Queen Anne in the early 18th century. Actress Keira Knightley chats about biographical movie Colette, based on the life of the French novelist, while Australian actor Guy Pearce talks about new historical drama Mary Queen of Scots, and Catherine Tate discusses her live stage show. With music from Rita Ora, who performs a medley of hits from her latest album Phoenix.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: Premiere. Worried about her finances when her book fails to find a publisher, Patsy is given the tip that Kate Moss has left her PR company and will be looking for new representation. Things start to go awry when the plot to approach the model goes horribly wrong and Patsy and Edina find themselves vilified by the entire nation and have to flee the country. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather, with Louise Minchin.

programme.title: Planes: Fire & Rescue
programme.desc: A racing plane suffers damage to his engine, and realises he can never compete again. He starts a new career as a member of a firefighting squadron, which proves even more dangerous than he expected when the aircraft have to deal with a massive forest blaze. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Dane Cook and Ed Harris.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: An alien on the run from his own people arrives on Earth and embarks on an adventure with a daring young woman. It turns out to be a life-changing trip during which they begin to understand the true meaning of the word home. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Jim Parsons, Rihanna, Steve Martin and Jennifer Lopez.

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates footage of a tiger in the dense jungles of India's Bandhavgarh Reserve. The big cat has four newborn cubs to protect and is the dominant presence in a prime hunting territory. However, rival tigers are determined to take over, and one of her own previous offspring becomes one of the most persistent enemies the mother and her cubs face.

programme.title: Resolutions
programme.desc: Chief executive of Street Soccer David Duke, who has experienced homelessness, talks about three things that give opportunity and hope - relationships, stability, and purpose.

programme.title: The Railway Children
programme.desc: Three Edwardian children are forced to leave their comfortable middle-class London home and move to the wilds of Yorkshire after their father is wrongfully imprisoned for treason. Family drama adapted from E Nesbit's story, starring Jenny Agutter, Sally Thomsett, Gary Warren, Dinah Sheridan, Bernard Cribbins, William Mervyn and Iain Cuthbertson.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.sub-title: Planet Earth II: A World of Wonder
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities.

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungle, leading a carefree life with his friends, a laidback bear and a wise panther. The return of a ferocious tiger who hates humans places the youngster's life in danger, and his friends must persuade him to return to the safety of his own people. Disney animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, with the voices of Phil Harris and George Sanders.

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Premiere. Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Viewers have had to wait a little longer for their festive fix of Doctor Who this time around, with the traditional Christmas Day slot moved back a week. As the new year begins, a terrifying evil is stirring from across the centuries of Earth's history. As the Doctor, Ryan, Graham and Yaz return home, will they be able to overcome the threat to planet Earth? Starring Jodie Whittaker, Tosin Cole, Bradley Walsh and Mandip Gill.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents gather for Mel and Ray's wedding, unaware the bride has only one thing on her mind - revenge. What exactly does she have planned and will it go off without a hitch? As the day gets under way, things quickly spiral out of control, leading to an explosive series of events. Meanwhile, Whitney tells Halfway she might be pregnant, but is taken aback by his reaction.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: New series. When a series of monstrous and seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious and public, DCI John Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a complex tangle of leads and misdirection that seems designed to protect an untouchable corruption. But, even as the case brings him closer than ever to the true face of evil, a reluctant Luther is forced to confront the unburied demons of his own recent past. Idris Elba stars, with Wunmi Mosaku and Patrick Malahide. Continues tomorrow.

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.sub-title: Mrs Brown's Boys New Year Special: Mammy's Motel

As if that wasn't enough for Agnes to cope with, she is asked by Father Damian to do a eulogy for a neighbour she never knew and there's Bono's 13th birthday party to host as well.

The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.desc: Ruby defends her gran's honour, and backed into a corner, Stevie is forced to make a decision. Meanwhile, Lou is drawn to protect a friend and JP throws a New Year's party of epic proportions.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies Sketchbook
programme.desc: Ronnie Corbett and Ronnie Barker reunite behind their famous desk to reminisce about their favourite comedy moments from their long-running TV shows. Again they present a selection of monologues, musical numbers and sketches, including the classic Fork Handles.
