Last in the series.

programme.title: Top of the Shop with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The seven heat winners are up against each other in the grand final, as they compete for the title of best up and coming artisan. First, they are tasked to supply a shop for a month, but they will not be there themselves to tempt customers to buy. Then, they return to the shop for one last farmers' market for the locals, before judges scrutinise the finalists' marketing and products one final time. Last in the series.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Banquet
programme.desc: Arriving at London's St Bartholomew's Hospital, the contenders are shown the location for the banquet - the almost 300 year-old Great Hall. However, there's a shock in store as Oliver Peyton reveals that it's the guests who will be voting to elect an overall Champion of Champions. The pressure intensifies as the guests arrive, including NHS Heroes from across the country, judges who helped select the menu and banquet host Jenny Agutter, star of Call the Midwife. The evening reaches a climax as one chef is crowned Champions of Champions.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The peregrine falcon is the fastest animal on earth, able to reach speeds of more than 200mph. But what does it take to be a high-speed record-breaker? This documentary follows a young family of falcons as they grow up in Chicago. It also meets renowned bird handler Lloyd Buck as he puts his peregrines to the test, using state-of-the-art technology. He also trains one young peregrine for the ultimate challenge of speed and agility, racing an Olympic skier in the Swiss Alps.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a journey from Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh to Kolkata in West Bengal, Michael Portillo charts a course through India's history from the days of The East India Company to the dawn of independence. In Lucknow, he tastes the famous kebabs, stops off at Bodh Gaya, where he meditates on its Buddhist heritage, and In Kolkata, he glimpses colonial Calcutta in the grand Great Eastern Hotel. Last in the series.

programme.title: Death on the Nile
programme.desc: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder on board a paddle steamer in Egypt. The victim was an unpopular heiress, whose outspoken manner put her at odds with most of her fellow passengers during their cruise on the Nile. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Peter Ustinov, Bette Davis, Maggie Smith, George Kennedy, Mia Farrow, Jane Birkin, Olivia Hussey, Angela Lansbury and David Niven.

programme.title: Evil Under the Sun
programme.desc: Hercule Poirot braves the heat and sand to investigate the murder of a glamorous stage star on an idyllic Adriatic holiday island. It becomes clear many people had reason to want the temperamental actress dead and the Belgian sleuth is soon hard at work figuring out which of her enemies eventually managed to kill her. Mystery, with Peter Ustinov, Diana Rigg, James Mason, Maggie Smith and Jane Birkin.

programme.title: Mary Berry's Country House at Christmas
programme.desc: Mary Berry visits Harewood House in West Yorkshire as staff prepare the house for the Christmas festivities, and discovers how country houses like this celebrate the season on a grand scale. She also meets some of the volunteers that are the life and soul of the country house, and hears their stories as they bake traditional gingerbread together. Later, she heads out into Harewood's spectacular grounds and gathers winter foliage for her own seasonal decorations before attending a glittering party for the staff and volunteers, who gather together to preview the house's astounding decorations.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the UK's largest sports shoe factory to see how 3,500 pairs of trainers are made every day, before meeting the man who comes up with the latest designs. Cherry Healey gets hands-on in a tannery, helping to process thousands of rawhides into finished leather for the nation's shoes, and finds out how a ballet company painstakingly create 250,000 ballet shoes per year. Ruth Goodman reveals how, when the sewing machine was first introduced into shoe factories in the mid-19th century, traditional shoemakers went on strike to rebel against joining a restrictive production line.

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: University Challenge Christmas 2018: Sheffield v Manchester
programme.desc: Teams made up of distinguished graduates of Sheffield and Manchester compete to secure a place in the semi-finals. Among those facing Jeremy Paxman's questions are politician David Blunkett and political commentator Paul Mason for Sheffield, with journalist David Aaronovitch and Watchdog presenter Matt Allwright representing Manchester.

programme.title: Ethel & Ernest
programme.desc: Animated drama based on Raymond Briggs' graphic novel following the lives of his parents, from their chance meeting in 1928 through the next 40 years of their marriage, an era marked by sweeping social changes from the hardships of the Great Depression and the Second World War to the cultural transformation of the 1960s. With the voices of Jim Broadbent, Brenda Blethyn and Luke Treadaway as Raymond Briggs himself.

programme.title: Raymond Briggs: Snowmen, Bogeymen & Milkmen
programme.desc: Profile of the author and illustrator, marking the 40th anniversary of the original publication of The Snowman. The programme explores Briggs' other work, including Fungus the Bogeyman, Father Christmas, When the Wind Blows and Ethel & Ernest, and includes animated interludes with artwork by Chris Riddell. Interviews with Briggs and contributions from Andy Serkis, Nick Park, Steve Bell and Posy Simmonds feature throughout. Narrated by Brenda Blethyn.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended version of the quiz in which Jason Manford, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh join regular participant Alan Davies to vie for points awarded for interesting - if not always correct - answers. In a Christmas-themed edition, the panellists learn the best way to wrap an awkwardly shaped present and get wine stains out of a carpet.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Live at the Apollo Christmas Special
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts the fourth annual Christmas special, recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. Taking to the stage for tonight's festive line-up are Ahir Shah and Laura Lexx, two performers making their Live at the Apollo debuts following successful shows at this year's Edinburgh Fringe, while the bill is completed by Gary Delaney.

programme.title: Jools' Annual Hootenanny
programme.desc: Jools Holland presents the 26th edition of his annual New Year's Eve party, with Canadian singer Michael Buble performing classic songs in a big band style from his latest album Love - including his take on Elvis Presley's Such a Night. Also appearing are Jess Glynne, Nile Rodgers and Chic, George Ezra, Marc Almond, Rudimental, Yola, the Record Company, Junior Giscombe, Hot 8 Brass Band and Ruby Turner, while the Pipes & Drums of the 1st Battalion Scots Guards will be on hand at midnight to play in the new year.

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Jo Whiley and Mark Radcliffe introduce highlights from the festival at Worthy Farm in Somerset, where Radiohead, Foo Fighters and Ed Sheeran were the headliners, including a reminder of some of the big performances, stories and moments from the weekend's events.

programme.title: Reading Festival 2018: The Best Bits
programme.desc: Huw Stephens presents highlights of performances at the festival, where the Main Stage headliners were Fall Out Boy, Kendrick Lamar and Kings of Leon.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Zog
programme.desc: Keen but accident-prone dragon Zog gets himself into mischief while learning how to fly, roar, breathe fire and fight knights in his first four years at Dragon School. Each year he meets a kindly young girl who patches up his bumps and bruises, but can she help him with his trickiest challenge yet? It's year five and he has to capture a princess. Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler's book, featuring the voices of Lenny Henry, Tracey Ullman, Hugh Skinner, Patsy Ferran and Kit Harington.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Puerto Rico: Island of Enchantment - Natural World
programme.desc: After being colonised by humans, Puerto Rico's rich natural resources were rapidly exploited for agriculture, industry and urban development. This documentary follows a conservation team fighting to save the most endangered creatures from extinction after they have been pushed to the edge of existence by human encroachment. David Attenborough narrates.

programme.title: An American in Paris: The Musical
programme.desc: George and Ira Gershwin's Tony award-winning Broadway musical, inspired by the 1951 Oscar-winner. It tells of Jerry Mulligan, a US GI trying to make it as a painter, and Lise, the beautiful young dancer who catches his eye. Starring Robert Fairchild, Leanne Cope and Haydn Oakley.

programme.title: New Year's Day Concert Live from Vienna 2019
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny introduces the traditional concert from the Golden Hall of Vienna's Musikverein. German conductor Christian Thielemann will be leading the concert for the first time, directing the Vienna Philharmonic in a performance of polkas, waltzes and gallops by the Strauss family and their contemporaries, culminating in the traditional renditions of By the Beautiful Blue Danube and the Radetzky March.

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores unusual and unexplained natural events that occur around the world during winter, enlisting the aid of leading scientists to uncover why these strange events happen. The programme examines unusual weather conditions, including tornadoes made of snow, and animals behaving in unexpected ways, from snowboarding crows to penguins attempting death-defying feats.

programme.title: Monkey Kingdom
programme.desc: Premiere. Documentary following a newborn monkey and its mother as they struggle to survive within the competitive social hierarchy of the Temple Troop, a group of simians who live in ancient ruins found deep in the jungles of Sri Lanka. Narrated by Tina Fey.

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh.

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: Premiere. An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.

programme.title: Resolutions
programme.desc: Chief executive of Street Soccer David Duke, who has experienced homelessness, talks about three things that give opportunity and hope - relationships, stability, and purpose.

programme.title: The Snow Wolf: A Winter's Tale
programme.desc: Dramatised natural history film, following an alpha female wolf in the Dolomite mountains. A tragic sequence of events forces the wolf to flee her pack while pregnant in search of new territory. Along the way, she gives birth to six cubs, which she strives to protect from humans and predators as she journeys into the Alps in search of a new home.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell presents the quiz show in which the Birdwatchers take on the Brews. They attempt to make connections between things that at first do not appear to be linked, such as consonants, drugs, Brexit and tap water.

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: University Challenge Christmas 2018: Edinburgh University v LSE
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as teams made up of distinguished graduates of Edinburgh University and the London School of Economics compete to secure a place in the semi-finals. Edinburgh is represented by the likes of MP Joanna Cherry and comedian Mitch Benn, while the LSE team includes critic Ekow Eshun and writer Maya Jaggi.

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following three of the world's largest rivers, beginning with the Amazon, uncovering some of the latest discoveries, including the 'Blue Lagoon' which is home to a newly discovered species of cichlid. The programme also explores some of the Amazon's flooded forests, home to an array of unusual animals, and cameras follow giant river otters on a fishing foray on the rocky terraces of the Cristalino river.

programme.title: In Sight of Home: The Iolaire
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the maritime disaster, the people of Lewis tell their story to the rest of the nation through the words and testimonies of the islanders. On 1 January 1919, having survived the First World War, in excess of 250 naval men were returning home to celebrate their first new year of peace. But in the blackest of nights, in a rising gale, HMY Iolaire sank within yards of the Lewis coast, claiming the lives of more than 200 people.

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: Premiere. A frontiersman leading a hunting party through the wilderness is mauled by a bear, and a travelling companion who pledged to stay with him until help comes kills his son and leaves him for dead. Against all odds, the wounded man survives his injuries and embarks on a gruelling quest for revenge that takes him through a harsh landscape. Western, starring an Oscar-winning Leonardo DiCaprio, with Tom Hardy and Domhnall Gleeson.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Ant-Man
programme.desc: Premiere. A thief attempting to go straight is recruited by a scientist who provides him with a suit that gives him the power to shrink. He must use his new skills to carry out a special mission - helping the inventor to steal back his miniaturisation technology from a ruthless businessman who intends to turn it into a deadly weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Doctor
programme.desc: Michael Mosley finds out whether singing can boost feel-good chemicals in the brain, Dr Zoe Williams discovers why music could help people with dementia, and Dr Alain Gregoire looks at some new research showing the surprising benefits of group singing for mothers with post-natal depression. Plus, Gabriel Weston investigates whether detoxing is a con.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Nadeem Islam visits Rome in Italy to discover what attraction are there for deaf people to enjoy, starting with a guided scooter tour. With voiceover.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central region chefs try to impress the judging panel of Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort, who are joined by joined by Dan Smith, a paramedic for the North West Manchester Ambulance Service who was one of the first at the scene of the Manchester Arena bombing in May 2017.(n)

programme.title: Swallows and Amazons
programme.desc: Four youngsters go boating while on holiday in the Lake District where they encounter two more children with a boat of their own, and a rivalry develops over a series of escapades. Family adventure, based on Arthur Ransome's classic novel, starring Virginia McKenna, Ronald Fraser, Sophie Neville and Simon West.(n)

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Kangaroo Dundee & Other Animals - Part One: Natural World
programme.desc: The natural history documentary follows the work of tough Australian Chris `Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to rescuing and raising orphaned kangaroos in the outback near Alice Springs. This two-part film follows Brolga as he expands operations by opening his doors to a whole new bunch of animals, including a trio of camels, a southern hairy-nosed wombat and three emu chicks, as well as building a wildlife hospital.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Kangaroo Dundee & Other Animals - Part Two: Natural World
programme.desc: The continued work of Australian naturalist Chris `Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to raising kangaroos and is now opening his doors to new animals. However, it is not proving easy. The emu chicks are wreaking havoc, the camels are rapidly outgrowing their enclosure and the wombat is proving quite a handful. To help, Brolga is moving some of them to his 80-acre sanctuary - but after a clash with Roger the kangaroo, he has been left on crutches, and all his plans are on hold.(n)

programme.title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy has a day where everything seems to go wrong, but gets no sympathy from his family. He becomes convinced that bad things only ever happen to him, but then his parents, his brother and his sister all suffer terrible days of their own. Family comedy based on Judith Viorst's series of children's books, starring Ed Oxenbould, Steve Carell and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A collection of interesting and previously unseen finds, with visits to St Albans, Wolverhampton Art Gallery, the Platform in Morecambe and Grimsby Minster. Paul Martin presents.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.(n)

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman hosts the first semi-final as teams of distinguished graduates compete on behalf of their former universities in the academic quiz's festive edition.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Fresh Start
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge challenges eight families to ditch convenience food and cook from scratch at home, as he believes it will make them fitter, happier and healthier. In the opening episode, Tom meets the eight volunteer families for the first time, and introduces them to the plan he wants them to follow for the next 12 weeks. The first step of his plan is to simply get the families cooking more, and he presents all the families with a starter pack of easy recipes and the ingredients for sausage and mash. Later, Tom prepares two dishes to inspire the group, a tomato salad packed with Mediterranean flavours, and a chicken and peanut stirfry.(n)

programme.title: The Twinstitute
programme.desc: New series. Doctors Chris and Xand van Tulleken put health theories to the test with the help of pairs of identical twins, revealing ways we can live a healthier life. Thanks to their matching DNA, identical twins are the perfect candidates for scientific comparison, so Chris and Xand use this principle to put contrasting health theories to the test. In the first episode, the doctors pit diet against exercise, and analyse the results as they challenge twins to go head-to-head with contrasting regimes to see who loses the most weight.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Following the astonishing wildlife, landscapes and people of the world's longest river, the Nile, beginning in the tropical mountain range of the Rwenzoris, home to one of the world's strangest birds, the shoebill stork. Then, cameras follow the Nile's journey as it travels through the wild Savannah lands of Uganda, before reaching the Ethiopian highlands where it receives an injection of water far to the East.(n)

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Kate Williams, Angela Scanlon and Griff Rhys Jones join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Steph McGovern and the Dragons catch up with memorable contestants from the last three series to see how their businesses have developed since their appearance on the show. Among those featured are Amy Wordsworth, who famously fainted while making her pitch. Steph and Deborah Meaden catch up with her just as she receives news that could either make or break her business. Elsewhere, a knitting handicraft brand celebrates a defining moment and Peter Jones becomes the face of a tennis events company.(n)

programme.title: NFL This Week
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora to look back at the final round of regular-season fixtures. The trio also preview the play-offs.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.

programme.title: Heimat Home from Home: Chronicle of a Vision
programme.sub-title: Heimat Home from Home: Chronicle of a Vision - Part Two
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part prequel to the drama about three families. In 1883, a blacksmith's son dreams of a new life, while his brother returns from military service. In German.

programme.title: Christmas at St Paul's
programme.desc: Documentary following preparations for the festive season at the famous London cathedral, featuring unprecedented behind-the-scenes access to the Christmas countdown. With more than 45,000 visitors attending 17 services and events, the pressure is on for the team gearing up for the busiest time of the year. Celebrities including Michael Palin perform at the most glamorous event in the cathedral's calendar, while three huge Christmas trees - donated by the Queen and weighing more than a ton - are hauled into place. There's also a look at the huge logistical challenge that goes into supplying enough consecrated wine and wafers for the thousands of people who attend Midnight Mass.

programme.title: My Faith and Me
programme.sub-title: My Faith and Me: Gavin Peacock
programme.desc: The former footballer revisits key locations from his spiritual life, and discusses how he has started a new career as an evangelical church minister in Canada.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.sub-title: The Pope and I - Our Lives
programme.desc: Pope Francis will become the second pontiff to visit Ireland when he arrives at the end of August and for tens of thousands of Northern Irish Catholics it will be a once-in-a-lifetime chance to see and hear the Holy Father in person. Ahead of his visit, this programme explores people's relationship with the papacy, and how it has changed over the decades.

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The families tackle a Catalan fish stew in a `Taste It Now Make It' challenge. They are then given a whole salmon and tasked with creating a selection of dishes that will use as much of the fish as possible. The families are pushed to their limits as they vie to stay in the competition. Presented by Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks.

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: As mid-summer arrives, David and Sandra have to shear the sheep and start to train a month-old foal. Elsewhere, dairy farmers Stuart and Aylett Roan take a break from the cows to prepare for piglets, Robin and Penny's hay harvest is threatened by the weather, and Stevie reveals big plans for the future of his buffalo business. Last in the series.

programme.title: Top of the Shop with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The seven heat winners are up against each other in the grand final, as they compete for the title of best up and coming artisan. First, they are tasked to supply a shop for a month, but they will not be there themselves to tempt customers to buy. Then, they return to the shop for one last farmers' market for the locals, before judges scrutinise the finalists' marketing and products one final time. Last in the series.

programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Banquet

The evening reaches a climax as one chef is crowned Champions of Champions.

Agatha Christie mystery, starring Peter Ustinov, Bette Davis, Maggie Smith, George Kennedy, Mia Farrow, Jane Birkin, Olivia Hussey, Angela Lansbury and David Niven.

Mystery, with Peter Ustinov, Diana Rigg, James Mason, Maggie Smith and Jane Birkin.

Later, she heads out into Harewood's spectacular grounds and gathers winter foliage for her own seasonal decorations before attending a glittering party for the staff and volunteers, who gather together to preview the house's astounding decorations.

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Over the past four weeks, 18 volunteers have experienced what life was like for the factory girls of the south Wales valleys in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s. Now some of the women who lived through it for real talk about their lives, speaking of terrifying bosses, everyday sexism, union battles, camaraderie and of lifelong friendships forged on the production line. Presented by Alex Jones, who also reveals how the factory was brought back to life using these women's stories as inspiration. Last in the series.

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: University Challenge Christmas 2018: Sheffield v Manchester
programme.desc: Teams made up of distinguished graduates of Sheffield and Manchester compete to secure a place in the semi-finals. Among those facing Jeremy Paxman's questions are politician David Blunkett and political commentator Paul Mason for Sheffield, with journalist David Aaronovitch and Watchdog presenter Matt Allwright representing Manchester.

programme.title: Zog
programme.desc: Keen but accident-prone dragon Zog gets himself into mischief while learning how to fly, roar, breathe fire and fight knights in his first four years at Dragon School. Each year he meets a kindly young girl who patches up his bumps and bruises, but can she help him with his trickiest challenge yet? It's year five and he has to capture a princess. Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler's book, featuring the voices of Lenny Henry, Tracey Ullman, Hugh Skinner, Patsy Ferran and Kit Harington.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Puerto Rico: Island of Enchantment - Natural World
programme.desc: After being colonised by humans, Puerto Rico's rich natural resources were rapidly exploited for agriculture, industry and urban development. This documentary follows a conservation team fighting to save the most endangered creatures from extinction after they have been pushed to the edge of existence by human encroachment. David Attenborough narrates.

programme.title: An American in Paris: The Musical
programme.desc: George and Ira Gershwin's Tony award-winning Broadway musical, inspired by the 1951 Oscar-winner. It tells of Jerry Mulligan, a US GI trying to make it as a painter, and Lise, the beautiful young dancer who catches his eye. Starring Robert Fairchild, Leanne Cope and Haydn Oakley.

programme.title: New Year's Day Concert Live from Vienna 2019
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny introduces the traditional concert from the Golden Hall of Vienna's Musikverein. German conductor Christian Thielemann will be leading the concert for the first time, directing the Vienna Philharmonic in a performance of polkas, waltzes and gallops by the Strauss family and their contemporaries, culminating in the traditional renditions of By the Beautiful Blue Danube and the Radetzky March.

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores unusual and unexplained natural events that occur around the world during winter, enlisting the aid of leading scientists to uncover why these strange events happen. The programme examines unusual weather conditions, including tornadoes made of snow, and animals behaving in unexpected ways, from snowboarding crows to penguins attempting death-defying feats.

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway heads to Llandudno to explore the rugged beauty of Great Orme, a giant headland overlooking the Irish Sea. Along the way he visits St Tudno's church and copper mines that date back 4,000 years. His next walk takes him to the remote Berwyn mountains, where he treks from Llangynog to the Pistyll Rhaeadr waterfall.

programme.title: Welsh Sports Review 2018
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a look back at some of his highlights of the Welsh sporting year. Interviewees include Tour de France-winner Geraint Thomas, and the respective men's and women's Wales football managers, Ryan Giggs and Jayne Ludlow.

programme.title: Scrum V Live
programme.desc: Cardiff Rugby v Pontypridd (Kick-off 2.30pm). Catrin Heledd presents all the action from the Principality Premiership clash at Cardiff Arms Park. Both teams have enjoyed strong campaigns so far and will be looking to challenge reigning champions Merthyr for the title. The last meeting between the sides saw Pontypridd claim an 18-8 victory in the final month of last season, but Cardiff will be looking to demonstrate how much they have improved since then. With analysis from Richie Rees and Sean Holley.

programme.title: Extreme Wales with Richard Parks
programme.desc: The endurance athlete and former Welsh rugby international Richard Parks embarks on extreme adventures across Wales. In the first programme, Richard heads on a three-day, adrenaline-fuelled, wet and wild coastal expedition as he climbs, scrambles and swims the St David's Head Peninsula in Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: Premiere. An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.

programme.title: The Archbishop of Canterbury's New Year Message
programme.desc: The Most Rev Justin Welby reflects on the ways communities can be sources of hope in difficult times and how he has been inspired by the community he established at his London home, Lambeth Palace.

programme.title: The Snow Wolf: A Winter's Tale
programme.desc: Dramatised natural history film, following an alpha female wolf in the Dolomite mountains. A tragic sequence of events forces the wolf to flee her pack while pregnant in search of new territory. Along the way, she gives birth to six cubs, which she strives to protect from humans and predators as she journeys into the Alps in search of a new home.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell presents the quiz show in which the Birdwatchers take on the Brews. They attempt to make connections between things that at first do not appear to be linked, such as consonants, drugs, Brexit and tap water.

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: University Challenge Christmas 2018: Edinburgh University v LSE
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as teams made up of distinguished graduates of Edinburgh University and the London School of Economics compete to secure a place in the semi-finals. Edinburgh is represented by the likes of MP Joanna Cherry and comedian Mitch Benn, while the LSE team includes critic Ekow Eshun and writer Maya Jaggi.

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following three of the world's largest rivers, beginning with the Amazon, uncovering some of the latest discoveries, including the 'Blue Lagoon' which is home to a newly discovered species of cichlid. The programme also explores some of the Amazon's flooded forests, home to an array of unusual animals, and cameras follow giant river otters on a fishing foray on the rocky terraces of the Cristalino river.

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: Premiere. A frontiersman leading a hunting party through the wilderness is mauled by a bear, and a travelling companion who pledged to stay with him until help comes kills his son and leaves him for dead. Against all odds, the wounded man survives his injuries and embarks on a gruelling quest for revenge that takes him through a harsh landscape. Western, starring an Oscar-winning Leonardo DiCaprio, with Tom Hardy and Domhnall Gleeson.

programme.title: Young Frankenstein
programme.desc: Frederick Frankenstein rejects his family heritage as a mad scientist, but when he finds a book revealing how his grandfather created a monster, he cannot resist building one of his own. Mel Brooks' spoof of James Whale's classic 1930s horror films, starring Gene Wilder, Marty Feldman, Madeline Kahn, Teri Garr, Peter Boyle and Gene Hackman.(n)

programme.title: Ant-Man
programme.desc: Premiere. A thief attempting to go straight is recruited by a scientist who provides him with a suit that gives him the power to shrink. He must use his new skills to carry out a special mission - helping the inventor to steal back his miniaturisation technology from a ruthless businessman who intends to turn it into a deadly weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Doctor
programme.desc: Michael Mosley finds out whether singing can boost feel-good chemicals in the brain, Dr Zoe Williams discovers why music could help people with dementia, and Dr Alain Gregoire looks at some new research showing the surprising benefits of group singing for mothers with post-natal depression. Plus, Gabriel Weston investigates whether detoxing is a con.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Nadeem Islam visits Rome in Italy to discover what attraction are there for deaf people to enjoy, starting with a guided scooter tour. With voiceover.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central region chefs try to impress the judging panel of Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort, who are joined by joined by Dan Smith, a paramedic for the North West Manchester Ambulance Service who was one of the first at the scene of the Manchester Arena bombing in May 2017.(n)

programme.title: Swallows and Amazons
programme.desc: Four youngsters go boating while on holiday in the Lake District where they encounter two more children with a boat of their own, and a rivalry develops over a series of escapades. Family adventure, based on Arthur Ransome's classic novel, starring Virginia McKenna, Ronald Fraser, Sophie Neville and Simon West.(n)

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Kangaroo Dundee & Other Animals - Part One: Natural World
programme.desc: The natural history documentary follows the work of tough Australian Chris `Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to rescuing and raising orphaned kangaroos in the outback near Alice Springs. This two-part film follows Brolga as he expands operations by opening his doors to a whole new bunch of animals, including a trio of camels, a southern hairy-nosed wombat and three emu chicks, as well as building a wildlife hospital.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Kangaroo Dundee & Other Animals - Part Two: Natural World
programme.desc: The continued work of Australian naturalist Chris `Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to raising kangaroos and is now opening his doors to new animals. However, it is not proving easy. The emu chicks are wreaking havoc, the camels are rapidly outgrowing their enclosure and the wombat is proving quite a handful. To help, Brolga is moving some of them to his 80-acre sanctuary - but after a clash with Roger the kangaroo, he has been left on crutches, and all his plans are on hold.(n)

programme.title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy has a day where everything seems to go wrong, but gets no sympathy from his family. He becomes convinced that bad things only ever happen to him, but then his parents, his brother and his sister all suffer terrible days of their own. Family comedy based on Judith Viorst's series of children's books, starring Ed Oxenbould, Steve Carell and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Wales with Richard Parks
programme.desc: Richard embarks on a three-day mountain-bike expedition from the border to the coast, beginning at Offa's Dyke on the ancient disputed border between Wales and England. He then travels through the beautiful yet remote Elan Valley, and the dangerous summit of the Cadair Idris, before reaching the finishing line at Barmouth Beach.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction in West Hertfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.(n)

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman hosts the first semi-final as teams of distinguished graduates compete on behalf of their former universities in the academic quiz's festive edition.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Fresh Start
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge challenges eight families to ditch convenience food and cook from scratch at home, as he believes it will make them fitter, happier and healthier. In the opening episode, Tom meets the eight volunteer families for the first time, and introduces them to the plan he wants them to follow for the next 12 weeks. The first step of his plan is to simply get the families cooking more, and he presents all the families with a starter pack of easy recipes and the ingredients for sausage and mash. Later, Tom prepares two dishes to inspire the group, a tomato salad packed with Mediterranean flavours, and a chicken and peanut stirfry.(n)

programme.title: The Twinstitute
programme.desc: New series. Doctors Chris and Xand van Tulleken put health theories to the test with the help of pairs of identical twins, revealing ways we can live a healthier life. Thanks to their matching DNA, identical twins are the perfect candidates for scientific comparison, so Chris and Xand use this principle to put contrasting health theories to the test. In the first episode, the doctors pit diet against exercise, and analyse the results as they challenge twins to go head-to-head with contrasting regimes to see who loses the most weight.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Following the astonishing wildlife, landscapes and people of the world's longest river, the Nile, beginning in the tropical mountain range of the Rwenzoris, home to one of the world's strangest birds, the shoebill stork. Then, cameras follow the Nile's journey as it travels through the wild Savannah lands of Uganda, before reaching the Ethiopian highlands where it receives an injection of water far to the East.(n)

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Kate Williams, Angela Scanlon and Griff Rhys Jones join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.(n)

programme.title: NI Trending
programme.desc: Holly Hamilton and Connor Phillips host a review of the year's most memorable moments, joined by guests including Derry Girls star Jamie-Lee O'Donnell and stand-up comedian Andrew Maxwell.(n)

programme.title: NFL This Week
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora to look back at the final round of regular-season fixtures. The trio also preview the play-offs.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: The Queen's Green Planet
programme.desc: Documentary following Her Majesty the Queen and an ambitious legacy project to create a global network of protected forests, spanning the 53 countries of the Commonwealth. The film also features a conversation between the Queen and Sir David Attenborough in the gardens of Buckingham Palace last summer, with the subjects ranging from climate change to conkers and birthday gifts. There is also footage of the members of the royal family involved so far in making the Queen's Commonwealth Canopy a reality, including Prince Harry planting trees in the Caribbean and Prince William in Canada's Great Bear Rainforest.

programme.title: This Morning - 30 Unforgettable Years
programme.desc: The legacy of one of the country's longest running and most famous shows, demonstrating how the show has played an influential role in changing TV landscape. Featuring giggles, gaffes and jaw-dropping moments unseen for decades, and contributions from the likes of Phillip Schofield, Holly Willoughby, Richard Madeley, Judy Finnigan, Fern Britton, Robbie Williams and Bradley Walsh.

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Daredevil explorers Rick and Evelyn O'Connell are called into action when their son accidentally resurrects the evil Chinese Emperor Han from his ancient tomb. The family now faces a race against time to prevent the merciless leader from awakening his vast terracotta army in a plot to take over the world. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Maria Bello, Jet Li and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is joined by a trio of celebrity contestants for the guessing game-show - Diversity's Ashley Banjo, Benidorm actor Jake Canuso and TV presenter Lorraine Kelly, who all stay in the game right through to the Super Catchphrase round.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five IT workers from Cumbria answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites celebrities to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants Bob Mortimer, Amy Childs and Alistair Stewart answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants Andi Osho, Mark Ramprakash, Alex Beresford and Jane Moore pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: Madcap panel show presented by the comedian, with Jordan Stephens, Janet Street-Porter, Alex Brooker and Una Stubbs nominally tasked with saving planet Earth from any potential alien invasion. They must find clips, people and anything that is fun or funny enough for Harry to place in the capsule which, in the event that the planet is invaded by aliens, can be presented to them to demonstrate earthlings are good fun and therefore worthy of saving.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matty suffers a cruel humiliation when a former boyfriend attacks him. Harriet goes looking for Dawn, and Charity sets up a surprise party for Ryan.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla and Peter examine their history and address their future, and Kate's night out with Imogen devastates Rana. Meanwhile, Lewis tires of Gail's influence on Audrey.

programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, Bond embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux and Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: World Cup: Summer of Love
programme.desc: Manager Gareth Southgate and members of his squad look back at England's 2018 World Cup campaign, which saw them reach the semi-finals for the first time since 1990. With insights from some of those who followed their journey back home, including Piers Morgan, Susanna Reid and Clive Woodward.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.sub-title: ITV News Including New Year Bongs: 31/12/2018

programme.title: Basic Instinct
programme.desc: A hard-drinking San Francisco cop investigates the case of a man murdered with an ice-pick, but his normally well-honed intuition starts letting him down as he falls for the sultry and manipulative chief suspect, the victim's former girlfriend. Thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, starring Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, George Dzundza and Jeanne Tripplehorn.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: London Underground workers answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Alex falls asleep while guarding his father's castle, allowing Sykronior to turn Kingsland into his new holiday home.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Far Out There
programme.desc: The team members think that they are facing a new Sykronian weapon when a vortex appears in the sky over Enchanted Island.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.sub-title: Horrid Henry and the Phantom Fish Filcher
programme.desc: It is Bring Your Baby to School day and Henry discovers that looking after everyone's babies is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.sub-title: Horrid Henry And The Tongue Twisters
programme.desc: Cartoon about a mischievous youngster who delights in playing pranks, being rotten to his relatives and generally getting up to no good.

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.sub-title: Horrid Henry and the Number Gnomes Knowhow
programme.desc: When the going gets tough, the tough get going - and of course that includes Henry.

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.sub-title: Horrid Henry is Too Cool for School
programme.desc: Henry is too cool for school - or is he?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Meet the Penguins
programme.desc: Documentary following the story of Adrian Walls, head of birds at London Zoo, as he fulfils a lifelong ambition to see Humboldt penguins in the wilds of Peru. The keeper - who recently recovered from an operation on a brain tumour - travels through the coastal deserts of the South American country to observe the endangered species in their natural habitat, and also meets local experts to find out why the numbers of the animal have decreased dramatically over the past 30 years. Narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

programme.title: Britain's Favourite Walks: Top 100
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury and Ore Oduba present a countdown of the UK's best loved walks, voted for by more than 8,000 enthusiasts. Featuring locations from the West Highland Way to the Ridgeway, and almost everywhere in between. Famous faces including Catherine Tyldesley, Adrian Edmondson, Katherine Kelly, Larry Lamb, Janet Street Porter and Robert Bathurst hit the trails to reveal their own favourite walks, which feature in the poll. They are joined by experts, nature aficionados and members of the public who provide an insight into the hikes, the history and the hidden stories behind the trails.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of races at 1.25, 2.00 and 3.10 from Cheltenham, plus two races from Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another round of viewer-submitted comedy clips, as captured via smartphone, drone and CCTV. This time, a hoverboard destroys an office, a man falls through a casino ceiling, and an ostrich takes a shine to a young child's mobile phone.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: New series. Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: The big-collared comedian returns with another round of madcap fun and laughter, joined by Emmerdale actor Gaynor Faye, Countryfile presenter Anita Rani, Professor Robert Winston and comedy legends Cannon and Ball. Their job is supposedly to help Harry fill a capsule with jokes, games, songs and clips to prove just how funny the human race can be and prevent an alien invasion - but in actual fact it's just an excuse to let Harry bring his particular brand of comedy back to prime-time television.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain seeks retribution on Isaac for his attack of Matty, Harriet tries to persuade Dawn to stay in the village, and Bernice is plagued by insecurity about her age.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey pins her hopes on Lewis proving Gail wrong, and Carla pushes the boat out for Peter. Meanwhile, David meets a face from the past when his old cellmate Paul turns up on the street.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: New series. Over the next six nights, Jeremy Clarkson welcomes more contestants to the studio, all keen to answer 15 questions in the hope of winning £1,000,000 - with lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Will one lucky contestant start 2019 as a millionaire?

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: First in a two-part tribute to the comedy magician, revealing how an act that started out in the desert during the Second World War went on to take the entertainment world by storm. Narrated by Martin Clunes and featuirng contributions from famous fans including Jennifer Saunders, Simon Callow, Lionel Blair, Anita Harris, Les Dennis and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Singer and actress Anita Harris retraces her footsteps back to the London Palladium where she worked with Tommy. Comedian Les Dennis makes an emotional trip back to Her Majesty's Theatre to remember the night he saw Tommy's final performance. Plus, how Cooper became an unlikely comedy hero on Dutch TV in the 1960s.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: New series. Over the next six nights, Jeremy Clarkson welcomes more contestants to the studio, all keen to answer 15 questions in the hope of winning £1,000,000 - with lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Will one lucky contestant start 2019 as a millionaire?(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Living with Quads
programme.desc: Any parent knows the challenges that a new baby brings, from the culture shock of nappy changes and sleepless nights to the realisation that time is no longer your own. Now imagine that multiplied by four. This one-off documentary follows the ups and downs of family life for people with quadruplets, meeting families with children of different ages - from babies to 10-year-olds - to reveal the joys, the occasional heartaches and the sacrifices that are necessary when a family expands by four overnight.(n)

programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring an interview with Russell Grant.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: The Queen's Green Planet
programme.desc: Documentary following Her Majesty the Queen and an ambitious legacy project to create a global network of protected forests, spanning the 53 countries of the Commonwealth. The film also features a conversation between the Queen and Sir David Attenborough in the gardens of Buckingham Palace last summer, with the subjects ranging from climate change to conkers and birthday gifts. There is also footage of the members of the royal family involved so far in making the Queen's Commonwealth Canopy a reality, including Prince Harry planting trees in the Caribbean and Prince William in Canada's Great Bear Rainforest.

programme.title: This Morning - 30 Unforgettable Years
programme.desc: The legacy of one of the country's longest running and most famous shows, demonstrating how the show has played an influential role in changing TV landscape. Featuring giggles, gaffes and jaw-dropping moments unseen for decades, and contributions from the likes of Phillip Schofield, Holly Willoughby, Richard Madeley, Judy Finnigan, Fern Britton, Robbie Williams and Bradley Walsh.

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Daredevil explorers Rick and Evelyn O'Connell are called into action when their son accidentally resurrects the evil Chinese Emperor Han from his ancient tomb. The family now faces a race against time to prevent the merciless leader from awakening his vast terracotta army in a plot to take over the world. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Maria Bello, Jet Li and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is joined by a trio of celebrity contestants for the guessing game-show - Diversity's Ashley Banjo, Benidorm actor Jake Canuso and TV presenter Lorraine Kelly, who all stay in the game right through to the Super Catchphrase round.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five IT workers from Cumbria answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites celebrities to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants Bob Mortimer, Amy Childs and Alistair Stewart answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants Andi Osho, Mark Ramprakash, Alex Beresford and Jane Moore pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: Madcap panel show presented by the comedian, with Jordan Stephens, Janet Street-Porter, Alex Brooker and Una Stubbs nominally tasked with saving planet Earth from any potential alien invasion. They must find clips, people and anything that is fun or funny enough for Harry to place in the capsule which, in the event that the planet is invaded by aliens, can be presented to them to demonstrate earthlings are good fun and therefore worthy of saving.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matty suffers a cruel humiliation when a former boyfriend attacks him. Harriet goes looking for Dawn, and Charity sets up a surprise party for Ryan.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla and Peter examine their history and address their future, and Kate's night out with Imogen devastates Rana. Meanwhile, Lewis tires of Gail's influence on Audrey.

programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, Bond embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux and Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: World Cup: Summer of Love
programme.desc: Manager Gareth Southgate and members of his squad look back at England's 2018 World Cup campaign, which saw them reach the semi-finals for the first time since 1990. With insights from some of those who followed their journey back home, including Piers Morgan, Susanna Reid and Clive Woodward.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.sub-title: ITV News Including New Year Bongs: 31/12/2018

programme.title: Basic Instinct
programme.desc: A hard-drinking San Francisco cop investigates the case of a man murdered with an ice-pick, but his normally well-honed intuition starts letting him down as he falls for the sultry and manipulative chief suspect, the victim's former girlfriend. Thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, starring Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, George Dzundza and Jeanne Tripplehorn.

programme.title: Super 4

programme.title: Horrid Henry

programme.desc: When the going gets tough, the tough get going - and of course that includes Henry.

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.sub-title: Horrid Henry is Too Cool for School
programme.desc: Henry is too cool for school - or is he?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Meet the Penguins
programme.desc: Documentary following the story of Adrian Walls, head of birds at London Zoo, as he fulfils a lifelong ambition to see Humboldt penguins in the wilds of Peru. The keeper - who recently recovered from an operation on a brain tumour - travels through the coastal deserts of the South American country to observe the endangered species in their natural habitat, and also meets local experts to find out why the numbers of the animal have decreased dramatically over the past 30 years. Narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

programme.title: Britain's Favourite Walks: Top 100
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury and Ore Oduba present a countdown of the UK's best loved walks, voted for by more than 8,000 enthusiasts. Featuring locations from the West Highland Way to the Ridgeway, and almost everywhere in between. Famous faces including Catherine Tyldesley, Adrian Edmondson, Katherine Kelly, Larry Lamb, Janet Street Porter and Robert Bathurst hit the trails to reveal their own favourite walks, which feature in the poll. They are joined by experts, nature aficionados and members of the public who provide an insight into the hikes, the history and the hidden stories behind the trails.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of races at 1.25, 2.00 and 3.10 from Cheltenham, plus two races from Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another round of viewer-submitted comedy clips, as captured via smartphone, drone and CCTV. This time, a hoverboard destroys an office, a man falls through a casino ceiling, and an ostrich takes a shine to a young child's mobile phone.

programme.title: Tipping Point

programme.desc: The big-collared comedian returns with another round of madcap fun and laughter, joined by Emmerdale actor Gaynor Faye, Countryfile presenter Anita Rani, Professor Robert Winston and comedy legends Cannon and Ball. Their job is supposedly to help Harry fill a capsule with jokes, games, songs and clips to prove just how funny the human race can be and prevent an alien invasion - but in actual fact it's just an excuse to let Harry bring his particular brand of comedy back to prime-time television.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain seeks retribution on Isaac for his attack of Matty, Harriet tries to persuade Dawn to stay in the village, and Bernice is plagued by insecurity about her age.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey pins her hopes on Lewis proving Gail wrong, and Carla pushes the boat out for Peter. Meanwhile, David meets a face from the past when his old cellmate Paul turns up on the street.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: New series. Over the next six nights, Jeremy Clarkson welcomes more contestants to the studio, all keen to answer 15 questions in the hope of winning £1,000,000 - with lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Will one lucky contestant start 2019 as a millionaire?

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: First in a two-part tribute to the comedy magician, revealing how an act that started out in the desert during the Second World War went on to take the entertainment world by storm. Narrated by Martin Clunes and featuirng contributions from famous fans including Jennifer Saunders, Simon Callow, Lionel Blair, Anita Harris, Les Dennis and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Singer and actress Anita Harris retraces her footsteps back to the London Palladium where she worked with Tommy. Comedian Les Dennis makes an emotional trip back to Her Majesty's Theatre to remember the night he saw Tommy's final performance. Plus, how Cooper became an unlikely comedy hero on Dutch TV in the 1960s.(n)

programme.title: Living with Quads
programme.desc: Any parent knows the challenges that a new baby brings, from the culture shock of nappy changes and sleepless nights to the realisation that time is no longer your own. Now imagine that multiplied by four. This one-off documentary follows the ups and downs of family life for people with quadruplets, meeting families with children of different ages - from babies to 10-year-olds - to reveal the joys, the occasional heartaches and the sacrifices that are necessary when a family expands by four overnight.(n)

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix set off on a European adventure, organising a special ceremony in each of their home countries. They begin in Gino's homeland of Italy, where the chef's best friend is renewing his vows in four days' time.
