But despite the urgency of preparing a menu, Gino insists they stop for lunch in his home town of Naples and takes them to the oldest pizzeria in town.(n)

programme.title: The Woman in Black
programme.desc: A lawyer tormented by the death of his wife is sent to a remote village to put deceased client Alice Drablow's affairs in order. The locals are suspicious of outsiders and determined to keep the area's tragic history a secret, and the late Mrs Drablow's isolated house appears to be haunted by a vengeful spirit that seems hell-bent on redressing a decades-past grievance. Horror based on Susan Hill's novel, with Daniel Radcliffe and Ciaran Hinds.

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides five enthusiastic competitors, who are paid to play computer games for a living, on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team must tackle physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.

programme.title: Carry On Teacher
programme.desc: A headmaster hopes to land a more prestigious job at a better school, but his pupils do not want him to leave. When two inspectors pay a visit, the mischievous students see a chance to sabotage his career plans with a series of pranks. Comedy, starring Ted Ray, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debt adviser Tom Franklin, landscape architect Richard Hodgetts, housing officer Emma Daisley and recruitment manager Sarah Dix compete for the £1,000 prize in Banbury, Oxfordshire. With single Sarah on the lookout for Mr Right, the week features plenty of flirtatious behaviour, while Richard is branded `Pickie Dickie' for criticising Tom's pea and mint soup.

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enters the paper crafts competition at the Royal Welsh Show. She produces an embroidered greetings card, and decoupage designer Jaina Minton teaches her how to make a paper sculpture of a seagull. To create jewellery, Phiona Richards lends a helping hand recycling damaged books and turning the print and pictures into rose rings.

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: A Victorian veterinary surgeon is certified insane after developing the ability to talk to his patients in their own language. Undaunted, he manages to escape from the asylum and embarks on a quest to locate a rare aquatic snail. Oscar-winning musical comedy, with Rex Harrison, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough and Anthony Newley. Songs include Talk to the Animals and I've Never Seen Anything Like It.

programme.title: Lego Masters
programme.desc: Melvin Odoom hosts the final, and the four remaining teams must build a walking, talking robo-pet. The last two teams have seven days to create the biggest build of their lives, using as many as half a million bricks each. Their Master Build creations will be displayed at The Design Museum, before being assessed for the final time by Matthew Ashton, Fran Scott and guest judge Sue Perkins. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard accompanies Sheldon on a road trip to end a family feud and persuade his reluctant brother George to come to the wedding. Jerry O'Connell guest stars.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Friends and family gather as Amy and Sheldon prepare to tie the knot - but it seems the happy couple's minds are elsewhere. Sheldon Cooper and Mayim Bialik star, with guest appearances from Laurie Metcalf, Kathy Bates, Mark Hamill, Jerry O'Connell and Teller (the quiet half of US magic duo Penn and Teller).

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny worries about the consequences of spending the night with Raj, and Leonard's reaction confirms her worst fears. Meanwhile, Sheldon is more interested in the upcoming paintball competition, and tries to refocus the boys' attentions as they argue over the previous evening's activities. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: In the Name of the Grandfather
programme.desc: After ducking out of a bonding session with Grampa, a guilt-ridden Homer vows to make it up to his father by granting him a wish. The old man decides to visit Ireland and drop in on his favourite pub from his army days. Upon arrival, the pair discover the bar is a shadow of its former self, and agree to buy the business and turn its fortunes around.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer proposes to Marge for the second time when he discovers their marriage licence is invalid, but the ceremony does not proceed without a hitch. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta and Julie Kavner.

programme.title: Flash Gordon
programme.desc: American football quarterback Flash Gordon and journalist Dale Arden find themselves aboard a rocket ship designed by scientist Dr Zarkov, who intends to travel across space to locate the source of recent natural disasters. The three arrive on the planet Mongo, where they soon learn that the attacks are the responsibility of evil emperor Ming the Merciless, who is planning to destroy the Earth. Sci-fi comic-strip adventure, with Sam J Jones, Max von Sydow, Brian Blessed, Melody Anderson, Topol, Timothy Dalton, Ornella Muti, Peter Wyngarde and Mariangela Melato. Featuring music by Queen.

programme.title: Vice Versa
programme.desc: A department store executive returns from a trip to Thailand in possession of a mysterious artefact that causes him to change places with his 11-year-old son. While the horrified father struggles to cope with a world of teachers and school bullies, the youngster is revelling in the perks of being a grown-up. Fantasy comedy, starring Judge Reinhold, Fred Savage, Swoosie Kurtz and Corinne Bohrer.

programme.title: The Dam Busters
programme.desc: The story of the destruction of the major dams in Germany's industrial heartland in the Ruhr valley in 1943, a mission that seemed impossible until engineer and scientist Barnes Wallis came up with the ingenious idea of bouncing bombs, and the pilots of 617 Squadron were trained to fly the crucial mission. Second World War drama, with Michael Redgrave, Richard Todd, Basil Sydney, Derek Farr and Ursula Jeans.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton.

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.sub-title: The Last Leg of the Year
programme.desc: A special edition of the comedy review show looking back at the significant moments of 2018 and peering ahead to the next 12 months. Host Adam Hills and his regular sidekicks - Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker - provide their own spin on the events that really mattered over the past year. Katherine Ryan, Johnny Vegas, Nish Kumar, Richard Ayoade, Tom Allen, Jessica Knappett, Lost Voice Guy and the Horne Section join in the fun, and there is also film of the trio's trip to Innsbruck, Austria, where Alex attempted to become the first disabled man in history to take part in the double luge.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Highlights from the past 12 months, featuring the armchair critics' instant reactions to some of the year's biggest shows. Including their opinions on Killing Eve, A Very English Scandal, Panorama: Inside No 10, Bodyguard, Strictly Come Dancing, The Haunting of Hill House, The Great British Bake Off, Naked Attraction, Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild, The Last Leg, Britain's Got Talent, The Andrew Marr Show, Antiques Roadshow, The X Factor and the royal wedding.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble.

programme.title: Northern Soul
programme.desc: A teenager living in a Northern town in the 1970s finds his horizons expanded when he discovers American soul music. He develops an inseparable friendship with a fellow devotee and the pair hope to achieve a brighter future beyond their bleak daily life. Drama, starring Elliot James Langridge, Josh Whitehouse, Steve Coogan and Ricky Tomlinson.

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts the game show, inviting a team calling themselves the London Girls to take his golden hand and tackle a number of physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges. Although the presenter has a tendency to mock his own show, he is clearly aware that the people taking part take it very seriously - although this week's bunch prove rather rowdy and out-of-control. Can Richard keep them in line as they try to win the elusive crystals that will buy them time in the Crystal Dome at the end?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates the popular belief that coffee can sober people up and also looks into new research linking consumption of the beverage and a reduced risk of liver disease. In San Francisco, Kate Quilton investigates trendy new drink kombucha, while Matt Tebbutt examines why supermarket labels don't say which cut of beef thin-cut steaks come from.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Surrey, American interior designer Carol Chalmers impresses with both her food and presentation, while nail technician Michelle Catacos pulls out all the stops with a Greek banquet - and two consecutive evenings of fine dining leave businessman Robin Lewis feeling the pressure when it's his turn to host. Doctor Anna Brocklebank rounds off the week with some fascinating table talk, but will her menu live up to the conversation?

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp glams-up Christmas with an embroidered velvet, fur-topped stocking filled with tie-dyed knickers, hot chocolate dippers and homemade lip balms.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ally babysits the twins, and does such a good job that Debra gives her even more responsibility around the house. However, Marie fears her granddaughter is being treated like a slave.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray worries Debra's criticism will make the children think he is a fool, and hatches a plan to win back their respect.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray refuses to take Debra to an awards ceremony, tired of her constant lateness, while Frank and Robert get into their own heated debate about the importance of punctuality. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton, Peter Boyle and Doris Roberts.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Maris tries to woo Niles with anonymous presents, but Frasier thinks the gifts were intended for him and risks his latest relationship to learn the identity of his secret admirer. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles's expensive divorce leaves him penniless, forcing him to move into Frasier and Martin's apartment. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer.

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
programme.desc: A boy starts a new school determined to be popular and admired, only to find himself instead a target for bullies. He documents his experiences in a journal as he sets out on a series of attempts to gain the respect he feels he deserves - but his every effort ends in disaster. Family comedy, with Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron and Chloe Grace Moretz.

programme.title: The Muppet Movie
programme.desc: Kermit the frog is persuaded by his agent that he has a future in movies. He sets off on a journey across America to realise his dream, gathering a crowd of like-minded friends along the way - but the owner of a French restaurant plans to make him the dish of the day. Comedy, starring Dom DeLuise and Charles Durning alongside the puppet characters, with cameos from Mel Brooks, Orson Welles and Steve Martin.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
programme.desc: Bart is on his best behaviour as he tries to win the affections of a girl at his school, while Lisa reports on what Springfield will look like in 50 years. With the voice of Anne Hathaway (Les Miserables).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is forced to eat bland food after he burns his taste buds while trying to copy a fire-eating street performer. He becomes a regular at Springfield Elementary's canteen where he learns a new parenting technique to try out on Bart and Lisa - but its overbearing nature leads to disaster. Meanwhile, Marge enjoys a sauna she discovers in the basement.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and Homer rent an apartment in an affluent area so their children can have a good education when Springfield Elementary is rated the worst school in the state. Bart wastes no time in establishing a bad-boy persona, and increases Lisa's popularity by telling people she knows a pop star. With the voice of Ellen Page (Juno).

programme.title: Splash
programme.desc: A lonely New Yorker is rescued from drowning by a mermaid, who falls in love with him and assumes human form so she can seek him out in Manhattan. He is soon equally smitten, and she resolves to keep her true nature a secret from him. However, an obsessive scientist suspects the truth and plans to prove it. Romantic fantasy comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Daryl Hannah and John Candy.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great New Year's Bake Off
programme.desc: Noel Fielding, Sandi Toksvig, Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood are reunited in the tent. Joining them are Kate Henry from the 2014 series, Dr Tamal Ray from 2015, 2016 winner Candice Brown, and finalist Steven Carter-Bailey from 2017. All hope to impress the judges with their skills and take home the title of Festive Star Baker. Music is provided by the London Gay Men's Chorus.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Cast members Simon Bird (Will), Joe Thomas (Simon), James Buckley (Jay) and Blake Harrison (Neil) reunite for a celebration of the sitcom, which made its debut on E4 in May 2008 and went on to become one of the most popular and successful British comedies of recent years. The programme promises behind-the-scenes footage from filming, the story behind the show, surprise guests, celebrity fans and plenty of embarrassing stories. The show will also be honouring the funniest moments across the three TV series and two films in the coveted Inbetweeners Awards.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will plans to celebrate his birthday with a grown-up dinner, but his friends face a dilemma when they discover the event clashes with a more popular party. They end up gatecrashing the rival gathering, only to find that Simon's French exchange student steals the limelight.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: At the start of the new term, Carli organises a fashion show that Simon is eager to participate in. Will tries to shake off his embarrassing reputation, while Jay continues to lie about his sexual experiences. Comedy, starring Emily Head, Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, James Buckley and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will decides to organise one last adventure for his friends before they all go their separate ways, so the gang heads off for a camping trip in the countryside. While Will draws on all his scout training, Jay, Neil and Simon are not prepared for the great outdoors.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides an AC/DC tribute band from Newcastle through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Future zones, tackling a range of skill, mystery, physical and mental challenges.(n)

programme.title: The People's Vet
programme.desc: A cat with cancer has its tail removed, a Jack Russell needs ligament surgery after chasing a ball down a hole, and vets try to work out why a budgie's feathers are falling out.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Pets
programme.desc: Dog expert Leon gives advice to a couple whose Chihuahua constantly barks, while vet Gavin deals with an African pygmy hedgehog that is plucking out its own quills.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty sets out to learn how kippers are produced, and finds out why this nutritious smoked fish is no longer a breakfast favourite, while Kate Quilton is in Germany to investigate gherkins, discovering a space-age machine that can pickle food in seconds. Matt Tebbutt and Helen Lawal try to discover why rice cakes are white when they are made of brown rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: A week of competitive dinner parties in Cumbria. Childminder Nina Raistrick kicks off the competition with a menu of deliberately mundane-sounding dishes, followed by theatre manager Jonathan Higgins, who presents a Turkish-themed menu on the second evening. The third night sees council worker Zoltan Buncsek prepare food from his native Hungary, and personal trainer Karen Rathbone rounds off the week with a healthy dinner party.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp makes a doll's house and also finds out about tree decorating rituals from around the world, including Austrian meringue decorations called windbackerai.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug ignores Carrie's fears and buys a motorcycle - so she takes up smoking to spite him. However, when he finally sells the bike, she feels guilty and decides to buy it back. Meanwhile, Arthur takes a job at a pretzel shop.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie becomes close friends with the new neighbour, leaving a jealous Doug feeling unwanted. American comedy set in New York, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug tries to get out of going to the bank with Carrie, claiming he is too busy at work, but a stapler-inflicted injury in a delicate area makes him see the error of his ways. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Deacon and Kelly ask Doug and Carrie to be godparents to their newborn son. Comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Victor Williams.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra wants to buy an expensive dress for Ally to wear to a friend's 13th birthday party, but Ray refuses to spend $250 on something that will only be used once, and naturally Marie takes his side. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Madylin Sweeten.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert contemplates leaving the police force to take up a job selling security systems, but the proposal receives a mixed reaction, leading to tense celebrations at his birthday party. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Brad Garrett and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Seal Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier prepare for a dinner party at Maris's beach house, but a bizarre turn of events results in them having to devote all their time to disposing of a dead seal that has washed up on the shore.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Unemployed Roz is reduced to borrowing money from Frasier, but he thinks she is spending it irresponsibly. Meanwhile, rumours circulate that KACL is rehiring staff. Comedy, starring Peri Gilpin and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: Reporters Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are sacked for missing out on a massive scoop about the theft of jewellery from famous British fashion designer Lady Holiday. To try to re-establish their reputations, the duo and Gonzo fly to London to see if they can track down the culprit. Comedy, with the voices of Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with cameo appearances by John Cleese, Diana Rigg, Charles Grodin and Peter Ustinov.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Willow
programme.desc: A farmer with dreams of becoming a wizard finds an abandoned baby, who is destined to bring about the downfall of an evil queen. The wicked tyrant's minions have been sent to kill the child before she can fulfil the prophecy, and it falls to the would-be sorcerer to protect her, with the aid of a rogue warrior. Fantasy adventure, starring Warwick Davis and Val Kilmer.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer presents as the best players from recent series return to compete for the Champion of Champions title. Nature and wildlife presenter Kate Humble in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Angela and Steve from Leicestershire search for a second home in Lanzarote, with a budget of £225,000.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers try to work out why male red panda Jung is losing weight, with a full medical examination scheduled after a special diet fails to solve the problem. West African mandrill JC is being challenged for his dominant position by his sons Ludo and Jareth and, while JC is taken for some health checks, Ludo gets 'over-friendly' with his dad's girlfriend. Tempers start to fray among Chester Zoo's Humboldt penguin colony during the annual moult - can youngsters Frazzle and Munch avoid being picked on by the grown-ups?(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: New series. Three couples from in and around Bristol, Billy and Tasha, Dennis and Tina, and Keith and Jane, compete for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game at the annual billionaires' retreat. He decides to build a state-of-the-art stadium in an effort to lure fans, but the proposed site is on the last remaining bee colony in Springfield - prompting Lisa to lead a protest.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: New series. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Lindleys from Ashtead, Surrey. Having built up his business empire from home, cyber security expert Bill has inadvertently taken over their detached bungalow, and retired civil servant Pippa has had enough. She dreams of moving to Kent, where they can be closer to family and the coast.(n)

programme.title: What Britain Bought in 2018
programme.desc: Mary Portas surveys Britain's spending habits over the past 12 months, revealing customers' passions, fashions, fads and faux pas during 2018. Throughout the programme, Mary goes inside a £2billion delivery company to find out how the UK became a takeaway nation, and sees how some of the biggest high street names and companies are attempting to be more ethical and cut down on their use of plastic. She also finds out how veganism went from marginal to mainstream and how companies have responded to consumers' changing habits.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 Dispatches
programme.sub-title: The Truth About Vegans: Channel 4 Dispatches
programme.desc: Reporter Morland Sanders investigates the rising popularity of veganism. It's better for your health, the environment and animals but why do some activists resort to such extreme tactics to promote it?(n)

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Comedian and author David Baddiel joins Richard Ayoade for a seasonal trip to Jordan, visiting world-class wonders, deserts and salted seas. The pair arrive in Amman and explore the city's ancient citadel, before attempting to secure a biblical selection box of gold, frankincense and myrrh, starting with a visit to the gold souk. They also go for a dip in the Dead Sea, follow in the footsteps of Moses as they scale Mount Nebo, and head for the ancient city of Petra, before ending their trip back in Amman, where they learn how to prepare a Jordanian Festive Feast.(n)

programme.title: Rob Rinder's Good Year, Bad Year
programme.desc: End-of-year review show in which the man best known as ITV's Judge Rinder casts an unflinching eye, razor-sharp legal mind and acerbic tongue over the events of 2018, to determine once and for all whether the year will be chalked up as being a `good' or `bad' one. With the help of guests Anthony Scaramucci, Deborah Frances-White, Ed Balls, Clare Balding, George Osborne, Tez Ilyas and David Baddiel, Rob delves deep into all the news stories, people and talking points of the year. Uncompromising, perceptive and funny, he gives a fresh take on the big issues while also reminding viewers of the hilarious tiny details already forgotten in the post-Christmas haze.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady plays Cupid for more singletons looking for love. This time, dental manager Johnathan must choose between a picture framer, a health care worker and a sausage maker, while Joanna from Aberdeen is given her choice of a plumber from Stockport, a coach driver from Surrey and a gym enthusiast from Newcastle. Plus, in a Blind Date first, past contestant Conor from Preston is stood up by his date, so Paul makes sure he has someone to share his hot-tub with in the Welsh valleys.

programme.title: World's Most Pampered Pets
programme.desc: Documentary looking for the animal with the most lavish lifestyle and revealing why some owners spend as much money on their pets as they do on themselves. American reality TV star Aubrey O'Day takes her pampered pooches for an extreme makeover, including purple highlights for one and a pink Mohican for another, while Louise Harris from Essex auditions Britain's best-looking `diva dogs' for a new fashion line. Also featured are the world's most expensive pet accessories and the sad story of Kalu the chimp - who missed out on an inheritance of £40million when its owner revealed she had lost her entire fortune.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton help a Northamptonshire woman spruce up her country cottage in the village of Welton, hoping to entice a buyer to part with £250,000. An unsightly boiler and fireplace are discreetly hidden and the lacklustre decor is brightened up to lighten the ground floor.

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Nick Baker visits one of the world's few remaining turtle nesting beaches, the Playa Grande in Costa Rica, and learns how the Las Baulas de Guanacaste National Park supports the largest breeding colony of leatherbacks in the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The playgroup friends are putting on a Christmas show for the parents - and while Danny Dog is dressed as Santa, the real Father Christmas pays them a visit.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The family heads to Paris, where the Donkeys take them to the top of the Eiffel Tower, but Daddy Pig does not like heights.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa go to play with their cousin Chloe and her friends. However, the older children don't want to play any childish games.

programme.title: The Day Henry Met
programme.desc: The four-year-old boy meets a friendly fire engine, and helps rescue a cat from a tree.

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Miss Cookie organises a nature trail for Lucy and her class, but it goes through the middle of the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: Hungarian vizsla Beans has given birth to 11 little puppies, including Gilbert and Sullivan. Cameras join them for dinner to see them learn to wriggle around at two weeks' old.

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Frank and Betty Flamingo have lost their egg, but while everyone is searching, Peggy Pingwing is making friends with a chick that has just hatched.

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Slippery Stage
programme.desc: Pat-Pat is meant to be giving a baton-twirling display at the Town Hall, but someone has spread slippery stuff on the stage, so Noddy decides to find out who is responsible.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas and Edward decide to teach Gordon a lesson after he refuses to thank Edward for rescuing him from Gordon Hill, despite previously berating the smaller engine for being old and unreliable.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.sub-title: Fireman Sam: Heroes of the Storm
programme.desc: Charlie and coastguard Ben see that a hurricane has developed and is heading straight for Pontypandy, so the team rushes into action. Sam has to rescue Penny and the children from the old mines and Elvis helps to prepare the town for the storm. Feature-length episode of the animation.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: Luna and Maddox are taken paddleboarding along the River Thames, while Donk shows how good his sea-legs are.

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: Highlights of the show in which the broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Truth About London
programme.desc: Chandler hears a startling revelation about how his relationship with Monica almost failed to get off the ground in London. Joey tries to get ordained via the internet and Rachel teaches Ben practical jokes to play on Ross. Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston, Matthew Perry and Matt LeBlanc star.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Cheap Wedding Dress
programme.desc: Joey and Ross date the same girl, while Monica fights tooth and nail with a fellow bride-to-be for a special wedding dress and the right to hire Chandler's favourite band for the ceremony. David Schwimmer and Courteney Cox star.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Needing to get rid of stolen goods that Kev planted at the Waterhole, Gary mistakenly attacks Dipi in the darkness. Ben contacts Xanthe with a job offer near Toowoomba.

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: A freak accident gives a womanising executive the ability to hear the thoughts of the opposite sex. Embittered after losing out on promotion to a female colleague, he uses his new-found talent to exact revenge - but the insight it provides ultimately brings out an unexpected sensitive side. Romantic comedy, starring Mel Gibson, Helen Hunt, Marisa Tomei, Alan Alda and Bette Midler.

Romantic drama, starring Patrick Swayze, Jennifer Grey and Jerry Orbach.

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The presenter travels up the Rhine, creating her very own Christmas in her cabin aboard the SS Antoinette. Along the way, she visits some of the most dazzling festive markets that Europe has to offer, sampling traditional food and drink, as well as unique seasonal customs. Back on board, the fun continues as Jane joins her fellow shipmates to make decorations and create her signature Christmas dish. A rousing musical performance by carol singers entertains passengers as the ship makes its way to Switzerland, which is the final stop on this magical festive cruise.

programme.title: Jane McDonald & Friends
programme.desc: Having thrown a fun-filled party last week to celebrate Christmas, Jane McDonald does it all again to ring in the new year, joined by another line-up of music stars. They are soul singer Billy Ocean, singer and actress Alexandra Burke, 1970s chart star Gilbert O'Sullivan, disco act Odyssey and vocal group Collabro. Continues at 11.55pm.

programme.title: Jane McDonald: My Life Story
programme.desc: Profile of the singer, examining her rise to fame as one of the country's first reality TV stars on 1998 docusoap The Cruise, her relationship with husband and fellow cruise ship crew member Henrik Brixen and subsequent career as a performer and presenter of shows including Loose Women and Jane McDonald & Friends.

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.sub-title: Jane McDonald: BAFTA Winning Cruise: Rhone River Cruise
programme.desc: The singer experiences a side of France she has never seen before as she journeys down the Rhone. In Lyon, she visits Marche Paul Bocuse, one of France's most celebrated food markets, and has the cruise takes Jane through a landscape dotted with unspoiled historic towns and villages, she gets a chance to achieve some lifelong ambitions, including riding in a hot-air balloon. The trip also opens Jane's eyes to the natural beauty of rural France, as she recreates a childhood fantasy picnic, and makes her way to Arles in Provence.

programme.title: Jane McDonald & Friends

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: A look back at the best bits, the never-seen-before out-takes and bizarre moments from the past four series of Cruising with Jane McDonald. Plus, a version of the festive classic The 12 Days of Christmas is sung by carollers from Jane's home town of Wakefield.

programme.title: SuperCasino

programme.title: World's Most Pampered Pets
programme.desc: Part two of two. Following people who spoil their pets, including former TOWIE star Amy Childs, who takes her pug Prince shopping in Essex at her favourite pet boutique. Comedienne Shappi Khorsandi treats her rabbit to a royal grooming session, while New York-based journalist Dara Foster goes with her canine to Fetch Club, a disco for dogs. Plus, a look at Skunkfest masterminded by Deborah Cipriani, which is a yearly gathering for skunk lovers.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice tackles a three-bedroom terraced Victorian house in Norwich which, thanks to a vast array of deeply personal belongings, overpowering paintwork and too much furniture, has been languishing on the market for three months. A few coats of paint to neutralise the colour scheme, some effective storage ideas and a ruthless purge of useless items certainly impress the owner.

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Roving naturalist Nick Baker encounters endangered mountain gorillas in the wilds of Uganda's dense Bwindi Forest. These great apes account for half of their species' entire population - and one group in particular has become accustomed to humans.

programme.desc: Malcolm Cockerel is fed up with getting no thanks and decides to have a lie-in, so it remains to be seen who will wake the animals up.

programme.title: Top Wing
programme.desc: New series. Swift, Penny, Rod and Brody, gather at Top Wing Academy where they will learn to pilot their vehicles and become a rescue team.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.sub-title: Thomas & Friends: Big World! Big Adventures! - The Movie
programme.desc: The CG-animated escapades of Thomas as he goes on a big adventure around the world and makes friends with an inspiring Kenyan engine called Nia.

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Shane vents his rage on Gary at the hospital, but decides not to tell the police. Amy helps Sheila to move the stolen goods, but makes it clear that she is furious, as does Xanthe.

programme.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends an alien who has been left stranded on Earth. The two develop a psychic connection as the boy helps the extraterrestrial to contact his own people and call for rescue. However, living on Earth starts to have a devastating effect on the visitor's health, and a government operative is determined to capture him for study. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi fantasy, starring Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Dee Wallace and Peter Coyote.

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
programme.desc: Eccentric inventor Caractacus Potts rescues an old car from the scrapheap, only to discover it has magical, gravity-defying powers. Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice.

programme.title: Oliver
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter.

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.title: World's Strongest Man 2018
programme.desc: James Richardson, Michelle Ackerley and 2017 champion Eddie Hall present action from the grand final of the showpiece strongman event, held in Manila, the Philippines. The 10 qualifiers from the heats battled through gruelling tests including the 360kg Frame Carry, 380kg Jeepney Deadlift and a 28-Tonne Bus Pull as they looked to succeed Hall. With commentary by Colin Bryce and Danny Wallace. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Morecambe and Wise Story: Look Back in Laughter
programme.desc: Documentary making use of old performances, chat show appearances and archive interviews to shed light on the success of Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise. Eric's mother Sadie claimed to be the first person to spot their potential as a comedy double act when, as children, they spent an entire train journey to Coventry annoying her with their antics. The Second World War would see the duo split up, but they were reunited by chance, and by 1968 they had become established household names and were on track to become the most-watched comedy act in the history of British TV.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton deals with a sick sheepdog and Peter Wright tries to reach a cow with pneumonia that needs constant care, but a raging blizzard means his route is blocked. Without medication the cow will die, so Peter must brave the extreme conditions to get through on foot. Meanwhile in Boroughbridge, farmer Ben has brought his prized sheepdog Meg in to see Julian after discovering a lump.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild UK
programme.sub-title: Ben Fogle On Our Yorkshire Farm
programme.desc: Ben meets 40-year-old Amanda Owen from Huddersfield, who left behind a comfortable existence to pursue her lifelong dream of becoming a hill shepherdess. Despite having no background in farming, she now lives at a 2,000-acre farm in the Yorkshire Dales with husband Clive and their eight children. Ben is given a taste of life as a hill shepherd, learns the highs and lows of farming life and finds out how she copes looking after such a huge family as well as her 1,000 native Swaledale sheep.

programme.title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.desc: A countdown of 40 of the most shocking celebrity antics of the year. All sorts of bad behaviour is covered from Kanye West's outbursts to Ant McPartlin's drink-driving incident. Other stories include Madonna's off-colour tribute to Aretha Franklin at the VMAs and the most shocking moments from Celebrity Big Brother. Plus, the tense stand-off between Kim Woodburn and Coleen Nolan on Loose Women, President Trump's controversial UK visit and claims concerning David and Victoria Beckham's marriage. Featuring contributions by Louis Walsh, Jeremy Vine, Michelle Visage, Jermaine Pennant, Dan Osborne, India Willoughby and Courtney Act.

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed.(n)

programme.title: Gino's Win Your Wish List
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo hosts the game show in which a family of five contestants choose their dream prizes, then in pairs answer questions to try to bank the items on their wish list. In the final round, two players try to secure all the prizes they have won so far - as well as a dream family holiday.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Disasters UK
programme.desc: People who regret their tattoos share the stories behind their body art and take steps to get them removed. A woman describes a desperate attempt to erase a former partner's name from her wrist, a man reveals how he woke from a wild night out with a slogan inked on his back and the most tattooed man in Britain reveals his latest addition. Plus, the aspiring model who now regrets getting a huge tattoo of a disgraced pop star on her stomach.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Disasters UK
programme.desc: A man who made his own tattoo gun using a toothbrush and a motor from the back of a TV hopes to get his DIY ink covered up so he can forget about his shady past. Plus, bride-to-be Jessica allowed her fiance to practise his technique on her back and now hopes to get her 18 unsightly tattoos removed in time for her big day.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton head for Sandhurst, Berkshire, to offer advice to Julie Frith, the owner of a four-bedroom house that has remained unsold for a year, despite two reductions in the asking price. The first thing that strikes potential buyers is the property's unfinished feel.(n)

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Nick Baker highlights the plight of South American Orinoco crocodiles as he documents a conservation project in Venezuela to save the species from extinction. In addition to heading out on a dangerous night-time hunt to find out how the creatures are surviving in the wild, he tries to coax a three-year-old to return to the open river.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Brown Bear teaches the playgroup what to do when there has been an accident, and they soon have a patient to try out the new skills they have learned.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro Pony tries to rescue Tiddles the Tortoise from up a tree, setting off a chain of events that needs several visits from the doctors to save the day.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Potato visits the playgroup with his superhero friend Super Potato, who teaches the children the importance of eating fruit and vegetables every day.(n)

programme.title: The Day Henry Met
programme.desc: Animation for youngsters, following the adventures of a four-year-old boy who encounters a new person every day.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben, Holly and Nanny Plum help Mrs Witch clear out some of her magical items.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: A family of wolf-like Tamaskans are breaking out of the house and exploring their back garden for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Pablo Penguin is looking for a nice colourful pebble, but has hurt his wing.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Broken Toy Wash
programme.desc: Fuse is upset because his new toy wash has been broken and Noddy uses his investigating skills to find out who the culprit is.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel complain about how fast they are going, so Thomas teases them by travelling very slowly.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam: Alien Alert! - The Movie
programme.desc: The host of a supernatural TV show about supernatural events visits Pontypandy, prompting the locals to set out in search of aliens. Animated adventure, with the voices of David Tennant and Steven Kynman.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Cap'n Turbot's ship is attacked by a giant octopus, but the pups discover the sea creature is only looking for its baby.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: When Digby's friend Sprite comes to visit, Fizzy casts a disappearing spell on her.(n)

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Sara Kayat treats a patient who is experiencing a full-blown panic attack, while Dr Clare Taylor has an asthmatic's life in her hands when they suffer a severe attack at the surgery. Dr William Laird breaks the news of stomach cancer to his patient, and a man suffering with throat cancer recounts a recent ordeal which left him hospitalised. Plus, a young man seeks Dr Chris Pearce's advice on various conflicting reports on his fertility.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.desc: Julian Norton deals with a sick sheepdog and Peter Wright tries to reach a cow with pneumonia that needs constant care, but a raging blizzard means his route is blocked. Without medication the cow will die, so Peter must brave the extreme conditions to get through on foot. Meanwhile in Boroughbridge, farmer Ben has brought his prized sheepdog Meg in to see Julian after discovering a lump.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring animals doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie learns that Susan has visited Finn in the hospital. Almost caught out sneaking a read of Bea's diary, Liz hides it in the nearest available place - the backyard pizza oven.(n)

programme.title: Paint By Murder
programme.desc: Premiere. An art gallery assistant comes across a previously undiscovered masterpiece and finds herself caught in the middle of a conspiracy. Thriller, starring Alexxis Lemire.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey is nominated for a minor daytime drama award, and Monica realises she will never again feel the thrill of a new romance. Meanwhile, Ross spots Chandler leaving a male strip club and Phoebe meets a cute guy. With Matt LeBlanc and Courteney Cox.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Ross and Monica's Cousin
programme.desc: Monica is visited by a cousin she has not seen since childhood, whose stunning looks do not go unnoticed by Chandler. Rachel and Phoebe plan a last-minute bridal party, while Joey tries to trick his way into an acting role. Guest starring Denise Richards (Starship Troopers).(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie learns that Susan has visited Finn in the hospital. Almost caught out sneaking a read of Bea's diary, Liz hides it in the nearest available place - the backyard pizza oven.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Documentary about Yorkshire vet Julian Norton, his business partner Peter Wright and their team as they administer modern-day medical and surgical aid to creatures great and small. Julian treats a much-loved cat with a swollen eye, for which surgery might be the only option. He also steps in to find out what is wrong with Copper, Head Nurse Sarah's beloved dog.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Megastructures
programme.desc: A look at MS Freedom of the Seas, one of the largest passenger ships in the world, which can accommodate more than 4,300 passengers and over 1,300 crew.(n)

programme.title: Animals After Dark
programme.desc: New series. Presenters and wildlife experts Steve Backshall, Miranda Krestovnikoff, Lindsey Chapman and Philippa Forrester look at what animals get up to at night, using new low-light cameras to follow wolves, foxes, otters, badgers, pine martens and owls, as well as spending the night behind-the-scenes at a zoo. In the first edition, Steve visits a hedgehog hospital, Miranda works with keepers at Bristol Zoo to find out if a slow loris is pregnant, and Lindsey drops by a back garden where badgers and foxes are regular visitors.(n)

programme.title: The Big Fat Lies About Diet & Exercise
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the potential pitfalls of trying to lead a more healthy lifestyle, from the dangers of crash dieting to the unexpected side effects of doing too much exercise. The programme features contributions from nutritionists, dieticians, GPs, cardiologists, fitness trainers and psychologists, who explain the health benefits of fat and carbohydrates, the addictive quality of sugar, the hazards of diet pills, and what can happen to someone who eats too many bananas.(n)

programme.title: Funniest Ever Celebrity Moments
programme.desc: Ore Oduba presents clips of well-known faces making fools of themselves.(n)

programme.title: Music Legends We Lost in 2018
programme.desc: A celebration of musicians who died this year, including Aretha Franklin, Dolores O'Riordan, Avicii, Hugh Masekela, Mark E Smith and Chas Hodges.

programme.title: Ultimate Road Wars
programme.desc: Highlights from the series in which police officers use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented.

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is England's second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Angus gets a shocking surprise when he tries to tell Matty that he is quitting the Phoenix Foundation. Guest starring Tate Donovan.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Police officers use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented. The programme also features footage of dangerous drivers.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The police are suspicious of a man who is wearing two pairs of trousers and two jackets, and they listen in amusement to his feeble attempts at a credible explanation. Plus, two car thieves wearing washing-up gloves make a swift getaway, but are halted when they collide with a cameraman.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge, Bart and Lisa taste success in the world of food blogging as the Three Mouthketeers. They score a reservation at Springfield's most exclusive restaurant, but a dream makes Marge reconsider inviting Homer. With the voices of chefs Anthony Bourdain (Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations), Mario Batali (Molto Mario) and Gordon Ramsay (Hell's Kitchen).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes an author of children's books, calling on the help of an acclaimed fantasy writer. Their book receives the attention of an important book publisher. With the voices of Neil Gaiman and Andy Garcia.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
programme.desc: Homer is made accounts manager at the power plant after he and Marge throw a hugely successful party to promote Krusty's own brand of liquor. A veteran accountant takes him under his wing and shows him what life is like in the corner office, but it is not long before the perks of the position start to wear thin. Meanwhile, Bart develops an unlikely interest in classic novels. Guest starring John Slattery (Mad Men).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simon Cowell provides the voice of the sharp-tongued administrator of a nursery for gifted children who has the job of deciding whether to accept Maggie. As the possibility of successful admission becomes more likely, Lisa feels her position as the intelligent one in the family is being threatened.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Things look bleak for Krusty the Clown when his TV show is binned and he is dropped by his talent agency. But then he is reunited with the veteran agent (Joan Rivers) who got him started in showbusiness all those years ago, and together they plan his big comeback.

programme.title: Fungus the Bogeyman
programme.desc: Andy Serkis narrates an adaptation of Raymond Briggs' children's classic that mixes live action and CGI animation to follow the adventures of a family of green monsters who live in the slimy underground world of Bogeydom. Fungus and his wife Mildew suspect their son Mould is illicitly dabbling in human culture, sparking a family argument that sees the boy flee to the surface. Above ground in Daventry, Daryl Hedge's go-getting wife Wendy won't let him forget it that he is unemployed, while his daughter Lucy has fallen for a disagreeable older boy called Dean. Starring Timothy Spall, Victoria Wood, Keeley Hawes, Joanna Scanlan and Marc Warren.

programme.title: Fungus the Bogeyman
programme.desc: Eve helps the family settle into their new home next door to the Hedges, but Fungus has bigger things to worry about than keeping up with the neighbours as he's been caught in Bogeyman form on CCTV and now the town is searching for the Daventry Monster. Thankfully, his friend Wallow shows up and the two sneak off for a night of bogeying, but they have a problem when Fungus makes a careless mistake. Starring Timothy Spall, Victoria Wood and John Thomson.

programme.title: Fungus the Bogeyman
programme.desc: The Bogeys must flee to Eve's house, but she is unhappy about the imposition and exposes her secret identity to Mildew, giving Mould the distraction he needs to slink off to Lucy's party. Meanwhile, Daryl makes a discovery when he sneaks into the Bogeys' house, while Fungus and Mildew come across Scarface while searching for their son, and he has some vital information about Eve. Starring Timothy Spall, Victoria Wood and Joanna Scanlan.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: An impassioned video rant by Homer becomes an internet sensation and he is given his own talk show. Before long the lovable oaf is the new voice of American politics and spokesperson for the Gravy Movement - but problems arise when he is given the task of choosing the next Republican nominee.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa comes up with a Facebook-style social network that takes Springfield by storm. But when the residents' unhealthy obsession with the addictive website threatens to cause mass hysteria, she is put on trial to explain why she created it in the first place. Adding to the fun, the Winklevoss twins turn up to compete in the 2012 Olympic rowing event - competing against Marge's chain-smoking identical sisters Patty and Selma.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
programme.desc: Moe is heckled for not having any real friends - but it turns out he is attached to his beloved bar towel, which came to him after an eventful 1,000-year journey that started in the Middle Ages. Jeremy Irons provides the voice of the barman's ragged best buddy as it recounts its global adventures prior to landing in Springfield.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The long-running animation reaches its 500th episode. Homer and his family are forced to leave town and live as outcasts after angering the people of Springfield one too many times. Helping them adjust to their new life is WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, while the cartoon's theme is given a makeover by singer Alison Krauss.

programme.title: Football's Funniest Moments
programme.desc: Comical incidents from the world of football, including Rod Stewart's memorable involvement in the Scottish Cup draw and a look at Chris Kamara's reporting style. With contributions by Jamie Carragher, David James and Paul Whitehouse.

programme.title: Premier League's Greatest Moments
programme.desc: From 11-goal thrillers to embarrassing misses, Jamie Carragher reveals his greatest Premier League moments. Interviews with Jose Mourinho, Harry Redknapp and Jermain Defoe.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart begins tagging Springfield with unflattering references to Homer, and his work is seen by professional graffiti artists Shepard Fairey, Ron English, Kenny Scharf and Robbie Conal (playing themselves) who invite the troublemaker to showcase his work in a gallery show. Meanwhile, Apu is worried that a new health food shop will threaten the Kwik-E-Mart's future.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer suffers a bout of incontinence and has to wear a nappy, forcing Marge to ask eccentric boffin Professor Frink to help determine the cause of his condition. With the use of a dream machine, Frink breaks into Homer's subconscious mind where a string of insecurities are exposed, including one involving his late mother.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns gets rid of his power plant employees and replaces them all with robots - with the exception of Homer. But trouble soon brews when the mechanised workers develop rebellious tendencies. With the guest voice of Brent Spiner (best known as Star Trek: The Next Generation's android Data).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: School bully Jimbo orders Bart to entertain his girlfriend Shauna, so he takes her to the cinema. But before he knows it, he's fallen for the girl and chaperoning turns to canoodling. Homer needs to shift the pounds but it's a struggle for him to leave his beloved sofa - until a treadmill with a built-in TV provides all the motivation he needs.

programme.title: Take That Live: Wonderland
programme.desc: A concert filmed at the O2 Arena in London, which was part of the band's 2017 tour in support of their eighth studio album Wonderland. Howard Donald, Mark Owen and Gary Barlow played several nights at the venue, perfoming much loved hits such as Relight My Fire, Patience, Pray, The Flood, and How Deep Is Your Love?. The latter was recently re-recorded with Barry Gibb for their 2018 album, Odyssey.

programme.title: Queen - Live at Wembley
programme.desc: A performance by the band recorded on their 1986 Magic tour, when they were riding the crest of a wave following their triumphant Live Aid performance at the same venue the year before. Including renditions of classic hits Bohemian Rhapsody, I Want to Break Free, We Will Rock You and Radio Ga Ga.

programme.title: New Year Fireworks Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the display from London to see in 2019.

programme.title: Coldplay: Live in Sao Paulo
programme.desc: A concert film recorded in the Brazilian city in November 2017, capturing the climax of the band's record-breaking A Head Full of Dreams Tour and featuring hits including Yellow, The Scientist, Paradise, Clocks and In My Place.

programme.title: Music Legends We Lost in 2018
programme.desc: A celebration of musicians who died this year, including Aretha Franklin, Dolores O'Riordan, Avicii, Hugh Masekela, Mark E Smith and Chas Hodges.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Young orang-utan Hsiao-Ning experiences a sugar-rush after eating too much sweet fruit. Elsewhere, animal manager Jeremy gets ready to take a huge risk to help adult male chimpanzee Jimmy with his leg wound.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimpanzee Bryan learns a painful lesson when he goes outside for the first time, woolly monkey Julio attempts to brave the great outdoors, and chimp Susie could be pregnant for the second time.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Staff members worry about the health of a newborn monkey, while infant orang-utan Dinda gets to grips with the outside enclosure, and stump-tailed macaque Koko has difficulties with her living accommodation.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry sneezes and reintroduces the common cold, forcing the Planet Express crew to put their friend into quarantine. However, that doesn't prevent the virus from spreading, so the president decides there's only one thing for it - everyone infected should be sent on a one-way trip to the sun.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Farnsworth tweaks Bender's processor to win a video-game battle, but it backfires when the robot ends up being boosted into a god-like entity capable of ingesting so much information he can predict the future. Meanwhile, Leela's relationship with Fry takes a turn for the worse, so she decides to leave the Planet Express crew and start afresh elsewhere.

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. This first episode examines the survival tactics of its terrifying residents including killer ants, trap-setting spiders and beetles with the ability to shoot boiling chemicals at their enemies.

programme.title: The Bachelor King
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of king penguins, filmed on the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia over five months. The programme imagines what one penguin's life would be, following it during the challenging, awkward time between adolescence and adulthood. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist examines the world of flight, travelling across the globe to chart the evolutionary story of those creatures who seemingly defy the rules of gravity by taking to the air. Initially focusing on insects, Attenborough meets a descendant of the dragonfly, before examining the Atlas beetle, which tends to restrict flight to times when it needs a mate or a fresh supply of food. More aesthetically pleasing is a group of beautiful tropical butterflies, followed by an in-depth study into the blow fly - the jet fighter of insects.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist visits the jungles of Borneo to meet creatures that like to glide through life - the harlequin tree frog and the little-known colugo - often referred to, incorrectly, as a flying lemur. He also has a CGI-assisted encounter with the first true vertebrate flyer, the pterosaur, receives a flying lesson from a small flock of swans at Loch Lomond in Scotland and encounters the planet's largest species of bat.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist turns his attention to creatures that dominate the skies today. He begins with the vast bird family, watching a group of vultures as they go scavenging and some peregrine falcons dive bombing for their prey. He then moves on to the floating forests of Ecuador to find out what makes the humble hummingbird tick, before ending his journey at the Gomantong bat caves of Borneo - a place he first filmed in 1972 - witnessing a mass exodus of the creatures.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural History Museum Alive
programme.desc: The broadcaster invites viewers to join him as he takes an after-hours stroll around one of his favourite places, the Natural History Museum. But this is no ordinary tour as some of the many exhibits spring to life as the veteran naturalist strolls along.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his exploration of the archipelago with a look at how, despite their proximity, no two of the 19 islands are the same. He also uncovers evidence that evolution on Galapagos is occurring faster than Charles Darwin could ever have imagined, and encounters Lonesome George, the last remaining giant Pinta Island tortoise, which died just a few weeks after filming in June 2012.

programme.title: Ratburger
programme.desc: Adaptation of David Walliams' book, starring Sheridan Smith. Zoe's new pet rat is in danger when burger van man Burt (Walliams) earmarks it for his menu.

programme.title: The Queen and I
programme.desc: New republican prime minister Jack Barker strips the royals of their assets and titles and the Queen and her family are forced to move to a rundown council estate. The locals don't exactly roll out the red carpet, but new neighbours Bev, Tony, Violet and Spiggy prove to be unlikely allies. Comedy based on Sue Townsend's book, starring David Walliams, Samantha Bond, Frances Barber, Amanda Abbington, Johnny Vegas and Julia McKenzie.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: A Totally Fun Thing That Bart Will Never Do Again
programme.desc: Bart persuades his family to go on a cruise, and for once the Simpsons enjoy their holiday - Lisa bonds with other intelligent children while Marge and Homer get some rare time alone. But when Bart embarks on an inspired yet morally dubious plan to prolong the trip indefinitely, things take a turn for the worse. With the guest voices of Steve Coogan and Treat Williams.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself in Marge's bad books after ruining a night out, so when a head injury keeps him off work, he decides to use the time wisely and reflect on his marriage - and as luck would have it, movie star Stradivarius Cain is on hand to offer a few pearls of marital wisdom. With the guest voice of Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The townsfolk discover Ned and Edna have secretly tied the knot, so Marge throws them a reception to celebrate, and before long everyone soon realises there is no such thing as a perfect marriage. Meanwhile, the bride has a plan to help stepchildren Rod and Todd fit in.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: James Corden returns with the comedy quiz as boxer Tony Bellew, Olympic skeleton champion Lizzy Yarnold and comedian Alan Carr joining regulars Jamie Redknapp, Andrew Flintoff and new boy Romesh Ranganathan, who replaces Jack Whitehall.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: An alien child from a dead world is raised on Earth, and grows up keeping his origins and extraordinary abilities a secret. He is forced to take a stand to protect his adopted home from a fanatical general from his own world, who intends to wipe out the human race. Sci-fi adventure based on the Superman comic-books, starring Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon and Russell Crowe.

programme.title: DC's Greatest Movie Moments
programme.desc: From Batman to Superman DC films always make an impression. Sky Cinema's Alex Zane guides you through the top 20 moments as voted for by the fans.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: The comedy quiz returns, with England Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Dele Alli, actor Stephen Mangan and comedian Rob Beckett joining team captains Jamie Redknapp and Andrew Flintoff, regular panellist Jack Whitehall and host James Corden.(n)

programme.title: Delicious
programme.desc: New series. Gina and Sam seem to have just about found a way to work together, but the arrival of rich and handsome restaurateur Mason Elliott throws a spanner in the works. He arrives in town just as Sam decides it's time to invest in a spa, putting a strain on her relationship with Gina, and also testing Adam's loyalty to his family. Return of the drama, starring Dawn French and Emilia Fox.(n)

programme.title: Street Crime UK
programme.desc: Police are called in to a kebab shop in Harrogate after a female employee is attacked by a customer, and in Colchester two women are arrested for possessing cocaine.(n)

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: The dog unit deals with a man who has barricaded himself in his house with his Rottweiler, while a woman thought to have overdosed disappears.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimp toddler Bryan finally makes friends with Seamus, the bad boy of the group - but it is not long before they fall out again.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The life of a baby woolly monkey hangs in the balance just 24 hours after its birth and Charlie is bullied by other chimps, meaning his days of living in the bachelor group could be numbered.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: A trio of tales presented in different animation styles. The first - Colorama - parodies 1940s black-and-white cartoons, the second - Futurama Challenge 3000 - drops Fry and the gang into a retro video game, and the concluding segment - Action Delivery Force - pays homage to Japanese anime as the crew battles dancing aliens.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fatherhood is unexpectedly thrust upon Bender, and against the odds he's a natural. After a heated encounter with Bev - Professor Farnsworth's drinks machine - the robot is left holding Baby Bender and relishes his new role while it lasts. With the guest voice of Wanda Sykes.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fatherhood is unexpectedly thrust upon Bender, and against the odds he's a natural. After a heated encounter with Bev - Professor Farnsworth's drinks machine - the robot is left holding Baby Bender and relishes his new role while it lasts. With the guest voice of Wanda Sykes.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry's search for a fresh pair of pants uncovers an ancient Martian prophecy revealing the world is going to end in 3012. Sudden freak weather and a power blackout seem to back up the claim, so with nothing to lose, the delivery boy decides to throw caution to the wind and tell Leela how much he loves her.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: With the elections for world leader just around the corner, former president Richard Nixon announces his intention to run, the prospect of which leaves Leela in despair. Deciding to enter the political game herself, she finds a worthy candidate to support and runs his campaign - but when it proves a great success, Nixon enlists the mud-slinging services of Bender.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender lands a job as a photographer for a trashy women's magazine, and his first assignment is to snap famous actor Langdon Cobb, whose face has never been seen. The celebrity wears a bag over his head at all times - and as Bender soon discovers, there's a very good reason for that.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam and Mitch go on diets, and Phil is inspired to try his hand at tightrope walking. Meanwhile, Claire tries to plant ideas in the heads of her warring daughters, and Jay's behaviour grates on Gloria.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay helps Manny with a school fundraiser involving lots of wrapping paper, and Claire petitions for a stop sign at a busy junction. Meanwhile, Mitchell is determined to prove a point to Cameron, but neither of them will back down. American comedy, guest starring David Cross (Arrested Development), with Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart begins tagging Springfield with unflattering references to Homer, and his work is seen by professional graffiti artists Shepard Fairey, Ron English, Kenny Scharf and Robbie Conal (playing themselves) who invite the troublemaker to showcase his work in a gallery show. Meanwhile, Apu is worried that a new health food shop will threaten the Kwik-E-Mart's future.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer suffers a bout of incontinence and has to wear a nappy, forcing Marge to ask eccentric boffin Professor Frink to help determine the cause of his condition. With the use of a dream machine, Frink breaks into Homer's subconscious mind where a string of insecurities are exposed, including one involving his late mother.(n)

programme.title: Snake Boss
programme.desc: Snake wrangler Julia Baker and her partner Johnny Bagpipes relocate some of Australia's biggest serpents, but to begin with, Julia must conquer her fear of heights.(n)

programme.title: Snake Boss
programme.desc: Julia Baker removes a highly venomous visitor from a karate school, only to find she has been called out to collect a serpentine intruder at another school.(n)

programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the world's largest animals, revealing why these creatures evolved into giants and how crucial they are to their habitats. He begins in the Americas, finding out more about the sperm whale, coming face to face with grizzly bears and getting up close and personal with an anaconda.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A new executive assistant director shakes up the team, while Hetty hands in her retirement papers and mysteriously vanishes and Sam urges Callen to find another partner. Return of the crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The murder of a swimming-pool cleaner leads the team to a cell of radicalised students who turn out to be plotting an attack on US soil. Meanwhile, Chin Ho takes Grover spearfishing.(n)

programme.desc: Catherine receives a distressed phone call from a man she met on her tour of duty in Afghanistan, revealing that his son has been taken by the Taliban. Roping in McGarrett, she sets out to rescue the youngster - a mission that prompts her to make a life-changing decision. Michelle Borth and Alex O'Loughlin star.(n)

programme.desc: Phil spends quality time with Haley and takes her on a tour of his old college. Meanwhile, Gloria and Jay are forced to talk about an intimate subject with Manny. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.desc: Homer unwittingly takes the blame for his former love rival Artie Ziff's shady financial dealings and business irregularities. Arrested and put on trial, he is shocked to find himself sentenced to 10 years in prison. With the guest voice of Jon Lovitz.(n)

programme.desc: The Planet Express pals decide to give healthy eating a go and head over to the farmers' market to stock up on heirloom eggs. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Marge visit a marriage counsellor and decide on a trial separation, during which Homer begins dating a twentysomething pharmacist. With the guest voices of Girls cast members Lena Dunham, Adam Driver, Jemima Kirke, Zosia Mamet and Allison Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: A couple are murdered and their daughter is kidnapped by a family working as a team in rural Alabama.
