programme.desc: The case of child killer John Straffen, who was spared the noose in 1951 because of his low IQ, but later escaped Broadmoor and struck again.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents investigate when three victims are found tied to stakes out in the Arizona desert. Crime thriller, starring Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: Banshee
programme.desc: Alex wrongly holds Proctor responsible for the armoured car heist and blows up a truck of cattle in retaliation. When this doesn't trigger the desired response, his sister Nola steps in and takes the crimelord's niece Rebecca hostage, leaving it down to Hood to rescue her. Meanwhile, Siobhan is approached by her violent ex-husband Breece, who presents himself a changed man but later turns up at her house drunk and starts threatening her. Drama, with Antony Starr.

programme.title: Banshee
programme.desc: Hood investigates the murder of a Kinaho girl who was secretly dating an Amish boy named Solomon - who happens to be Proctor's nephew. The crime sends shockwaves through the community, shattering the uneasy peace between the Amish and Native American residents, and the sheriff and his deputies ignore their lack of jurisdiction over the reservation to speak to a suspect.

programme.title: Kidding
programme.desc: Jeff wonders if he is having a breakthrough or a mental breakdown, and Seb decides to make a last minute change to Pickles on Ice while Jeff if away.

programme.title: Kidding
programme.desc: In the final episode, Jeff delivers an earth-shaking speech on live national television that affects everyone in his life. Last in the series.

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: Vince is preparing for his driving test as well as an appearance on Jay Leno's show to promote Gatsby, his new movie directed by Martin Scorsese. E wonders whether he should move into his own place, but is unsure how the others would cope, while Lloyd gives his boss an ultimatum - but Ari has ideas of his own.

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet and his staff consider their reaction to a political opponent's verbal assault on affirmative action, Josh is forced to postpone his holiday with Amy to defuse a volatile situation in Puerto Rico, and Sam meets an eccentric politician who thinks a fortune in gold bullion is missing from Fort Knox.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet sees a psychiatrist about his sleeping disorder and receives a sobering personal assessment. CJ battles for the release of a reporter taken hostage in the Democratic Republic of Congo, and Toby writes a controversial speech condemning Islamic fanaticism. Political drama, with Martin Sheen and guest-starring Adam Arkin.

programme.title: Aquaman: Special
programme.desc: Sky Cinema takes a look at the DC superhero film, starring Jason Momoa and directed by James Wan.

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for water plant foreman Jason Turner, whose life had been threatened by a disgruntled employee he had made redundant. However, further investigation reveals the missing man had also been attempting to reconcile with his ex-fiancee, suggesting a new explanation for his disappearance.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: The naturalist and film-maker explores the many varieties of plant life housed at the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew, west London, and explains what they reveal about the natural world and the development of life on Earth. He begins inside the establishment's Palm House, whose climate has been engineered to simulate conditions found in rainforests, charting the evolution of plants that grow in the world's wettest regions and investigating how flowering plants spread across the globe so rapidly.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: The naturalist explores how the plants at Kew Gardens change through the seasons and demonstrates the surprising properties of several species, including the predatory pond-dwelling bladderwort utricularia and a fungus that appears to be capable of mind control. He also discusses the largest single organism on the planet, visits the world's biggest flower and explains how plants and insects can communicate using scents and music.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: The naturalist concludes his exploration of the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew, west London, by examining plants that have evolved to minimise their dependence on water, enabling them to survive in the world's driest environments. He witnesses a cactus blooming at midnight, tells the story of the spectacular flowering of the Agave franzosinii, and visits the Millennium Seed Bank, a facility designed to save plants from future extinction.

programme.title: Doctor Zhivago
programme.desc: A married Russian physician falls in love with another woman, but as their passionate affair plays out against the raging backdrop of the First World War and the Bolshevik revolution, he is torn between his desires and his loyalty to his wife. David Lean's epic drama based on Boris Pasternak's novel, starring Omar Sharif, Julie Christie, Geraldine Chaplin, Rod Steiger, Alec Guinness, Ralph Richardson, Tom Courtenay and Klaus Kinski.

programme.title: Attenborough at 90: Behind the Lens
programme.desc: A profile of broadcaster and naturalist David Attenborough, whose career has included being the first controller of BBC Two and making numerous groundbreaking wildlife programmes.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Wild City
programme.desc: The veteran broadcaster examines the wildlife of Singapore, showing the diversity of the urban and hidden environments of animals living in the city-state.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The White House staff prepare for an environmental crisis after a truck carrying uranium rods crashes in a remote Idaho tunnel, and are forced to face the possibility that terrorists may be responsible. Meanwhile, Vice President John Hoynes, unaware that President Bartlet's electoral strategy may exclude him from the next campaign, ponders how to promote one of his favourite bills, and Donna seeks a presidential proclamation honouring the retirement of her favourite teacher - but doesn't count on Josh's interference. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen, Rob Lowe and Tim Matheson.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: CJ has her work cut out trying to play down the resulting scandal when President Bartlet disparages a potential Republican nominee following a TV interview, not realising the cameras are still rolling. programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Clara receives a letter summoning her to a mysterious meeting, where she is given a message for the Doctor. The meaning is uncertain, but when an enemy strikes the Time Lord is left with no choice but to travel to the one place in time and space he should never go - into a deadly trap that threatens to unravel his past, present and future. Matt Smith and Jenna-Louise Coleman star in the first part of a three-pronged tale.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Doctor, the Widow and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: The Time Lord crash-lands on Earth during the Second World War, where he tries to make sure two unfortunate evacuees and their mother have the best Christmas ever. He transports them to a magical land dominated by an enchanted forest - but that is when their troubles really begin. Claire Skinner, Bill Bailey, Arabella Weir and Alexander Armstrong join Matt Smith in the 2011 festive special, inspired by CS Lewis's Narnia stories.

programme.title: Gangsta Granny
programme.desc: Family comedy based on the children's novel by David Walliams. Schoolboy Ben is bored witless after being made to stay with his grandma. All she ever wants to do is play Scrabble and eat yucky cabbage soup. But it turns out there's a whole lot more to this OAP than cardigans and toffees when she tells him how she used to be an international jewel thief - and when she admits there was one heist she never quite managed in her heyday, the pair set out on a criminal adventure. Julie McKenzie stars as the shady senior citizen, with Walliams and Miranda Hart as the boys' ballroom-dancing parents, alongside Joanna Lumley, Rob Brydon and Robbie Williams, with Reece Buttery as Ben.

programme.title: Mr Stink
programme.desc: Family comedy based on the children's novel by David Walliams. Twelve-year-old Chloe leads a lonely existence - her mother is too busy with her political ambitions to take any interest in her daughter, her hen-pecked dad is hiding a secret of his own and she cannot hope to compete with her `perfect' younger sister - to say nothing of the nasty girls who make her school life a misery. So when she meets a tramp in need of somewhere to stay, she invites him to hide in her family's garden shed - but it soon turns out there is more to her smelly guest than meets the eye. Downton Abbey's Hugh Bonneville stars, with Sheridan Smith, Johnny Vegas and Isabella Blake-Thomas, and an appearance from Britain's Got Talent winner Pudsey the dog.

programme.title: The Boy in the Dress
programme.desc: Family comedy adapted from David Walliams' children's book about 12-year-old Dennis, an ordinary boy who lives in an ordinary town - but somehow feels different from everyone else. A chance sighting in a fashion magazine introduces him to a whole new world of colour and creativity. But can a boy really wear a dress - and what will his headmaster, dad and friends in the football team think if they find out? Billy Kennedy stars as Dennis, with a supporting cast including Jennifer Saunders, Tim McInnerny, Meera Syal, Steve Speirs, Felicity Montagu, James Buckley and Walliams himself, with a cameo appearance by supermodel Kate Moss.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: This Morning's husband-and-wife presenting duo Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford and TV personality Brian Dowling take part in the quiz show in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they gather, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity. Ben Shephard hosts.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Doctor, the Widow and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: The Time Lord crash-lands on Earth during the Second World War, where he tries to make sure two unfortunate evacuees and their mother have the best Christmas ever. He transports them to a magical land dominated by an enchanted forest - but that is when their troubles really begin. Claire Skinner, Bill Bailey, Arabella Weir and Alexander Armstrong join Matt Smith in the 2011 festive special, inspired by CS Lewis's Narnia stories.

programme.title: Dynamo: Live at the O2
programme.desc: A stage performance by the illusionist, who became the first magician in history to headline London's O2 to an assembled audience of around 10,000 with his critically acclaimed show, Seeing Is Believing. Shrouded in secrecy, the show is the culmination of over 10 years' work and has attracted audiences of over 400,000 people across 100 dates since its inception in October 2015.

programme.title: Billionaire Boy
programme.desc: Family comedy, by David Walliams and Kevin Cecil. Len Spud and his 12-year-old son Joe become billionaires when Len invents a new toilet roll. Len soon starts dating fortysomething hand model Sapphire Diamond, while the butler helps a neglected and unhappy Joe transfer to the local comprehensive where he conceals the facts of his wealth. However, when Len turns up at the school with his son's forgotten homework, the cat is soon out of the bag. John Thomson stars as the inventor, alongside Walliams, Catherine Tate and Rebecca Front, and featuring Warwick Davis and Bryn Terfel as themselves.

programme.title: The Boy in the Dress
programme.desc: Family comedy adapted from David Walliams' children's book about 12-year-old Dennis, an ordinary boy who lives in an ordinary town - but somehow feels different from everyone else. A chance sighting in a fashion magazine introduces him to a whole new world of colour and creativity. But can a boy really wear a dress - and what will his headmaster, dad and friends in the football team think if they find out? Billy Kennedy stars as Dennis, with a supporting cast including Jennifer Saunders, Tim McInnerny, Meera Syal, Steve Speirs, Felicity Montagu, James Buckley and Walliams himself, with a cameo appearance by supermodel Kate Moss.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Former Bond girl Britt Ekland, Loose Women panellist Sherrie Hewson and Dancing on Ice star Robin Cousins take part in the quiz show in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity. Ben Shephard hosts.

programme.desc: When Eric raids the freezer, he leaves the door open and all the food inside thaws out, so his better half Beth throws an impromptu party for friends Cathy, Colin, Ian, Jaz, Christine and Sophie to consume the food before it goes to waste. Everything goes well until Cathy urges Colin to go next door and get something out of their freezer to replace the defrosted food - a whole Scottish salmon. programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit. The trio are also joined by The Voice mentor Will.i am, who takes the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. A furious Cleveland decides he has finally had enough of his stepson's misbehaviour - and threatens to send him to a young offenders' institution if matters do not improve. Animated sitcom, with the voice of Mike Henry.

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: You've Got to Be a Football Hero
programme.desc: Will ends up getting drunk in an effort to compete with an American football hero for Jackie's attentions, but the plan backfires when his fraternity friends play a trick on him. Meanwhile, Ashley learns an important lesson about vanity. Comedy, starring Will Smith and Tyra Banks.

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will's lack of studying catches up with him when he takes an important exam, and Ashley has to face the consequences of staying out late on her first date. Branford Marsalis guest stars as himself.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Carlton becomes manager of the students' campus restaurant, leading to friction between him and Will, who refuses to work under his authority.

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Screams
programme.desc: Football team mascot Carlton is kidnapped by students from a rival college just before a big game. Comedy, starring Will Smith.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The gang celebrate New Year's Eve with a party at Monica and Rachel's flat, while Ross tries to alleviate his loneliness by getting a new room-mate - a monkey. Comedy, starring Courteney Cox and David Schwimmer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The pals plan a surprise party for Rachel, but her recently separated mother and father show up. To keep the parents apart, the gang decides to have two different gatherings. Comedy, guest starring Marlo Thomas (That Girl) and Ron Leibman.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Can't Remember Which Sister
programme.desc: Rachel's attractive and influential new friend sends Ross into a jealous frenzy, while Chandler gets drunk and falls for the curvaceous charms of one of Joey's many sisters - but later cannot remember which one.

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle
programme.desc: LL Cool J and Chrissy Teigen preside over another celebrity musical battle as Hollywood actresses Hayden Panettiere and Eva Longoria compete. They face off to determine who can most adequately fake performing two hit tracks of their choice in front of a live studio audience, featuring renditions of `Lady Marmalade' and Flo Rida and T-Pain's `Low'.

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle
programme.desc: Pop icon Ricky Martin and actress Kate Upton go head to head lip-synching to a song of their choice. Presented by LL Cool J, with commentary from Chrissy Teigen.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where They're Going to Party!
programme.desc: Things start looking up for the gang as Monica gets a career opportunity that is too good to turn down and Rachel is offered a promotion. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler are excited to hear an old friend is coming to visit. Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox star.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Fake Party
programme.desc: Rachel spoils Ross's plans of a romantic last evening with Emily before she returns to England by organising a farewell party and inviting everyone. Meanwhile Phoebe's pregnancy causes her to abandon her vegetarian lifestyle as she craves meat. Comedy, guest starring Helen Baxendale.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Resolutions
programme.desc: The pals announce resolutions for the coming year and Chandler enlists Joey's help so he can kiss Monica at midnight during a New Year's Eve party. American comedy, starring Matthew Perry and Courtney Cox.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel starts taking regular cigarette breaks to ingratiate herself with new boss Kim and colleague Nancy, even though she does not smoke, while Joey competes with Ross's son for a role in a TV commercial. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Gleason (Boogie Nights).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey tries to find the perfect opportunity to kiss Janine, while Ross and Monica resurrect their high-school dance routine for a TV programme. Comedy, guest starring Elle Macpherson.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Halloween Party
programme.desc: Phoebe finds herself attracted to flighty twin sister Ursula's fiance as the gang has fun at Monica's Halloween party. The Bings dress up as Catwoman and a pink bunny, and Rachel tries to kick-start her maternal instincts with a host of trick-or-treaters. Guest starring Sean Penn.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Soap Opera Party
programme.desc: Joey throws a party for the cast of Days of Our Lives, but refuses to invite his pals in case their behaviour embarrasses him. However, the answering machine gives the game away and everyone attends - which is good news for Ross.

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2
programme.desc: A scientist believes he has saved the world from his invention, a machine that accidentally turned water into food. However, he learns the device is still active and has created a race of food/animal hybrids that he must stop from running wild across the world. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Bill Hader, Anna Faris and James Caan.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Worst Best Man Ever
programme.desc: Joey somehow manages to lose Ross's wedding ring at the stag party, while Phoebe's pregnancy causes her to experience violent mood swings. Comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel leave Las Vegas as a married couple, while Phoebe is persuaded to embark on a cross-country adventure with Joey. Comedy, starring David Schwimmer, Jennifer Aniston, Lisa Kudrow and Matt LeBlanc.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Monica and Chandler's Wedding - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The gang continues to search for the missing Chandler, who is still suffering a severe case of premarital jitters. Joey tries desperately to be released from his role in a major film so he can act as minister at the wedding. Gary Oldman and Kathleen Turner guest star.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Phoebe's Birthday Dinner
programme.desc: The pals eagerly look forward to Phoebe's birthday dinner at a fancy restaurant, but Chandler and Monica have an argument just before setting off. Meanwhile, Ross creates a domestic crisis by locking himself and Rachel out of the flat - with Emma inside. Directed by and starring David Schwimmer, with Jennifer Aniston.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Rachel's Phone Number
programme.desc: Chandler returns from Tulsa to visit Monica, but has to hide from Joey after rejecting his offer of free basketball tickets. Rachel goes out with Phoebe for a night on the town, while Ross and Mike find they have nothing in common.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Soap Opera Party
programme.desc: Joey throws a party for the cast of Days of Our Lives, but refuses to invite his pals in case their behaviour embarrasses him. However, the answering machine gives the game away and everyone attends - which is good news for Ross.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Is Fine
programme.desc: Ross tries to put on a brave face and invites Joey and Rachel to dinner with him and Charlie, but gets drunk and makes an embarrassing scene. Frank Jr tries to talk Phoebe into taking care of one of the triplets, while Chandler and Monica learn more about adoption.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where the Stripper Cries
programme.desc: Joey appears on quiz show The $100,000 Pyramid, but his disastrous efforts to answer the questions end up costing his partner the prize money. Meanwhile, the revellers at Phoebe's hen party get a surprise once the stripper shows up. Guest starring Danny DeVito and Donny Osmond.

programme.title: Lee Evans Live at Wembley
programme.desc: A performance by the energetic comedian in front of a sell-out 10,000-strong crowd at Wembley Arena.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre: Hello Wembley
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the comedian at Wembley Arena, where he entertained a sell-out crowd in October 2009, following on from his successful 2008 show Live and Laughing. In a routine centred on his take on life, he discusses wine menus, restaurant etiquette and the condiment hierarchy in the kitchen cupboard.

programme.title: Comedy Store
programme.sub-title: Peter Kay at the Comedy Store
programme.desc: A stand-up performance in which the Bolton comedian talks about taxi drivers, technology, British people abroad and and why the UK is a nation of mimers.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Animal rights activists protest against the use of a cow as the school mascot, so the boys look to come up with an alternative. Kyle and Cartman mount their own unique campaigns and begin recruiting voters, but Stan refuses to take part, prompting the authorities to banish him from the town.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: A department store offering massive discounts opens and all the locals rush to shop there, but before long the town's smaller businesses have to shut down because they cannot compete. Furious, Stan organises a rally against the manager of the new mall - who responds by committing suicide.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys fret when Trent Boyett is released from juvenile prison, five years after they set him up on a case of arson - vowing to hunt them down. Kyle, Cartman and Stan try to enlist the help of the sixth graders to act as bodyguards, but their former nemesis quickly eradicates this line of defence.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The elementary school launches a closed circuit television network, and the boys choose to produce a news bulletin. However, apathy about current affairs leads to poor ratings and the programme is scrapped - until Cartman comes up with a rescue plan.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Paris Hilton arrives in town and opens a store selling memorabilia of herself. Wendy is lost for words when her friends begin idolising the heiress, and finds no reasonable answers to explain why she is so revered, while Butters' parents enter into negotiations to sell him to the star as a pet.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman tries to fly from the roof of his house but falls to the ground, and ends up in hospital with severe head injuries. Police detectives believe he has acquired psychic powers and employ him to help in their hunt for a serial killer who is running amok.

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael has an anti-wrinkle injection, but it has the unfortunate side-effect of leaving his mouth twisted into a permanent smile - which soon gets him into trouble. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.

programme.desc: Michael takes extreme measures to ensure he does not catch the flu from his ailing family - including spraying them with disinfectant and using a 10ft extending grabber to hand Jay her orange juice. Comedy, starring Damon Wayans.

Family comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn and Anjelica Huston.

Comedy, with Martin Lawrence, Nia Long, Paul Giamatti, Jascha Washington, Terrence Dashon Howard and Ella Mitchell. Edited for violence, language and sexual content.

programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Got High

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe is alarmed to learn she has attracted the unwanted attentions of a stalker, and Monica comes up with a plan to deal with her broodiness. American comedy, guest starring David Arquette, with Lisa Kudrow and Courteney Cox.

programme.sub-title: The One with the Truth About London

programme.desc: The gang celebrates Thanksgiving and Monica invites old high-school friend Will, the only student who was fatter than her - unaware of his animosity toward Rachel. Meanwhile, Chandler and Phoebe try to avoid helping in the kitchen and Joey vows to eat an entire turkey. Guest starring Brad Pitt.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a ride in a police car, until the sound of a gunshot causes them to fear for their lives. Meanwhile, Rachel accidentally listens to a telephone message to Ross from Emily. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer.

programme.sub-title: The One with All the Thanksgivings
programme.desc: The pals digest a huge Thanksgiving meal and reminisce about their worst holiday experiences, including the time Chandler's father left his mother in favour of the houseboy, and the occasion in 1987 when a teenage Monica overheard Chandler calling her fat. Guest starring Morgan Fairchild.

programme.sub-title: The One with the Birth Mother
programme.desc: Monica and Chandler travel to Ohio to meet the mother of the baby they plan to adopt. The pregnant mother, Erica, likes them but only because their files got mixed up with a doctor and a female minister. Meanwhile, Joey is set up on a date with one of Phoebe's friends, but soon regrets it when she tries to take some food off his plate, and Ross has a fashion faux pas when he accidently wears women's clothing on a date.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross's girlfriend goes on a wild weekend away, leaving him to worry about what she is getting up to. Rachel longs for a date and Joey's fridge breaks down.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre: Happy & Glorious
programme.desc: A chance to see a show from the popular stand-up star's 2015 tour of the UK and Ireland, recorded as-live at the O2 in London. Returning to a venue he has visited 27 times in the past, more than any other artist in the world, Michael showcases his particular brand of wit, taking aim once again at some of the absurdities of everyday life.

programme.title: Jimmy Carr: Laughing & Joking
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy with the host of 8 Out of 10 Cats, recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo in November, 2013. This eighth live show from the award-winning funnyman is packed with his familiar brand of acerbic one-liners, audience put-downs and near-the-knuckle stories.

Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. To complicate matters further, the missing man's outspoken spouse happens to be the ex-wife of both Gibbs and Fornell. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. After being stationed in Kabul, she became pregnant by a local man called Amir who was later killed in action - and Abby discovers he was the sole male heir of a wealthy family that owns a large tract of land in a politically sensitive part of Afghanistan.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. She identifies the murderer as Seal-turned-assassin Marcellus Dane, who is suspected of working for Casey Stratton - a member of black ops unit Phantom Eight. Guest starring Sarah Jane Morris.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An estate agent and two clients discover the body of Lt Com Maya Burris, a naval attache who had been working in Egypt, and her detective husband Nick arrives on the scene to demand answers. Using documents discovered on the victim's boat, Abby links her to Barry Norton, who is suspected of having sold government secrets to a Middle Eastern terrorist group known as the SRC.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs goes into his favourite diner for a cup of coffee and finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun, forcing him to question choices he has made in the past and present. The action then flashes back a few days to when he and the rest of the team members were investigating the death of a petty officer on board USS Gentry, which has been undergoing repairs in dry dock. The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: Maverick cop Axel Foley returns to Los Angeles when an investigation into a colleague's murder leads him to a Hollywood theme park. He enlists the help of old ally Rosewood to prove the resort is a cover for a major counterfeiting ring connected to a terrorist conspiracy. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Eddie Murphy, Judge Reinhold, Theresa Randle and Bronson Pinchot.

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson set out to track down a pregnant rape victim who has disappeared from hospital and uncover an illegal adoption operation, leading them to pose as husband and wife to obtain the evidence they need to trap those responsible. Meanwhile, ADA Marlowe clashes with Cragen over the lack of protection for the missing woman.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team investigates the rapes of several teenage girls in Central Park, but rookie cop Brad Fletcher jeopardises the case when he rashly apprehends and attacks a suspect. Marlowe lays into the officer for potentially ruining her case with his actions, but she is stunned when Cragen then informs her NYPD records show nobody by the name of Brad Fletcher in the system.

programme.title: Sea Patrol
programme.desc: Charge investigates when a Russian sailor friend and his Swedish companion go missing on a diving trip, and is unconvinced by claims that the pair were attacked by a shark.

programme.title: Numb3rs
programme.desc: Don's team tries to find a group of kidnappers who abducted a wealthy heiress as an act of revenge against her industrialist father. Drama, starring Rob Morrow.

programme.title: Numb3rs
programme.desc: A comic-book convention turns into a crime scene when a robbery leads to the disappearance of a rare publication. American drama, starring Rob Morrow as an FBI agent who recruits his mathematical genius brother to help the Bureau solve crimes in Los Angeles. With David Krumholtz.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to buy bargains galore at home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs goes into his favourite diner for a cup of coffee and finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun, forcing him to question choices he has made in the past and present. The action then flashes back a few days to when he and the rest of the team members were investigating the death of a petty officer on board USS Gentry, which has been undergoing repairs in dry dock. The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy captain wearing a colourful costume underneath his uniform is shot and killed in a flower shop, and further investigation reveals he was leading a double life as a masked vigilante. Vance brings in Tony's ex-fiancee, journalist Wendy Miller, who claims the victim had been trying to expose a scandal, and as the team pursues the case, a real-estate scam is uncovered. Guest starring Perrey Reeves (Entourage).

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy reservist is found dead in his home with marks around his neck, and Gibbs and the team discover he was working on a highly classified case for the department of defence. The circumstances surrounding the man's demise lead the investigators to suspect someone was secretly trying to drive him insane, bringing them into contact with Samantha Ryan, the director of a division specialising in psychological warfare. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Chief petty officer Leland Wiley dies of a heart attack just as he is about to reveal information on elusive arms dealer Agah Bayar. The team discovers the cardiac arrest was caused by someone hacking into a computer monitoring Wiley's pacemaker and increasing his heart rate to 400bpm. Meanwhile, a probationary agent tries to impress Gibbs and win a place on his team. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with Tamer Hassan and Matt L Jones.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Confidential files are leaked by an anonymous hacker, who threatens to release more unless the Navy agrees to renew a contract with a struggling shipbuilding firm. The Navy Secretary suspects the company's owner Philip Wickes is to blame, and asks NCIS to join forces with the PsyOps unit in an elaborate ruse to bring the culprit out of hiding. Meanwhile, Gibbs' colleagues begin to notice his attraction to his opposite number Samantha Ryan. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Vance's brother-in-law Michael Thomas is linked to the murder of a petty officer, and Gibbs is placed under pressure to clear the man's name. Meanwhile, a negative performance review leaves Tony feeling downhearted and he resolves to prove the assessment wrong by being less chatty while on duty. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine lieutenant's body falls from the sky and the team links the man's death to the disappearance of a Navy chaplain thought to have been kidnapped by rebels working with Colombian crime cartels. Ziva and Tony are dispatched to conduct a rescue operation and enlist the help of former Interpol agent Monique Lisson, while Gibbs discovers there was more to the chaplain's outreach mission than meets the eye. Crime drama, guest starring Karina Lombard (The L Word) and Jamie Lee Curtis (A Fish Called Wanda).

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A fire crew discovers a man's body after putting out a raging blaze at a warehouse belonging to a Navy-contracted electronics company, and Gibbs recognises the victim as Carter Plimpton - a former member of an NCIS black-ops unit. Meanwhile, a member of the Baltimore police department helping with the case appears to have a grudge against Tony.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's mission to track the arsonist targeting US Navy facilities appears to end in success when the man in question is killed by a thermite explosion on board the USS Brewer. Meanwhile, Abby studies evidence relating to fire-starter Bruce Johnson, who died when his car exploded, and discovers coded messages in his quarters that indicate he may have been working as part of a larger gang. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. A phone call from the man himself makes it clear he is out for revenge, and Sam Ryan has information as to the motive behind it. Guest starring Richard Schiff (The West Wing).

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to track down wanted terrorist Harper Dearing before another US Navy ship is destroyed, and a desperate Gibbs enlists the aid of a prisoner to draw his target out of hiding. Meanwhile, Palmer is forced to consider putting his nuptials on hold as the stand-off with Dearing becomes heated. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: A New York actor's difficult reputation has rendered him unemployable. When a TV soap advertises a new female role, he disguises himself as a woman for the audition - and wins the part. But the character proves so popular, he is forced to keep up the pretence indefinitely. Comedy, starring Dustin Hoffman, Jessica Lange and Bill Murray. Directed by Sydney Pollack, who makes a cameo appearance as Hoffman's agent.

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: The manager of an apartment complex asks a Wall Street financier to manage pension funds for him and his friends, but the man pockets all the money instead. When he realises the fraudster is going to get away with the crime and the money will never be found, he enlists the help of a professional thief to steal it back. Crime comedy, with Ben Stiller, Eddie Murphy, Alan Alda, Tea Leoni, Casey Affleck and Matthew Broderick.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in to investigate when eight-year-old Nicholas Olsen is kidnapped and discover his mother Sophie is under a restraining order to stay away from him. She denies having anything to do with the abduction, but evidence in her apartment suggests otherwise, and Marlowe accuses her of hiring somebody to snatch her son. Guest starring Isabelle Huppert.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Fin crosses international borders to catch a fugitive rapist, a political tug-of-war derails Barba's legal case, while shocking allegations against Benson lead to the return of an old friend. Ice T stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson's private life comes under scrutiny, and a woman's unusual story of rape divides the team when some of the elements prove hard to believe.(n)

programme.title: Sea Patrol
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward mission to deliver vital medical supplies to remote islands in New Guinea erupts into violence when Dutchy and Swain unwittingly stumble across an explosive power struggle.(n)

programme.title: Numb3rs
programme.desc: A former FBI subcontractor guns down an agent and captures a member of Don's team, holding him hostage in a lift. Desperate to avoid conflict, Charlie suggests a solution to the crisis - but his idea is ignored. Drama, starring Rob Morrow.(n)

programme.title: Numb3rs
programme.desc: Charlie finds his life placed in danger after an interview he gives regarding the disappearance of an investigative reporter attracts the attention of the kidnappers involved. David Krumholtz and Rob Morrow star.(n)

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

Meanwhile, Palmer is forced to consider putting his nuptials on hold as the stand-off with Dearing becomes heated. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The seemingly straightforward murder of a stockbroker plunges Briscoe and Green into the murky world of insider-trading and blackmail, as they learn that the victim led a seedy double life. However, their investigations take on a new dimension when the suspected killer is himself bumped off by a professional hitman. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a white teenager in Harlem seems like an open-and-shut case - until two patrol officers are implicated in the crime. As tensions between residents and investigating officers mount, the Mayor puts pressure on Schiff to make an example of the cops, hoping it will be enough to satisfy ADA McCoy. Drama, starring Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his colleagues investigate a youngster's abduction and find themselves drawn into a dangerous situation at a jeweller's shop while trying to track down the kidnappers. A gun battle ensues - and a member of the team is killed in the line of duty.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man arrested for a shooting decides to represent himself in court - and proves to be far more formidable than expected. Horatio realises the only thing that can put him behind bars is the eyewitness testimony of the victim's son, but is reluctant to put the boy on the stand.(n)

programme.title: Major Crimes
programme.desc: American police drama starring Mary McDonnell as Captain Sharon Raydor, the new head of the Los Angeles Police Department's Major Crimes Division. The squad is still in shock over previous incumbent Chief Johnson's departure, and the incoming leader has the responsibility of trying to gain the trust of the team under her control.(n)

programme.title: Major Crimes
programme.desc: There are growing pains within the unit as it works to obtain justice in a brutal homicide, and Raydor has to step in to sort out hierarchical issues involving Taylor and Provenza - the changes within the department may be more than the latter can accept. Starring Mary McDonnell and Graham Patrick Martin.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The aftermath of Harper Dearing's bomb attack on the NCIS headquarters dominates proceedings. As rescue crews sift through the debris searching for survivors, Abby, Gibbs, McGee and Vance are accounted for, but Ziva and Tony are trapped in a lift. Dearing makes contact after his ex-wife is taken into custody, enabling his car to be traced to an abandoned lot - and the agents arrive just in time to see the vehicle blow up. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate the death of an armoury employee when divers find her body in a car at the bottom of a lake. The victim had been reported missing since she was evacuated before the blast at NCIS headquarters. Meanwhile, crisis counsellor Miles Wolf carries out psychological assessments of all the agents in the wake of the bombings. Guest starring Steve Valentine (Crossing Jordan).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Fin crosses international borders to catch a fugitive rapist, a political tug-of-war derails Barba's legal case, while shocking allegations against Benson lead to the return of an old friend. Ice T stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson's private life comes under scrutiny, and a woman's unusual story of rape divides the team when some of the elements prove hard to believe.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins and Carisi investigate when a man is castrated and left for dead. Langan has devastating news for Benson.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Runaways
programme.desc: Return of the fantasy adventure. The kids struggle with their new lives, until they find a hideout. Alex goes to work for Darius while PRIDE plots to kill Jonah.

programme.title: Primeval
programme.desc: A school detention class is thrown into chaos when a teacher is killed and the pupils run riot - unaware that a deadly therocephalian is stalking the corridors looking for its next meal. ARC's attempts to capture the creature are hampered when youngsters hack into the automatic locking system, but the school lab proves invaluable when an even greater threat emerges. Elsewhere, Abby's menagerie is under threat. Hannah Spearritt and Andrew-Lee Potts star.

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
programme.desc: A beautiful substitute instantly drives all the male Sunnydale students wild with desire - including Xander. None of them realises she is actually a giant praying mantis on the hunt for young males to mate with and feed on. Only Buffy knows the truth - but she has a hard time convincing anyone else.

programme.title: The Outpost
programme.desc: Talon, Janzo and Garret venture into forbidden territory in search of the Book of Names, and an army is led to the Outpost Gates.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Runaways
programme.desc: The Pride desperately tries to clean up the latest mess without involving Jonah, but the group may not be able to handle it without help.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to buy bargains galore at home.(n)

programme.title: Primeval
programme.desc: Reunited with an old friend from university, Connor encounters a deadly creature terrorising the docks and finds evidence of a fresh kill. Abby and Matt arrive to help catch the beast, leading to a tense chase through a container yard. Later, Connor hopes his brave efforts will be rewarded and returns to ARC to fight for his job. Andrew-Lee Potts, Hannah Spearritt and Ciaran McMenamin star.(n)

programme.title: Tom's Midnight Garden
programme.desc: A boy is sent to live with his elderly aunt and uncle, and discovers a magical hiding place, which appears to him only when the clock strikes 13. He finds the people there cannot see him - except for one girl, with whom he forms a close friendship. Children's drama, based on Philippa Pearce's novel, starring Anthony Way, Florence Hoath, Nigel Le Vaillant, Greta Scacchi, Liz Smith and Joan Plowright.(n)

programme.title: The Land That Time Forgot
programme.desc: A Caribbean cruise ship is left shipwrecked by a mysterious storm and the survivors find themselves stranded on an island inhabited by dinosaurs and a host of other deadly prehistoric creatures. Fantasy adventure, directed by and starring C Thomas Howell. With Timothy Bottoms, Lindsey McKeon and Darren Dalton.(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: Tiny emotionless aliens on a mission to save their homeworld travel to Earth aboard a spacecraft in human form, where they plan to drain the planet's oceans. However, the miniature explorers have a change of heart when they encounter Man - and are unprepared for their vessel falling in love. Sci-fi comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Mars Attacks
programme.desc: The inhabitants of Earth leap into action to repel an impending invasion by a seemingly invincible Martian army, which possesses superior weaponry, a thirst for destruction and a wicked sense of humour. Tim Burton's sci-fi comedy, starring Jack Nicholson, Glenn Close, Pierce Brosnan, Annette Bening, Natalie Portman, Danny DeVito and Tom Jones.(n)

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the ability to teleport, a talent he cleverly exploits to rob banks undetected while living a life of luxury all over the world. However, he soon learns he is not the only one with this power - and that a secret society of religious fanatics is determined to wipe out him and all of his kind. Fantasy thriller, with Hayden Christensen, Jamie Bell and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The Jackal
programme.desc: An assassin whose identity is shrouded in mystery is hired by a Russian crime syndicate to kill the director of the FBI. As the American and Russian authorities join forces to stop him, they are forced to turn to the only man able to identify the hitman - an imprisoned IRA terrorist, who offers his help in return for his freedom. Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Richard Gere and Sidney Poitier.(n)

programme.title: The Shepherd
programme.desc: A former homicide detective takes up a new post as a US border patrol agent. He makes it his mission to capture a group of veteran Navy Seals plotting to smuggle a large consignment of heroin into the country from Mexico, using innocent migrants being wired with explosives to cause a diversion. Action thriller, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Scott Adkins and Stephen Lord.(n)

programme.title: Lesbian Vampire Killers
programme.desc: Fletch and Jimmy head off on a weekend getaway and stumble across a town in which all of the women are cursed to become bloodthirsty vampires. It is not long before the men realise that in order to avoid becoming prey to the killers, they must become the hunters. Comedy horror, starring James Corden, Mathew Horne and Paul McGann.(n)

programme.title: The Captains Close Up
programme.desc: William Shatner offers a retrospective exploration of Avery Brooks' Captain Benjamin Sisko in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine.(n)

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
programme.desc: Buffy needs something normal in her life, so, much to Giles's horror, she auditions for the school's cheerleading squad. A series of unpleasant accidents disrupts the try-outs, leading to suspicions that a witch is using black magic to eliminate the competition. A girl under pressure from her former cheerleader mother seems the most likely suspect - but the truth is far stranger.(n)

programme.title: The Outpost
programme.desc: Talon, Garret and Janzo are ambushed and the Book of Names falls into enemy hands, and the Prime Order settles into its new oppressive rule.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Runaways
programme.desc: The group feels more fractured than ever when Molly arrives with a devastating message from her parents. The kids must stop their parents before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to buy bargains galore at home.(n)

programme.title: Primeval
programme.desc: Matt inadvertently brings back a mysterious woman trying to escape through an anomaly ARC is investigating, but its sealing off means she has been left stranded - along with two undetected arboreal dinosaurs. Later, after Abby and Becker have managed to corner one of the deadly creatures in a theatre, Matt and the woman are forced to undergo a terrifying confrontation with the remaining beast. Hannah Spearritt, Ciaran McMenamin and Ruth Bradley star.(n)

programme.title: Who Am I
programme.desc: As a hacker's intrusions become more daring, he finds himself the object of increasing interest from the authorities. Mystery drama, starring Tom Schilling, Elyas M'Barek and Hannah Herzsprung.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: Generations
programme.desc: USS Enterprise Captain Jean-Luc Picard must stop a deranged genius obsessed with gaining access to a mysterious energy source - regardless of the threat to entire civilisations that lie in his path. Help arrives from an unlikely quarter - his supposedly long dead predecessor Captain James T Kirk. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Patrick Stewart, William Shatner, Malcolm McDowell and Whoopi Goldberg.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: First Contact
programme.desc: Captain Jean-Luc Picard and the crew of the Enterprise face their deadliest enemies, the Borg, who travel back in time in an attempt to change Earth's history. The starship follows on a mission to foil their plan, but the vessel is taken over by members of the cyborg collective, leaving Picard consumed by a desire for revenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner, James Cromwell and Alice Krige.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: Insurrection
programme.desc: Captain Picard and the Enterprise crew uncover a conspiracy by their own superiors and a sinister alien race to take over a peaceful world and exploit its power to prolong life. However, the crew is forced to defy Federation orders and turns renegade to protect the planet's inhabitants. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Patrick Stewart, F Murray Abraham, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner and Michael Dorn.(n)

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot is framed for the murder of starving civilians - and ends up being forced to take part in a brutal TV game show in which a succession of gadget-wielding killers hunt him on the streets of Los Angeles. Sci-fi action adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Yaphet Kotto, Maria Conchita Alonso and Richard Dawson.(n)

programme.title: Twelve Monkeys
programme.desc: A time traveller from 2035 journeys back to the 1990s to discover the cause of a deadly disease that ravaged the world, only to be thrown into an asylum. He meets a fellow patient who may hold the key to his mission, but the longer he spends in the past, the more he comes to question whether he really is from the future or simply delusional. Terry Gilliam's sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Brad Pitt, Madeleine Stowe and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Runaways
programme.desc: Return of the fantasy adventure. The kids struggle with their new lives, until they find a hideout. Alex goes to work for Darius while PRIDE plots to kill Jonah.(n)

Elsewhere, Abby's menagerie is under threat. Hannah Spearritt and Andrew-Lee Potts star.(n)

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
programme.sub-title: Never Kill a Boy on the First Date
programme.desc: Giles discovers an ancient prophecy is about to come true, and a powerful new foe known as the Anointed One will soon come into being - but Buffy is more concerned with having finally got a date with a handsome classmate she has a crush on. The exasperated watcher goes in search of the Anointed One himself, only to end up having to fight off a band of vampires.(n)

programme.title: The Outpost
programme.desc: Talon, Garret and Janzo return to find the Outpost very different from how they left it. Talon faces Dred, but is torn between revenge and saving her friends.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Runaways
programme.desc: The team face off with their parents, but realise they are in over their heads when Jonah unexpectedly arrives with a new game plan.(n)

ARC's attempts to capture the creature are hampered when youngsters hack into the automatic locking system, but the school lab proves invaluable when an even greater threat emerges. Elsewhere, Abby's menagerie is under threat. Hannah Spearritt and Andrew-Lee Potts star.(n)

programme.title: Primeval
programme.desc: Connor and Abby are sent to investigate unusual anomaly signals in a coastal village, where they uncover the existence of a supposedly mythical labyrinthodont that has turned its attentions to the local fishermen after attacking cows. Back at ARC, Lester and Jess learn that Emily has been kidnapped by Ethan, prompting Matt to make a dash to a cemetery - where he faces a difficult choice. Hannah Spearritt and Andrew-Lee Potts star.(n)

programme.title: 12 Disasters
programme.desc: A dark star appears in the sky on Christmas Eve, leaving mankind convinced the end of the world is nigh. A series of devastating natural disasters occuring all around the world seemingly validates the belief, and it falls to a small band of heroes to prevent the apocalypse. Thriller, with Ed Quinn and Magda Apanowicz.(n)

programme.title: The Librarian 3: The Curse of the Judas Chalice

programme.desc: When the King family purchases a new horse, Felix King convinces Alec King to let him take over care of their elderly horse, Blackie. In order to afford Blackie's care, Felix starts a delivery service - which Alec hopes will help Felix learn life lessons.

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: Alec is elected to the school board and hires a new member of staff - but does not realise he is an out-of-work actor only pretending to be a teacher. Christopher Lloyd guest stars.

programme.title: Royal Stories
programme.desc: Examining the history of younger siblings to the heir to the throne and their roles in the royal household. Narrated by Samantha Bond.

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: An orphan is sent to live with her uncle in his forbidding Yorkshire mansion, where she meets her bedridden cousin - a boy she knew nothing about. She also stumbles across a marvellous but neglected garden, and sets about nursing them both back to health, with the help of a lad from a nearby village. Children's drama, based on Frances Hodgson Burnett's book, with Kate Maberly, Heydon Prowse, Andrew Knott, Maggie Smith and John Lynch.(c)

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American businessman travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris tries to hire Hercule Poirot to discover the source of the death threats that have been made against him. The sleuth refuses, but wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow - and there is no shortage of suspects among the passengers. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Sean Connery and Vanessa Redgrave.(c)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor is found dead on Halloween with a stake through her heart and Hobson reveals she shared a house with the victim in her university days. A medium visits Lewis claiming to have foreseen the tragedy, and ghostly messages spelled out in fridge magnet letters start appearing in a house occupied by four students. As the detective struggles with the possibility his friend is somehow implicated in the crime, a tale of jealousy and revenge begins to unfold. Rupert Graves (Sherlock) and Niamh Cusack (Heartbeat) guest star. Last in the series.(c)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The body of Dr Stephen Black is found on an Oxford tour bus, and the detectives are led to sprawling Crevecoeur Hall, where Hathaway spent much of his childhood. As he investigates, he is drawn to Scarlett Mortmaigne, the glamorous daughter of the estate's owner, but when another corpse is discovered, Hathaway's refusal to believe the family is involved threatens to test his relationship with Lewis to breaking point. Guest starring Nathaniel Parker (The Inspector Lynley Mysteries), Juliet Aubrey (Primeval) and Stella Gonet (Holby City), with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(c)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis.(c)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: When Jacko Argyle is executed for the murder of his stepmother, his family attempt to put the tragedy behind them, until a stranger provides an alibi that proves Jacko's innocence. Suspicion falls on every member of the household when it transpires that they all are much happier since the death of the matriarch. Miss Marple is conveniently on hand to solve the mystery. Geraldine McEwan stars, with Juliet Stevenson, Denis Lawson and Alison Steadman.(c)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Clapham Cook
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth.(c)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The newly promoted Detective Sergeant Morse investigates when a famous international thief tries to steal a Faberge egg from an auction. The case leads to the gruesome murders of an academic and a gangster, and Morse is convinced the deaths are the work of the same man. As he struggles with his new responsibilities, he finds himself forced to mentor a younger partner (played by Poldark's Lewis Peek).

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the remains of a teenager are found half-buried in a wood, Vera finds herself investigating a 30-year-old mystery. Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners' strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?(c)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Brenda Blethyn. The detective investigates a fire that rips through a holiday park on the Northumberland coast, destroying three cabins. A young woman's body is discovered and the resort's owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison.(c)

programme.desc: Documentary examining how prince William has become one of the most popular members of the Royal family in the eyes of the British public. Last in the series.

programme.title: Goodbye Mr Chips
programme.desc: Martin Clunes stars as an earnest Latin master working at the Brookfield School of the 1880s, where he meets and marries his true love Kathie and finds himself touched by politics, grief and the utter devastation of World War One. Charting more than 50 years of one man's extraordinary life, the story ends in the 1930s, as a wise, elderly and much-loved Mr Chipping lives out his last days in retirement. Frank Delaney's adaptation of James Hilton's timeless classic, which has never been out of print since first appearing as a magazine serialisation in 1934, and for which Robert Donat whipped an Oscar from under the nose of Gone with the Wind's Clark Gable in the 1939 film production. Also starring Victoria Hamilton, Conleth Hill and Patrick Malahide.(c)

programme.title: Goodnight Mister Tom
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in this adaptation of Michelle Magorian's wartime novel as Tom Oakley, an irascible widower whose life is changed for ever when nine-year-old London evacuee Willie is billeted in his cottage. The youngster takes to village life and the pair develop a strong bond - which looks set to be broken when Willie's tyrannical mother summons him back to the capital. Co-starring Nick Robinson and Annabelle Apsion.(c)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis.(c)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Weatherill and Sister Brigid take the Ormerod children on a family day out to Peasholm Park to see a naval re-enactment show, but the trip ends in disaster. Meanwhile, Dr Ellis risks getting too involved with a patient who is in trouble with the law, and Lizzie sets out to improve her career prospects. Starring Amy Robbins, Linda Armstrong, Neil McDermott and Michelle Hardwick.(c)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A clairvoyant at Whitby Funfair gives a bride-to-be cold feet about her imminent nuptials. Meanwhile, Bellamy is persuaded to cover at the pub, and is almost caught serving drinks after hours, while a new policeman in the village is suspected of being an imposter. Rural drama, starring Ruth Platt, Robert Hands, Mark Jordan and Craig Heaney.(c)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steph asks Phyllis to continue working for them, Jack discovers proof that Joss is not really Vera's father. Meanwhile, Des is furious when he has the Italian message translated.(c)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Vera is adamant that Joss is her dad. Meanwhile, Jackie decides she wants to marry in a registry office, and Des discovers Clive Parnell been on holiday with Steph.(c)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A walk in the woods leads to tragedy for Emily Simpson, who witnesses something unsettling before being found dead in her cottage by old friend Lucy Bellringer. Convinced natural causes are not to blame, Lucy calls in DCI Barnaby and Sergeant Troy, whose investigation eventually uncovers sinister long-buried secrets. John Nettles stars, with Rosalie Crutchley, Jonathan Firth and Emily Mortimer.(c)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A clairvoyant at Whitby Funfair gives a bride-to-be cold feet about her imminent nuptials. Meanwhile, Bellamy is persuaded to cover at the pub, and is almost caught serving drinks after hours, while a new policeman in the village is suspected of being an imposter. Rural drama, starring Ruth Platt, Robert Hands, Mark Jordan and Craig Heaney.(c)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: While staying in an opulent hotel, courtesy of Grady's fraternity brother Gary, Jessica becomes embroiled in a fight to clear Grady of a woman's murder, which is tied to Gary's past. Janet Leigh guest stars, alongside Angela Lansbury.(c)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Oxford plays host to a veteran film star, in town to visit a local cinema. However, a mysterious death casts a sinister pall over the occasion, and offers the newly promoted DS Endeavour Morse a fresh case to pursue. Meanwhile, a family visit puts DCI Thursday's hospitality to the test. Inspector Morse prequel, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When a body is dredged up from a slurry pit on a remote farm, the investigation forces owner Danny Pryor to admit he has a number of illegal Serbian workers on the payroll. A faded tattoo identifies the victim as Jack Reeves, a young man from the local travelling community, but what is his connection to the immigrants? As the case unfolds, Vera and her team must connect the dots between Jack and a wounded Serbian, and expose the tragic truth at the heart of Pryor Farm. With Mark Bonnar, Mark Womack and Jim Sturgeon.(c)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the remains of a teenager are found half-buried in a wood, Vera finds herself investigating a 30-year-old mystery. Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners' strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?(c)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The detective's latest case presents him with a baffling conundrum in the shape of two seemingly random murders, with the victims coming from very different ends of the social spectrum - one is a countess, and the other a showgirl. His investigation soon reveals a dark secret that is an unexpected connection between the two women, both of whom have past experiences involving the same hotel in Nice. Rowan Atkinson makes his fourth appearance as the French detective from Georges Simenon's series of novels.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Affair at the Victory Ball
programme.desc: The sleuth is invited to attend a masquerade ball dressed as someone famous and modestly goes as himself - and finds time amid the revelry to solve the murder of aristocratic fellow guest Lord Cronshaw. David Suchet stars.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby
programme.desc: The Belgian detective looks forward to a quiet Christmas, but is disturbed by the Foreign Office when an Egyptian prince loses a famous ruby - after making the mistake of lending it to a mysterious woman. Guest starring Stephanie Cole, Nigel Le Vaillant and Tariq Alibai.

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.sub-title: But When She Was Bad, She Was Horrid - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sara is held hostage by a gang of criminals who have mistaken her for the thief she swapped places with. Meanwhile, the young crook is stealing from Sara's family.

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: When the King family purchases a new horse, Felix King convinces Alec King to let him take over care of their elderly horse, Blackie. In order to afford Blackie's care, Felix starts a delivery service - which Alec hopes will help Felix learn life lessons.

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: Alec is elected to the school board and hires a new member of staff - but does not realise he is an out-of-work actor only pretending to be a teacher. Christopher Lloyd guest stars.
