programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Royal Stories
programme.desc: Examining the history of younger siblings to the heir to the throne and their roles in the royal household. Narrated by Samantha Bond.

programme.title: Holiday on the Buses
programme.desc: Bus driver Stan and conductor Jack are fired and wind up working at a holiday camp in Wales, where they fall foul of the security officer - none other than their old adversary Inspector Blake, who has also lost his job and been forced into alternative employment. Comedy based on the 1970s sitcom, starring Reg Varney, Bob Grant, Stephen Lewis, Anna Karen and Doris Hare.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Buses
programme.desc: Chirpy bus driver Stan Butler lands himself in trouble as he struggles to raise enough money to marry his girlfriend, and on top of training his unemployed brother-in-law for a job at the depot he has to contend with an officious new manager. Comedy based on the sitcom, starring Reg Varney, Stephen Lewis, Bob Grant, Michael Robbins, Anna Karen and Doris Hare.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The master of Gresham College, amateur astronomer Andrew Crompton, is found dead at the Oxford University observatory, and Lewis finds there are numerous suspects, from senior academics to college scouts. Laura Hobson's involvement with a local orchestra helps her give the detective inside information on the complex relationships within the close-knit community, and Hathaway's sharp mind cracks an astronomical conundrum as the team slowly unravels the riddle of the victim's death. Guest starring Sophie Ward (Heartbeat), Diana Quick (Brideshead Revisited) and Robert Hardy (Cornelius Fudge in the Harry Potter films).

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new sculpture park, but when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson are called to investigate. However, they must deal with an apparently unexplainable broken locket found near the scene of the crime, a host of suspects, and a complex web of deception. As the crime solving duo inspect further, they find they have to get creative to solve a case where art imitates death and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A Saint's bones are discovered during an archaeological dig, causing a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. However, when the dig's leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson are presented with a complex investigation as they hunt for the perpetrator. As the duo unearth more evidence, they soon discover that it is not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Fiona Dolman and Malcolm Sinclair.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual harvest fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death arrive in the Midsomer village of Whitcombe Mallet. But when the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson, along with the expertise of forensic pathologist Kam Karimore, must unravel a complex feud from the past. However, nothing is as it seems, and they are in a race against time as they work to solve the case. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk and Fiona Dolman. Last in the series.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The newly promoted Detective Sergeant Morse investigates when a famous international thief tries to steal a Faberge egg from an auction. The case leads to the gruesome murders of an academic and a gangster, and Morse is convinced the deaths are the work of the same man. As he struggles with his new responsibilities, he finds himself forced to mentor a younger partner (played by Poldark's Lewis Peek).

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Brenda Blethyn. The detective investigates a fire that rips through a holiday park on the Northumberland coast, destroying three cabins. A young woman's body is discovered and the resort's owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is brought in to investigate when a former Met police officer is stabbed to death outside a nightclub in Newcastle. The team initially suspects a crime of passion after it emerges the victim had recently rekindled his affair with his childhood sweetheart, whose husband has a history of violence. However, Vera uncovers evidence pointing to a more complex case involving inside information and the hostile takeover of a brewery. What did the deceased find out that cost him his life? Guest starring Jill Halfpenny, Christine Bottomley, Ralph Ineson and Liam Cunningham. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Royal Stories
programme.desc: A look at the life of Diana, Princess of Wales, revealing how she proved a controversial figure and examining the conspiracy theories surrounding her death.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: An orphan is sent to live with her uncle in his forbidding Yorkshire mansion, where she meets her bedridden cousin - a boy she knew nothing about. She also stumbles across a marvellous but neglected garden, and sets about nursing them both back to health, with the help of a lad from a nearby village. Children's drama, based on Frances Hodgson Burnett's book, with Kate Maberly, Heydon Prowse, Andrew Knott, Maggie Smith and John Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American businessman travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris tries to hire Hercule Poirot to discover the source of the death threats that have been made against him. The sleuth refuses, but wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow - and there is no shortage of suspects among the passengers. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Sean Connery and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor is found dead on Halloween with a stake through her heart and Hobson reveals she shared a house with the victim in her university days. A medium visits Lewis claiming to have foreseen the tragedy, and ghostly messages spelled out in fridge magnet letters start appearing in a house occupied by four students. As the detective struggles with the possibility his friend is somehow implicated in the crime, a tale of jealousy and revenge begins to unfold. Rupert Graves (Sherlock) and Niamh Cusack (Heartbeat) guest star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The body of Dr Stephen Black is found on an Oxford tour bus, and the detectives are led to sprawling Crevecoeur Hall, where Hathaway spent much of his childhood. As he investigates, he is drawn to Scarlett Mortmaigne, the glamorous daughter of the estate's owner, but when another corpse is discovered, Hathaway's refusal to believe the family is involved threatens to test his relationship with Lewis to breaking point. Guest starring Nathaniel Parker (The Inspector Lynley Mysteries), Juliet Aubrey (Primeval) and Stella Gonet (Holby City), with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.desc: When Jacko Argyle is executed for the murder of his stepmother, his family attempt to put the tragedy behind them, until a stranger provides an alibi that proves Jacko's innocence. Suspicion falls on every member of the household when it transpires that they all are much happier since the death of the matriarch. Miss Marple is conveniently on hand to solve the mystery. programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: The duo investigate the strange deaths of several astronomers whose bodies have been mysteriously bleached white, and encounter an eccentric society dedicated to establishing contact with aliens from Venus. Jon Pertwee guest stars in the series' first colour episode.(c)

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: Part one of two. Theo is forced to reopen a long-forgotten case, and enlists the help of an old flame, hoping she might jog his memory. Detective drama, guest starring Diane Baker.(c)

programme.desc: A series of damning reports claims police officers are not playing by the book, so Regan poses as an ex-con and heads to a club frequented by two officers suspected of running a protection racket and taking bribes from villains to release them. John Thaw stars.(c)

programme.desc: Doyle teams up with a Hong Kong cop, who is in London trailing a Triad gang supplying drugs to US army personnel in Germany while operating an international protection racket. programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed and Mrs Peel investigate a spate of murders, and discover a ruthless businessman has been killing his rivals to gain a competitive edge. Vintage adventures, starring Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg.(c)

programme.desc: Hijackers take over a plane, little realising they are exposing themselves and the passengers to a deadly virus - leaving Quincy in a race against time to save their lives. Crime drama, starring Jack Klugman and Robert Ito.(c)

programme.sub-title: Bring Me the Head of Arthur Daley
programme.desc: A car he sold in 1970 returns to haunt Arthur - who ends up being framed for crimes he did not commit. Drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster.(c)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 investigates a consortium building a lethal fighter plane in eastern Europe, that appears willing to kill to supress publication of the aircraft's appalling safetly record. Lynda Bellingham guest stars, with Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins.(c)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A youth is arrested after an elderly money-lender is brutally assaulted and robbed. His mother asks Regan, an old friend, to intervene. Though it is later proved he got a legitimate loan and is innocent of theft, the youngster finds himself being blackmailed after falling foul of some very dangerous individuals. Karl Howman guest stars, with John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.(c)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan, Secret Eaters presenter Anna Richardson, TV survivalist Ray Mears and Coronation Street star Jane Danson (Leanne Tilsley) compete to win thousands of pounds for charity by taking on one of the show's resident trivia experts in a test of their general knowledge. However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh asks the questions.(c)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade investigates the stories behind supposedly deadly freshwater creatures, beginning by examining whether piranhas deserve their fearsome reputation. He travels to Brazil to swim in the Amazon with the fish and incites them into a feeding frenzy, before tracking down survivors and eyewitnesses of attacks.(c)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: America boasts a species of fish reputed to have committed a number of violent attacks on humans. The alligator gar is said to be as vicious as a shark and as large as an alligator. Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade heads to Texas on a hunt to uncover the truth about the notorious creature.(c)

programme.title: Passenger 57
programme.desc: After his wife is shot dead during a robbery, a cop hands in his badge and takes up a job offer from an old friend to be a security adviser for a major transatlantic airline. programme.desc: Seven people who are alone in London on Christmas eve turn to an escort agency for comfort. However, things do not work out as simply as planned, as they wrestle with their personal demons and endure traumatic experiences of violence, racism and crime. Drama, starring Maria O'Brien and David Dixon.

programme.title: The Guv'nor
programme.desc: Documentary about the life of bare-knuckle fighter Lenny McLean, told from the point of view of his son, exploring his unusual rise to fame as an author and actor.

programme.title: Food Junkies
programme.desc: Food busker John Quilter makes smoked salmon tagliatelle, while DJ BBQ gets stuck into some American-style ribs. Plus, the Soul Food Sisters host a supper club in Tottenham.

programme.desc: The Dumpling sisters prepare market chicken noodles and Joey Bones samples three kebabs. Meanwhile, Simon Deeprose makes a Shorefire Ditch.

programme.desc: The boys build a submarine to look for treasure underwater, but run into a band of pirates and a hungry sea dragon.

programme.title: Richmond Park: National Nature Reserve
programme.desc: Documentary about the nature reserve, exploring the area's wildlife and plants and encouraging visitors to help preserve the park. With David Attenborough.

programme.title: King George VI: The Man Behind The King's Speech
programme.desc: Documentary about the king who was unexpectedly thrust into the role and led the nation during the Second World War in the face of personal limitations.

programme.title: The Long Day Closes
programme.desc: Director Terence Davies' semi-autobiographical drama, about a lonely post-war childhood in Liverpool. A montage of evocative snapshots recalls the confusion of a boy on the brink of adolescence - and his escape into the world of movies. Starring Marjorie Yates, Leigh McCormack, Anthony Watson and Nicholas Lamont.

programme.desc: Memorable moments from the silent comedy icon's greatest movies.

Comedy directed by Gerald Thomas of Carry On fame and starring Leslie Phillips, Joan Sims, Charles Hawtrey, Ted Ray, Jean Kent and Julia Lockwood.

programme.desc: A large furry bear arrives from the zoo to take up temporary residence with a little girl, Tilly, and her parents. Children's animation based on the Raymond Briggs tale, with the vocal talents of Charlotte Church.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Turner's House
programme.desc: The restoration of the artist's home, featuring a look at the work of the many craftsmen whose skills brought the conservation project to a successful conclusion.(n)

programme.title: Face Facts - The Truth About Botox
programme.desc: Presenter Kirsten O'Brien explores the world of Botox and dermal fillers, looking at how they work, and with cosmetic injections growing more widespread, she investigates the risks associated with their use. She also examines DIY kits that can be purchased online.(n)

programme.title: Mud Men
programme.desc: Steve Brooker and Johnny Vaughan hunt for medieval and Tudor treasure at Fulham Palace, and get an archery lesson from actor Robert Hardy.(n)

programme.desc: Coverage of the event from Central London, featuring thousands of performers and floats from all around the world.(n)

programme.title: Miss World
programme.desc: Coverage of the 68th edition of the annual beauty pageant, which this year comes from China.(n)

programme.title: Food Junkies
programme.desc: A chilli compilation, with Kerryann Dunlop preparing fried chicken, DJ BBQ visiting the best chilli eateries in London, and Simon Deeprose making a Shorefire Ditch. Plus, a jerk chicken legend.(n)

programme.title: Rich, Russian and Living in London
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of wealthy Russians who have chosen to make London their home, looking at why they favoured the city and their obsessions with the English education system, polo and the monarchy. The film follows an art collector, an entrepreneur who says he was chased out of Russia for his liberal views and growing bank balance, and two debutantes preparing for the glitz and glamour of the prestigious Russian ball. The programme also offers an insight into the life of a leading Russian supermodel.(n)

programme.title: London: A Tale of Two Cities with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: The historian examines how London coped with a series of disastrous events in the 17th century, including the Great Fire, the Plague and the Civil War, and became one of Europe's most powerful cities. He uses information from surveys taken by chroniclers at the beginning and end of the century to explore the qualities that enabled Londoners to thrive, and explains how events of the period laid the foundations for the English capital's success.(n)

programme.title: Hilary and Jackie
programme.desc: Biopic of world-famous cellist Jacqueline du Pre, focusing on her relationship with sister Hilary and following her torrid affair with her brother-in-law, her tumultuous personal life and the battle against multiple sclerosis that threatened to end her career. Starring Emily Watson, Rachel Griffiths, James Frain and David Morrissey.(n)

programme.title: Blue Steel
programme.desc: A police officer shoots an armed robber, but is suspended from duty when the criminal's gun cannot be found. The weapon has been stolen from the crime scene by a stockbroker who becomes obsessed with the incident, and begins dating the cop while secretly using the gun to carry out a murder spree. Kathryn Bigelow's thriller, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Ron Silver and Clancy Brown.(n)

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The first of three programmes about the wildlife, landscape and culture in different areas of the country explores the Sierra Madre mountains, and reveals how this rugged landscape has shaped the nation. This chain of peaks includes several volcanoes and is home to a wide variety of animals, including black bears, monarch butterflies, orchid bees and quetzals. The programme also visits the ruins of an ancient Aztec shrine and the blue agave plant which grows in the mountains is used in making tequila.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.sub-title: Wild Mexico: Forests of the Maya
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. The region also holds a secret that is the key to how Mexico's people and animals are able to survive during the country's dry season.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.

programme.title: Wild Japan
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the wildlife of rural Japan's mountains, rainforests, beaches and swamps, beginning with Honshu, Japan's largest island.

programme.title: Wild Japan
programme.desc: The tropical Southwest Islands in the south of Japan, which are home to volcanoes and fierce typhoons.

programme.title: Wild Japan
programme.desc: The wildlife of rural Japan's mountains, rainforests and beaches, where the climate can shift drastically from icy cold winters to tropical summers.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: A group of experts joins adventurer George Kourounis to investigate avalanches in the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Forces of Nature with Brian Cox
programme.desc: The physicist goes on a grand tour of the planet to explain how the Earth's beauty is created by just a handful of forces, beginning by examining the diversity of shapes in the natural world. Off the coast of Canada, Brian explains how massive icebergs that surge down from Greenland and into shipping lanes of the Atlantic emerge due to a powerful yet infinitesimal force of nature, while revealing how honeycombs made by bees in Nepal to store their precious honey conceal a mathematical rule.

programme.title: Forces of Nature with Brian Cox
programme.desc: The physicist charts the Earth's journey through space, taking to the air in a fighter jet to race the spin of the planet and reverse the passage of the day. In Brazil, a professional surfer rides a monstrous wave surges up the Amazon River, marking the world's constant dance with the Moon, while the harsh winter in Greenland brings opportunity to the Inuit people who live there, and Brian explains how comprehending the motion and speed of Earth brings an understanding of the nature of space and time itself.

programme.title: Forces of Nature with Brian Cox
programme.desc: The physicist examines the building blocks of life that have been taken from the Earth's elements, including the pure sulphur mined in the heart of a volcano in Indonesia. On a precipitous dam wall in Italy, mountain goats seek out the chemicals essential to their survival, while in a Japanese bay, Brian explains how the dazzling display of thousands of glowing squid shows how life has utilised the planet's chemistry for its own ends.

programme.title: Forces of Nature with Brian Cox
programme.desc: The physicist concludes his journey by examining the effects of light interacting with the Earth, travelling to Iceland to witness a moonbow - the band of colours released when moonbeams are refracted by the spray of a waterfall. He then visits the site of an enormous outpouring of lava to explain why hot things glow red, and reveals how the different colours of light energy from the sun transform the plains of the Serengeti in Tanzania and drive the migration of humpback whales to the Caribbean each year.

programme.title: Wild Colombia with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The wildlife expert searches for anacondas, the biggest snakes in Colombia, in the flooded forests of the Amazon.(n)

programme.title: Dino Gangs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dr Phil Currie goes on a quest to prove that Tyrannosaurus rex were more intelligent and far more dangerous than ever imagined, and that they hunted in deadly, killer packs. With his groundbreaking new findings and extensive research, the palaeontologist and dino hunter challenges the very foundations of traditional dinosaur theories.(n)

programme.title: Dino Gangs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Phil Currie explores the hunting behaviour of the Tyrannosaurus rex, arguing the creatures worked in packs and tore their prey to shreds in frenzied attacks. Dr Currie journeys to some of the most remote and inhospitable places on the planet in search of evidence that may reveal how just how brutally the tyrant lizard king lorded over their domain, and why their reign of terror lasted so long.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: Documentary following palaeontologists searching for dinosaur fossils. A team of scientists searches for the skull bones of what may be a brand new species of horned dinosaurs.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: A team searches a 100-year-old dig site to find the remains of a 73-million-year-old armoured dinosaur, while a paleontologist couple tries to airlift a 4,000kg skeleton.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: In the Bay of Fundy, scientists search for the earliest dinosaurs, while a team in British Columbia tracks dino-prints up a steep rock face.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: Scientists in Alberta look for the skeleton of a rare horned dinosaur, while in Saskatchewan a team find the fossils of the last dinosaurs to walk the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep underground.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the wildlife eking out an existence in and around the scorching wilderness of the Sahara Desert, where only the toughest survive. It's a constant struggle against dehydration, as zebra battle over dwindling rivers, camels search for water and tiny barn swallows navigate thousands of square miles of barren sand to find a life-saving oasis. The naked mole rat avoids the heat by living a subterranean existence, while the silver ant is able to take on the midday sun - but needs a `spacesuit' to do it.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates historical evidence of the story of Jesus, examining his execution and his relationship with Mary Magdalene.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Stasi: Behind the Berlin Wall
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks behind the hidden remnants of the Berlin Wall, a notorious symbol of division, to tell the story of the Stasi, East Germany's State Security Service.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates what Hitler intended to do with the priceless works of art stolen by the Nazis from across Europe, as well as his obsession with religious artefacts.

programme.title: Forbidden History

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.desc: Llythyrau personol rhai o enwogion Cymru sy'n cael y sylw yn y rhaglen gan gynnwys rhai a ysgrifennwyd gan yr addysgwr, hanesydd ac arloeswr, Syr O.M.Edwards, y llenor a'r cenedlaetholwr, Saunders Lewis a'r nofelydd Kate Roberts. programme.title: The Eighties
programme.desc: A look at how Mikhail Gorbachev's rise to power in the Soviet Union sparked a chain of events that culminated in the dramatic conclusion of the Cold War.

programme.title: The Eighties
programme.desc: A look at how the personal computer, the internet and video games all became part of daily life thanks to technological innovations made during the 1980s.

programme.title: Sarah Brightman: Hymn
programme.desc: Filmed in September 2018 at Ludwigs Festspielhaus in Bavaria, this concert sees Sarah Brightman perform her best-loved songs accompanied by a 40-piece orchestra, a 50-voice choir and the Ludwig Ensemble of dancers, with a special guest appearance from Japanese megastar Yoshiki.

programme.title: Michael Ball: Both Sides Now
programme.desc: A concert by the singer and West End star at London's Hammersmith Apollo, featuring hits from his recording and stage careers.

programme.title: Phantom of the Opera at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: Ramin Karimloo and Sierra Boggess star in Cameron Mackintosh's production of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical, marking 25 years since it opened in the West End, with the show telling the story of a deformed musical genius who lives in the catacombs of the Paris Opera House.

programme.title: Funny Girl: The Musical
programme.desc: A production of the musical recorded at the Manchester Palace Theatre in 2017, starring Sheridan Smith in the role of comedienne Fanny Brice, whose vocal talents and comedic ability see her rise from Brooklyn music hall singer to Broadway star.

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Music journalists examine the work of the Gibb brothers, whose hits such as Jive Talkin', How Deep Is Your Love and Stayin' Alive are enduring dancefloor fillers.

programme.title: Mario Lanza: The Best of Everything
programme.desc: A biographical portrait of the celebrated tenor and movie star, who rose to fame in the 1950s and paved the way for the likes of Jose Carreras and Placido Domingo.

programme.title: Dinner for One
programme.desc: An upper-class woman celebrates her 90th birthday, with her butler impersonating all the guests that she has outlived. Comedy, starring Freddie Frinton and May Warden.

programme.title: Andre Rieu
programme.sub-title: Andre Rieu: How It All Began
programme.desc: An insight into the life and career of the Dutch violinist, from his humble beginnings in Maastricht to his critically acclaimed sell-out world tours.

programme.title: Andre Rieu
programme.sub-title: Andre Rieu: New Year's Eve Punch
programme.desc: The violinist brings in the New Year with a concert in Hanover, Germany. Russell Watson is his special guest.

programme.title: Andre Rieu
programme.sub-title: Andre Rieu: New Year's Eve in Vienna
programme.desc: A performance by the violinist in the capital of Austria, featuring pieces by composers including Johann Strauss, Franz Lehar and Robert Stolz.

programme.title: Bee Gees: One Night Only
programme.desc: Barry, Robin and Maurice Gibb perform their greatest hits, such as Jive Talkin', How Deep Is Your Love and Stayin' Alive, in a concert at the MGM Grand, Las Vegas, in 1997. They are joined by Celine Dion on the track Immortality, and also sing some of the music they wrote but which was made popular by other artists, including Islands in the Stream, Guilty and Heartbreaker.(n)

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Leading music critics reflect on the career of the Swedish pop band, examining how they cracked the UK, US and Australian charts with hits such as Dancing Queen, SOS and Mamma Mia.(n)

programme.title: Video Killed the Radio Star
programme.desc: An insight into the making of promo videos for Elton John songs, with director Russell Mulcahy describing the disorganised two-day shoot for I'm Still Standing. The programme also explores public reaction to the video that accompanied Elton's Song, as well as Sam Taylor-Wood's film for I Want Love featuring Robert Downey Jr. Marcus Nispel discusses the inspiration behind his black-and-white video for Believe.(n)

programme.title: Trailblazers
programme.desc: Arlene Phillips and Gary Numan are among those taking a look at the development of the music video, including Michael Jackson's Thriller and David Bowie's The Jean Genie.(n)

programme.title: Trailblazers
programme.desc: Noddy Holder narrates a documentary examining key moments that shaped music history from the 1960s to the 1990s, starting with a look at the origins of disco.(n)

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: A look back at the music of American new wave band Blondie, who were led by Debbie Harry and Chris Stein and rose to fame with their 1978 album Parallel Lines.(n)

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A profile of Bristol-born leading man Cary Grant, star of films including His Girl Friday, North by Northwest and Charade, and who married five times.(n)

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A profile of the actor who became one of the 20th century's biggest Hollywood stars and won an Oscar for his portrayal of US marshal Rooster Cogburn in 1969 film True Grit.(n)

programme.title: 2019 Preview Show
programme.desc: A look ahead to the next 12 months.(n)

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A philandering physician with an obsession for orchids cultivates a deadly plot to see off his wife. Sian Phillips and Richard Johnson star.(n)

programme.title: Chaplin: The Birth of the Tramp
programme.desc: Documentary charting Charlie Chaplin's rise to stardom, looking beyond the iconic toothbrush moustache, bowler hat, walking cane and splayed feet.(n)

programme.title: Buster Keaton: The Genius Crushed by Hollywood
programme.desc: How the silent film star went from being one of Hollywood's brightest talents in the mid-1920s to becoming a sad, solitary alcoholic by 1933.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Legends
programme.desc: Barry Cryer pays tribute to the comedy acts he has worked with during his many years in the business, beginning with Tommy Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Comedy Legends
programme.desc: Barry Cryer pays tribute to Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise, one of British TV's best-loved comedy duos, whose Christmas Day shows became a national institution.(n)

programme.title: Laurel and Hardy: Their Lives and Magic
programme.desc: Documentary shedding new light on the turbulent private lives of Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy and the genuine friendship between them.(n)

programme.title: Coldplay: Live in Sao Paulo
programme.desc: A concert film recorded in the Brazilian city in November 2017, capturing the climax of the band's record-breaking A Head Full of Dreams Tour and featuring hits including Yellow, The Scientist, Paradise, Clocks and In My Place.(n)

programme.title: Bee Gees: In Our Own Time
programme.desc: Robin and Barry Gibb discuss their career in music, which began following their family's emigration to Australia. Returning to England in the 1960s, they and brother Maurice found fame as the Bee Gees with songs including Massachusetts and I've Gotta Get a Message to You, before becoming known worldwide for their contributions to the soundtrack of 1977 film Saturday Night Fever, which included the hits Stayin' Alive, Night Fever and How Deep Is Your Love. Featuring archive interviews with Maurice.(n)

programme.title: Andre Rieu: Gala Concert
programme.desc: A performance by the Dutch violinist, recorded at the Color Line Arena in Hamburg in December 2002, with pieces including Flight of the Bumblebee and The Merry Widow.(n)

programme.title: Miss Saigon: 25th Anniversary Performance
programme.desc: Eva Noblezada and Alistair Brammer star in a 25th anniversary gala performance of the musical at London's Prince Edward Theatre, recorded in 2016. The story tells the tragic tale of young bar girl Kim, who is . orphaned by war and eventually falls in love with American GI Chris - but their lives are torn apart by the fall of Saigon.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: A terrified client claims his father was killed by a monstrous creature stalking the wilds of Dartmoor, so Holmes and Watson head to the countryside to investigate. But what seemed like mere fantasy back in Baker Street proves a very different prospect when the duo look into an ultra-secret army base at the edge of the moor. Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman star in this adaptation of Conan Doyle's most famous Sherlock Holmes story, The Hound of the Baskervilles, with Russell Tovey (The Job Lot), Amelia Bullmore (Scott & Bailey) and Clive Mantle (Casualty).

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team searches for a nine-year-old boy who has apparently drowned at the summer camp where Lt Tao's son works. Meanwhile, Captain Raydor suggests Brenda should think of hiring a lawyer, as the organisational revamp of the Major Crimes unit continues.

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The squad investigates the death of a minister whose family will stop at nothing to protect his name and their church. Meanwhile, all the members of the unit receive a subpoena except Gabriel, raising questions about his allegiances.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is found in a seemingly idyllic Northumberland coastal village in 1966, and the subsequent investigation leads Gently and Bacchus to suspect the victim's estranged husband is responsible for the killing. However, they soon come to realise her disturbed family is hiding an even more shocking secret. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Daniel Casey (Midsomer Murders), Shaun Dooley (Married Single Other), Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky) and Greg Hemphill (Still Game).

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: In the summer of 1966, the Northumbrian police come under increasing media scrutiny as Sunderland prepares to host a World Cup match involving the USSR, while campaigners protest against the proposed landing of the Polaris nuclear submarine at Jarrow docks. When an academic is found dead after a CND rally, Gently and Bacchus are dispatched to Durham University to investigate his background - and find themselves in the middle of a wave of social and sexual rebellion. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Sarah Lancashire and Warren Clarke.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. Bacchus suspects the dead girl's music teacher, since rumours persist that she was having an affair with him. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: A terrified client claims his father was killed by a monstrous creature stalking the wilds of Dartmoor, so Holmes and Watson head to the countryside to investigate. But what seemed like mere fantasy back in Baker Street proves a very different prospect when the duo look into an ultra-secret army base at the edge of the moor. Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman star in this adaptation of Conan Doyle's most famous Sherlock Holmes story, The Hound of the Baskervilles, with Russell Tovey (The Job Lot), Amelia Bullmore (Scott & Bailey) and Clive Mantle (Casualty).

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: The Tower of London, Pentonville Prison and the Bank of England are all broken into on the same day - and yet nothing is stolen. Moriarty emerges as the culprit, and goes to trial for his crimes. However, the legal battle sets in motion a scheme through which the criminal mastermind plans to destroy his old foe Sherlock, whose loyalty and courage are tested to the limit as he fights for his reputation, his sanity and his life. Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman star in the award-winning crime drama, with Andrew Scott and Katherine Parkinson.

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: Two years on from reports of his Reichenbach Fall demise, Holmes resurfaces as London comes under threat of a huge terrorist attack. Watson, though, has mixed feelings - he's delighted by the return of his best friend, but harbours worries that the consulting detective's reappearance will have an adverse affect on his settled domestic life, in particular his romance with Mary Morstan. Modern reimagining of Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes detective stories, starring Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman, with Una Stubbs, Rupert Graves and Amanda Abbington.

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: John and Mary's wedding day arrives, presenting Sherlock with one of the toughest challenges he has ever faced as he sets about delivering a best man's speech. But soon he is on more familiar ground as mortal danger stalks the reception, leaving the brooding detective to solve the case and stop a killer before the happy couple make it to their first dance. Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman star in the modern reimagining of Arthur Conan Doyle's classic stories, with Amanda Abbington, Rupert Graves and Una Stubbs.

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: The consulting detective's latest case sees him coming up against the master blackmailer Charles Augustus Magnussen - the one man he truly despises. But how can he tackle a foe who knows the personal weakness of every person of importance in the Western world? Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman star, with Amanda Abbington, Rupert Graves and an appearance from Lars Mikkelsen, better known to fans of Danish drama The Killing as politician Troels Hartmann.

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team investigates when a body appears in a construction site. Brenda considers investing a considerable amount of money in hiring a leading lawyer, but has second thoughts when she realises the fee will mean she has to cut back her spending. Mark Pellegrino (Being Human) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team helps a fellow law enforcement officer by investigating the mysterious death of her daughter. Meanwhile, Captain Raydor continues her audit of Major Crimes, focusing her attention on Detective Sanchez.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda receives a valuable tip-off about a murder involving a major drug cartel, but has to ask for Raydor's help as the case falls outside her jurisdiction. Meanwhile, her attorney starts gathering testimonies about the case at the centre of the civil lawsuit against her.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: Thomas Ricoletti is somewhat surprised to see his wife dressed in her old wedding gown as only a few hours earlier she took her own life. The apparent ghost of Mrs Ricoletti now appears to be prowling the streets with an unslakeable thirst for revenge. From fog-shrouded Limehouse to the bowels of a ruined church, Holmes and Watson must use all their cunning to combat an enemy seemingly from beyond the grave. One-off special episode set in Victorian London, starring Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman, with Tim McInnerny and Catherine McCormack.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: The detective returns to investigate the apparent return from the dead of his old enemy Moriarty, but another strange case is soon demanding his attention. Scotland Yard is baffled by a mysterious criminal who is defacing images of Margaret Thatcher, and Sherlock is convinced there is a more sinister purpose at work behind these acts of vandalism - but his investigation digs up Mary Watson's dark past as an assassin. Benedict Cumberbatch, Martin Freeman and Amanda Abbington return for a fourth series of the detective drama.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: The detective faces a dangerous new enemy in the seemingly unassailable Culverton Smith, a man whose position of power conceals a terrible secret. Estranged from John, Sherlock must confront his demons to defeat his enemy's plans. Toby Jones guest stars as the villain alongside Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: The sleuth and Watson face their greatest challenge as the duo's long-buried secrets come to light and a threat from the past seems to have returned from the dead. They discover an elusive enemy has been playing a very long game - which is now reaching its devastating conclusion. Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman star in the conclusion of the fourth series of the detective drama.(n)

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The inspector and his ambitious sergeant John Bacchus investigate the murder of Dolores Kenny, a black woman. She is a regular attender of a local club's soul all-nighters, events popular with factory workers from across the racial divide. Gently begins to uncover evidence of prejudice within the local community and his own police force as he seeks to identify the victim's killer. Detective drama set in 1968, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Lenora Crichlow, Craig Conway, Pippa Bennett-Warner and Maggie O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: Will Is Home Alone
programme.desc: Will is left home alone when his mother goes away for the weekend with an old school friend, so he decides to take advantage of the situation. After a wild time with the boys ordering items off the internet and raiding the fridge, he wakes up to an unpleasant shock. Comedy, starring Simon Bird and Joe Thomas.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: The Camping Trip
programme.desc: Will decides to organise one last adventure for his friends before they all go their separate ways, so the gang heads off for a camping trip in the countryside. While Will draws on all his scout training, Jay, Neil and Simon are not prepared for the great outdoors.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: The Gig and the Girlfriend
programme.desc: Simon goes to his first gig since seeing Take That at Wembley Arena, hoping to impress an attractive girl in the year below, but Will, Jay and Neil tag along and jeopardise his chances of wooing her. Comedy, starring Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, James Buckley and Blake Harrison.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After spending the holidays apart, the gang get together to hear about Sheldon's and Amy's trip to his mother's, Leonard's and Penny's Christmas tree adventure, and Howard's and Bernadette's first days as parents.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny thinks that Leonard is taking her for granted and has stopped making an effort in their relationship, so she decides to go away for a spa weekend with Amy. Howard and Raj go to extreme lengths to deal with a squeaky floorboard in the baby's bedroom.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tests a newly invented device after hearing that it can help him to read people's emotions. Leonard isn't happy when he finds out that Penny's brother is coming to town so that she can help him to find a job. Raj gathers his ex-girlfriends together so that they can give him some dating advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard attempt to distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows the progress of their work on the Air Force guidance system. Raj and Stuart look after baby Halley, while Penny and Amy take Bernadette out.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Doug Judy (Craig Robinson) is returned to custody after scamming Jake and Rosa in a previous encounter, but Captain Holt offers him a plea deal when he reveals he knows the location of a notorious drug dealer. Meanwhile, Gina and Boyle become concerned about their parents' relationship, and Santiago makes Holt a Christmas gift. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Leela is very excited to be about to marry Louis, but it seems Louis still has his ex-wife Simone on his mind. Yazz causes trouble for Ste when she gets him banned from selling his mince pies at The Bean. Meanwhile, Mercedes and Sylver go out on their first date, but the night comes to a disastrous end.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Detective Jake Peralta and his eclectic group of colleagues at Brooklyn's 99th Precinct are used to having a commanding officer who doesn't make them work too hard or follow the rules too closely. That all changes when tightly wound Captain Ray Holt takes over, determined to make the dysfunctional squad into the best in the borough. Pilot episode of the American comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is assigned to a minor graffiti case by Captain Holt as punishment for turning up late for work, but the investigation becomes a major headache when the vandal's identity is revealed. Meanwhile, Gina's psychic friend Carlene visits the precinct to help with a case, and upsets Charles with a prediction about his romantic life. American comedy, starring Andy Samberg.

programme.title: Postman Pat: The Movie
programme.desc: The small-town postman enters a TV talent contest, and is soon tempted away from his simple life by the bright lights of celebrity. Meanwhile, a sinister corporation has plans for taking over his deliveries. Animated adventure, with the voices of Stephen Mangan, Rupert Grint, Jim Broadbent and David Tennant.

programme.title: Garfield 2: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Grasshopper Experiment
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Barbarian Sublimation
programme.desc: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian. As her obsession intensifies, she begins to neglect her friends and seeks the company of the usually snide Sheldon, whom she continually pesters for advice. Starring Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Panty Pinata Polarisation
programme.desc: Penny's TV breaks down, so she heads to the boys' flat to watch her favourite shows. However, Sheldon tires of her presence and bans future visits, leading to an embarrassing form of retaliation. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj search for the America's Next Top Model house.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Work Song Nanocluster
programme.desc: Penny starts her own hair accessories business and the orders start to pile in. However, she makes the mistake of asking Sheldon to help, leading to frustration and regret. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Adhesive Duck Deficiency
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard go camping to watch the Leonid meteor shower, but the trip takes an unexpected turn thanks to some specially baked cookies. Meanwhile, Penny injures herself in the shower, and with the rest of the gang out of town, it's left to Sheldon to come to her aid.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Vengeance Formulation
programme.desc: Howard's fear of commitment causes him to avoid Bernadette, but he soon realises he has made a mistake and tries to compensate for it. Meanwhile, Kripke plays a prank during a radio interview with Sheldon, who sets out to get revenge, only to be caught by the Dean. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with an appearance by Katee Sackhoff (Battlestar Galactica) as herself.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Maternal Congruence
programme.desc: Leonard's mother visits and he is horrified to learn that Sheldon knows more than he does about his own family, including his parents' impending divorce and the death of his dog. Guest starring Christine Baranski.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Lunar Excitation
programme.desc: Raj and Howard register Sheldon with an online dating site hoping to find his perfect female equivalent. Meanwhile, a drunk Penny seduces Leonard, but regrets it the next day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco. Mayim Bialik (Blossom) makes her first appearance on the show.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Shiny Trinket Manoeuvre
programme.desc: Sheldon is uninterested in Amy's career, so Penny, Raj and Leonard try to make him understand that sometimes it benefits a relationship to pretend to care about a partner's achievements. Howard notices Bernadette is uncomfortable around children when she helps him perform a magic show at his nephew's birthday party.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.sub-title: The Big Bang Theory: The Gang's Best Bits: The Romance Resonance
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: A workaholic businessman always puts his job before his family until he receives an unexpected inheritance from his explorer father - six penguins. He abandons his plan to offload the birds to a zoo when he finds his kids love them, and sets about turning his New York apartment into a suitable habitat. Family comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Carla Gugino and Angela Lansbury.

programme.title: Ice Age: A Mammoth Christmas
programme.desc: Festive spin-off of the animated films. Sid the sloth accidentally ruins one of Manny the mammoth's Christmas traditions, and worries he may be on Santa Claus's naughty list - so he heads to the North Pole in a bid to redeem himself. Featuring the voices of John Leguizamo, Ray Romano, Queen Latifah and Denis Leary.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Harry returns to the village and is on a mission to make amends with James and win him back. Romeo wants to tell Alfie the truth about Cindy's medication, so an enraged Mac throws Romeo out. Meanwhile, Yasmine and Alfie decide to set Romeo up on a date.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: The Most Handsome Boy on the Planet
programme.desc: Barry is excited when a modelling agency representative approaches him, but Erica thinks it's a scam. Meanwhile, Adam tries to get Murray to build bridges with his father.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys have fun at the expense of Penny's boyfriend Zack, but later try to make amends by enlisting his help with the New Year's costume competition at the comic-book store. Comedy, starring Kaley Cuoco and Simon Helberg.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuart's comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners Movie
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Simon, Will, Jay and Neil plan a holiday to the Greek island of Crete after they finish their exams, hoping to experience drink, sex and debauchery beyond their wildest dreams. However, things do not quite work out as planned. Comedy based on the TV series, with Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, James Buckley and Blake Harrison.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: Bunk Off
programme.desc: The four lads decide to play truant from sixth form and buy alcohol for an all-day drinking session, which is interrupted when Neil's father comes home early. Meanwhile, Simon decides to declare his love for Carli through graffiti, and the friends face the wrath of their parents.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: Night Out in London
programme.desc: Will tries to reinvent the boys' image by taking them clubbing around London, but Simon is unsure whether to go until Carli shows an interest in the outing. When the friends arrive in the West End, their efforts to appear cool are hampered by aggressive bouncers, a tramp and some angry bus passengers.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: The Fashion Show
programme.desc: At the start of the new term, Carli organises a fashion show that Simon is eager to participate in. Will tries to shake off his embarrassing reputation, while Jay continues to lie about his sexual experiences. Comedy, starring Emily Head, Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, James Buckley and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: Thorpe Park
programme.desc: Simon passes his driving test, so the lads decide to take a trip to a theme park. However, things start to go wrong when their route is obstructed by a funeral cortege and the newly qualified motorist has an accident in the car park. Later, Will regrets ever making the journey when he disgraces himself on a rollercoaster.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.sub-title: The Inbetweeners: Fan Favourites: Field Trip
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Wolverhampton DJ Darryl hopes stripping everything back will him meet his ideal partner, while former ballet dancer Ania, from Preston, is tired of investing valuable time on people only to be disappointed when the clothes come off and has decided that being upfront is the key to relationship success. Anna Richardson hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The sharp-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on coverage of the Irish Referendum and Harvey Weinstein's arrest. Plus, appraisals of TV shows including A Very English Scandal, Britain's Got Talent, First Dates, Steve Backshall vs The Monster Mountain and 4 Men 175 Babies: The UK's Super Sperm Donors.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

Meanwhile, Simon decides to declare his love for Carli through graffiti, and the friends face the wrath of their parents.(n)
