programme.title: New Year's Eve Countdown Concert
programme.desc: Sinead Kennedy presents live from Custom House Quay, Dublin, where headliner Gavin James helps bring in the New Year.

programme.title: GoodFellas
programme.desc: An Irish-Italian boy from a poor neighbourhood grows up idolising the glamorous lifestyle of the Mafia. Taken under the wing of a mobster, he rises quickly in the world of organised crime. But he soon has to face the realities of murder and treachery, while his involvement in drug deals puts him at risk from both sides of the law. Martin Scorsese's crime drama, starring Ray Liotta, Robert De Niro and an Oscar-winning Joe Pesci.

programme.title: The Net
programme.desc: A shy computer analyst discovers evidence of a criminal conspiracy, so the villains decide to retaliate. Erasing her personal details from the national database, they replace them with a false police record, hurling her into a desperate race against time to prove her real identity before corrupt officials silence her for good. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock, Jeremy Northam and Dennis Miller.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: In the Footsteps of a Killer
programme.desc: Another mystery for the cops on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. However, it's all change for the team. Last week they waved goodbye to Humphrey Goodman. No one knows how Kris Marshall's character is bowing out of the show - will he walk off into the sunset with new love Martha, or will he meet a sticky end, like his predecessor Richard Poole (Ben Miller)? What we do know is that in his place is Ardal O'Hanlon as DI Jack Mooney, who first popped up in the two-part London special. His first Caribbean case sees the reopening of a seven-year-old murder when a tourist provides an alibi for the woman convicted of the crime.

programme.desc: Colleen and Matt question if they will ever get married after missing all the flights to Mexico. The Hughes family have to move in with Tyler and Clementine.

programme.desc: Gates goes on the run, convinced he can save his career and marriage by proving his innocence. As his options dwindle, the anti-corruption team faces renewed pressure to close the case - but rifts start to appear when Arnott questions how far Fleming is willing to go to get results. Police thriller, starring Lennie James, Martin Compston and Vicky McClure. Last in the series.

programme.desc: New series. The aquarium has sprung a leak, so Mr Peek has to find somewhere to put the fish. Animation about a zookeeper, his children and the animals he looks after.

programme.desc: Cliona and her helpers show how to build a fort.

programme.title: Donncha's Two Talented
programme.desc: Family entertainment show, hosted by rugby star Donncha O'Callaghan, in which three children - along with their chosen adult - showcase their various talents.

programme.title: Beyond Beyond
programme.desc: Premiere. A young rabbit lives happily on a boat with his father, although his mother disappeared some time ago. One day, he receives a distress call from her over the radio and follows her message to an island that is about to sink into the ocean. The king of this endangered land needs his help to save his people. Animated adventure, with the voice of Jon Heder.

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Legend of the NeverBeast
programme.desc: One of Tinker Bell's friends meets a large hairy monster, and discovers he is not as fearsome as he looks. However, she has a hard time convincing the other fairies to accept him, and needs the help of her friends to protect the creature. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Ginnifer Goodwin and Rosario Dawson.

programme.title: news2day
programme.desc: A look back at all the major news and sport stories from the past 12 months.

programme.title: Gangsta Granny
programme.desc: Family comedy based on the children's novel by David Walliams. Schoolboy Ben is bored witless after being made to stay with his grandma. All she ever wants to do is play Scrabble and eat yucky cabbage soup. But it turns out there's a whole lot more to this OAP than cardigans and toffees when she tells him how she used to be an international jewel thief - and when she admits there was one heist she never quite managed in her heyday, the pair set out on a criminal adventure. Julie McKenzie stars as the shady senior citizen, with Walliams and Miranda Hart as the boys' ballroom-dancing parents, alongside Joanna Lumley, Rob Brydon and Robbie Williams, with Reece Buttery as Ben.

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.

programme.title: Ariana Grande: Live in London
programme.desc: Davina McCall presents this one-off special in which Ariana Grande performs songs from her latest album Sweetener and some of her biggest hits, accompanied by her band and a full orchestra. In between songs she also talks to Davina about her life and career.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
programme.desc: The party of dwarves and their hobbit ally continue the quest to reclaim their lost kingdom, journeying through the forest home of ancestral enemy the elves and finally facing the dragon that drove them from their home. Meanwhile, Gandalf the wizard investigates the rise of a mysterious dark power. Part two of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
programme.desc: Dwarf king Thorin reclaims control of his homeland, but his descent into madness places him on the brink of war with his human and elven allies. As Thorin's Hobbit friend Bilbo tries to save the tormented ruler from himself, a vast horde of orcs gathers to destroy them all. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Luke Evans and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: Summer of Hurling
programme.desc: Kilkenny v Limerick. A look back at the 2018 All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship quarter-final from Semple Stadium, Thurles.

programme.title: Meet the Fockers
programme.desc: A hapless groom-to-be appears to have finally won the approval of his stern prospective in-laws, but faces a new challenge when he takes them on a vacation to Florida to meet his free-spirited sex therapist mother and eccentric house-husband father. The tension rapidly mounts as the mismatched families struggle to get along. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand.

programme.title: The Young Offenders
programme.desc: Fortitude star Robert Sheehan appears as himself in this festive episode of the sitcom. The residents of the council estate where Conor and Jock live are threatened with eviction, but are not about to go down without a fight - and the resulting media circus puts everyone on edge. In the midst of all this mayhem, Conor's mother Mairead is rushed to hospital, and may be more seriously ill than previously thought. When she says she wants to see a white Christmas, the lads vow to make her wish come true - with a little help from Sheehan, who is shooting a film nearby.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt.

programme.title: Grabbers
programme.desc: A drunken Irish policeman introduces a new recruit to life on a quiet island off the coast, just as a series of strange events occur. They discover they are under attack from strange creatures coming out of the sea, and head for the only safe place - the local pub. Comedy horror, starring Richard Coyle, Ruth Bradley and Russell Tovey.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: DI Lindsay Denton is investigated when she survives the ambush of a police convoy in which three of her colleagues are killed and a witness is seriously injured. AC-12's commanding officer Ted Hastings assigns new recruit Georgia Trotman to work alongside Steve Arnott on the investigation, and suspicions are soon raised about Denton. Starring Adrian Dunbar, Keeley Hawes, Martin Compston and Jessica Raine.

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: Animation for children about two brothers who use creature power suits created from animal DNA.

programme.title: How to Do Everything
programme.desc: Cliona and her helpers demonstrate how to play hopscotch.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: A new alarm at the Town Hall keeps going off, and there may be something spooky behind it.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his building buddies visit Fixham Beach, which needs a good tidy - but Lofty gets carried away with his own ideas for how to use the driftwood.

programme.title: Donncha's Two Talented
programme.desc: Family entertainment show, hosted by rugby star Donncha O'Callaghan, in which three children - along with their chosen adult - showcase their various talents.

programme.title: Alpha & Omega: The Legend of the Saw Tooth Cave
programme.desc: Premiere. After exploring a haunted cave and finding a wolf who has been driven away from her pack, Runt the pup attempts to help her. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Debi Derryberry and Kate Higgins.

programme.title: Zog
programme.desc: Keen but accident-prone dragon Zog gets himself into mischief while learning how to fly, roar, breathe fire and fight knights in his first four years at Dragon School. Each year he meets a kindly young girl who patches up his bumps and bruises, but can she help him with his trickiest challenge yet? It's year five and he has to capture a princess. Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler's book, featuring the voices of Lenny Henry, Tracey Ullman, Hugh Skinner, Patsy Ferran and Kit Harington.

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
programme.desc: Nick Park's Oscar-winning animation featuring the bumbling inventor and his faithful dog, whose lives are turned upside down after foolishly offering board and lodgings to villainous penguin Feathers McGraw. With the voice of Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Sandokan
programme.desc: A prince travels the seas as a pirate seeking to reclaim his rightful throne from the Rajah of Sarawak. Animated adventure, with the voice of Dave Mallow.

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall embarks on a global journey, beginning in the Arctic where he boards an ice-breaker and goes in search of a polar bear.

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera.

programme.title: Revolting Rhymes
programme.desc: The first of two collections of animations based on poems from Roald Dahl's children's book, featuring the author's twists on Snow White & the Seven Dwarves, Little Red Riding Hood and The Three Little Pigs. Best friends Snow and Red take on a villainous queen with a magic mirror, before Red faces another challenge when two hungry wolves are on the prowl - one disguised as her own grandmother, while the other has his eye on a trio of helpless pigs. With the voices of Tamsin Greig, Dominic West, Rob Brydon, Bertie Carvel, Gemma Chan and Rose Leslie.

programme.title: Free Willy 3: The Rescue
programme.desc: The amiable killer whale is reunited with his human friend Jesse, now a teenager working on a research ship. Jesse meets a boy whose father is secretly involved in poaching whales for their meat, and persuades the youngster to help him protect Willy and his pod from harm. Family adventure, starring Jason James Richter, August Schellenberg and Annie Corley.

programme.title: Where Eagles Dare
programme.desc: An American general is held captive by the Nazis in a heavily defended fortress in the Alps. A crack team of British soldiers and an American lieutenant are dispatched to free him, but they soon realise there is a traitor in their ranks. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Clint Eastwood, Patrick Wymark, Michael Hordern and Mary Ure.

programme.title: Stories from the 2018 FIFA World Cup
programme.desc: Memories and the main talking points from Russia.

programme.title: All the Goals of the 2018 FIFA World Cup
programme.desc: Action from Russia, featuring memorable strikes by the likes of Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappe.

programme.title: Summer of Hurling
programme.desc: Galway v Clare. A look back at the 2018 All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship semi-final from Croke Park.

programme.title: Conor McGregor: Notorious
programme.desc: Premiere. Documentary following the MMA fighter, one of the most recognisable names in the history of the UFC, filmed over the course of four years. The film charts McGregor's personal and professional journey, from claiming benefits and living in his mum's spare room with his girlfriend, to winning multiple championship belts and huge pay packets.

programme.title: The Doireann Project
programme.desc: New series. Doireann Garrihy impersonates a portfolio of famous Irish faces and characters in this comedy sketch show.

programme.title: Searching for Sugar Man
programme.desc: Premiere. Documentary following two fans in search of their musical idol. American singer Sixto Rodriguez enjoyed a brief recording career in the 1970s before fading into obscurity. However, his politically conscious music became incredibly popular in South Africa. Bizarre stories of his death had circulated over the years, but two devotees plan to find out what really became of him.

programme.title: World's Deadliest
programme.sub-title: World's Deadliest: Jaws and Sins: More 7 Deadly Sins
programme.desc: Dangerous animals in the sea and sky, including the poisonous blue ringed octopus, and crocodiles that only need to eat once a week, but are immensely powerful when hungry.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Following the tragedy at the hospital, Fleming continues to work under cover in missing persons and looks into the disappearance of 15-year-old Carly Kirk, a case in which Denton appears to have a personal interest. The under-suspicion detective also starts to scrutinise the background of the AC-12 officers and gathers compromising evidence to use against the anti-corruption team.(n)

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.(n)

programme.title: Wild Kratts
programme.desc: Martin and Chris receive reports of snowy owls in North America. Since these raptors live in the Arctic, it's up to the Wild Kratts to solve the mystery of the snowy owl invasion.(n)

programme.title: How to Do Everything
programme.sub-title: How to Make a Rain Gauge

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Leo has to make a film for college, Scoop tries so hard to get on camera that he does not think about the mess he is creating along the way.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Muck shoos away Pilchard, so Leo and the machines set out to find her without bothering Bob.(n)

programme.title: Donncha's Two Talented
programme.desc: Family entertainment show, hosted by rugby star Donncha O'Callaghan, in which three children - along with their chosen adult - showcase their various talents.(n)

programme.title: Alpha and Omega: Family Vacation
programme.desc: Wolves Humphrey and Kate decide to take their pups on holiday for the first time, making a journey to a peaceful waterfall. However, the family getaway does not prove as relaxing as expected when a gang of trappers has designs on their fur. Animated adventure, with the voices of Ben Diskin and Kate Higgins.(n)

programme.title: Room on the Broom
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of the children's book by author Julia Donaldson and illustrator Axel Scheffler, the creators of modern classic The Gruffalo. It tells the story of a kind witch who invites a surprising number of animals to ride on her broom - much to the frustration of her cat. But when a fearsome dragon appears, what will the gang do? Gillian Anderson heads the voice cast as the witch, with Rob Brydon, Martin Clunes, Sally Hawkins and David Walliams as the animals, Timothy Spall as the dragon and Simon Pegg as narrator.(n)

programme.title: Yolanda: Secret of the Black Rose
programme.desc: Thrilling animated adventure following the escapades of a girl who is shocked to discover her father was a notorious pirate - but is inspired to free the people of the Caribbean from their tyrannous overlords.(n)

programme.title: Prank Patrol Down Under
programme.desc: A youngster asks his friend to accompany him to a scrapyard to search for spare parts, but the visit takes an unexpected turn.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall watches a polar bear scale a sea cliff in search of food in Svalbard, before heading south to Somerset Island in the Canadian Arctic. Once there, he goes in search of musk ox, and an Arctic fox still in its pristine winter coat, but for the first time in 40 years the ice hasn't melted, which may hamper the presenter's mission to see a beluga whale.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and JK Rowling's Wizarding World
programme.desc: Warwick Davis explores the popularity of JK Rowling's fantasy sagas, with access to the cast and creators of her new film, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. He meets star Eddie Redmayne on the set of the new movie and catches up with the author at the world premiere in New York.(n)

programme.title: The Princess Bride
programme.desc: A cynical youngster becomes entranced by his grandfather's magical tales, which revolve around a stable-boy's heroic quest to rescue his lost love from the clutches of an evil prince, with the aid of a vengeance-seeking Spanish swashbuckler and his hulking sidekick. Rob Reiner's comic fantasy adventure, with Cary Elwes, Robin Wright, Chris Sarandon, Mandy Patinkin, Peter Falk and Fred Savage.(n)

programme.title: Kelly's Heroes
programme.desc: A rebellious American soldier fighting in occupied France learns from a captive German officer the whereabouts of a fortune in Nazi gold. Recruiting the aid of three fellow soldiers, he puts together a daring plan to penetrate enemy lines to get their hands on the bullion. Second World War adventure, starring Clint Eastwood, Telly Savalas, Donald Sutherland, Don Rickles and Harry Dean Stanton.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie learns that Susan has visited Finn in the hospital. Almost caught out sneaking a read of Bea's diary, Liz hides it in the nearest available place - the backyard pizza oven.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer forms a bowling team and reluctantly allows Mr Burns to join alongside Moe and Apu. Meanwhile, Bart causes a riot at school by sporting a provocative T-shirt, but as a result the students are forced to wear uniforms.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Conservationist Dr Julian Fennessy is on a mission to learn more about the giraffes of Africa, but the most important fact is that they are disappearing. In an urgent attempt to save them, he and a determined Ugandan team round up 20 of the world's rarest giraffes to take across and beyond the mighty Nile River. The stakes are high, but if they succeed the reward will be a brighter future for an animal Dr Fennessy believes has been overlooked. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Summer of Hurling
programme.desc: Cork v Limerick. A look back at the 2018 All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship semi-final from Croke Park.(n)

programme.desc: Ciara Kelly hosts a look back at the past year.

programme.title: Brendan Grace: Everylaughing
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the comedian, featuring new material as well as some old favourites from his vast repertoire over the past 40 years.

programme.title: The Six O'Clock Show
programme.desc: Chat show, featuring celebrity interviews, sampling food from leading chefs and guidance on a wide range of topics, from consumer affairs to the latest trends, with viewers invited to contribute with pictures, comments, stories and gossip.

programme.title: Surprise Surprise
programme.desc: Mark Wright takes a community hero on the trip of a lifetime to see world-renowned violinist Andre Rieu, and a former soldier who set up a go-kart racing team for injured ex-servicemen receives a gift to help him continue his good work. Michael Underwood delivers a special thank-you to an inspirational cancer survivor, and in the biggest reunion in the programme's history, a grandmother is surprised by family members from three continents, including the brother she hasn't seen for nearly 50 years. Holly Willoughby presents.

programme.title: Schofield's South African Adventure
programme.desc: After an early start, Phillip Schofield and his wife make their way into the heart of a game reserve and Steph is reduced to tears as she sees a giraffe up close for the first time. Later, the presenter is invited to take part in a conservation project to protect the rhino population. Rhinos are on the endangered list as they are being poached faster than they can breed, so tagging is a vital element in the constant war against the poachers. After a dart is shot from his helicopter, Phillip steps out and attaches the tagging device to the animal.

programme.title: Surprise Surprise
programme.desc: JLS star-turned-presenter Marvin Humes surprises a dedicated volunteer with a complete makeover for his community soup kitchen. A 76-year-old fundraising singer fulfils a lifelong dream when she performs with an orchestra in the studio, and there's a further treat in store when she's reunited with her best friend after more than 40 years apart. Plus, a devoted husband delivers a heartfelt message of thanks to his wife for her love and support during a family tragedy. Holly Willoughby presents.

programme.title: Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine programme featuring health, safety and education reports, entertainment news and interviews with personalities making the headlines.

programme.title: Coronation Street: Deirdre - a Tribute
programme.desc: Another chance to see this 2012 documentary. Actress Anne Kirkbride talks about her long career playing one of British soap's most popular characters, as the programme explores the life of the woman behind those famous glasses. Taking the cameras backstage, she discusses her close relationships with other cast members and reveals the depression she suffered while filming the Weatherfield One storyline, which gripped the nation as Deirdre was wrongly jailed for fraud in 1998. Narrated by Lesley Sharp.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Todd Carty, Jo Pavey, Saira Khan and Dominic Holland pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Funny Side of the Street
programme.desc: A selection of comedy moments from Coronation Street. Members of the cast both past and present, including Liz Dawn, Wendi Peters and William Roache, talk about Britain's longest-running soap and reveal their favourite clips and comic characters. Narrated by Matthew Kelly.

programme.title: The Funny Side of the Street
programme.desc: Comedy moments from Coronation Street, Britain's longest-running soap, featuring interviews with actors past and present.

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts this entertainment show in which the children of three celebrities spill the beans about their famous parents, talking about their home lives, making heart-warming revelations or telling downright embarrassing stories. However, it should all be worth it as they are earning money for their chosen charities - and have the chance to play for a £15,000 jackpot at the end. First up are former EastEnders actress Nina Wadia and six-year-old son Aidan, TV actor Will Mellor and his daughter Renee, who is five, and pop star Jamelia and her seven-year-old daughter Tiani.

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the entertainment show, inviting three more youngsters to spill the beans about their famous parents. Playing to raise money for their favourite charities are Blue singer Duncan James with his eight-year-old daughter Tianie-Finn, 1980s pop star Sinitta, joined by her daughter Magdelena who is also eight, and football pundit Robbie Savage with his seven-year-old son Freddie.

programme.title: Your Song
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents a one-off special in which members of the public receive private performances from their favourite stars. James Arthur sings for the founder of an anti-bullying charity, Paloma Faith acts as celebrant at a gay wedding, the Script perform for a woman recovering from two recent bereavements, Rita Ora revisits a youth club she attended as a teenager, and Little Mix make a special appearance for three fans.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: A blooper and outtake special of the quiz show, presented by Bradley Walsh. Featuring The Governess, The Beast, The Vixen and The Sinnerman.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Filmed over two years, this documentary follows the Manchester soap's transfer from its 53-year-old base at Granada Studios to its new home in Trafford Park. Featuring behind-the-scenes access as stars of the show pack up their dressing rooms and film their final scenes at the old site. The programme also includes rarely seen footage of Coronation Street being shot in the 1960s, and tells the story of the evolution of filming the long-running series. Featuring contributions by Beverley Callard, Sally Dynevor, Simon Gregson and Brooke Vincent.

programme.title: Virgin Media News Update
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's national and international headlines.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matty suffers a cruel humiliation when a former boyfriend attacks him. Harriet goes looking for Dawn, and Charity sets up a surprise party for Ryan.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla and Peter examine their history and address their future, and Kate's night out with Imogen devastates Rana. Meanwhile, Lewis tires of Gail's influence on Audrey.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a 10-week-old collie who has been rejected by its mother, and helps to find a home for a mongrel called Hope who has been at Battersea for over 300 days. Elsewhere, Paul has got his work cut out when a family of nine whippets arrive on site, including some three-week-old puppies in need of some love.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a star-studded version of the game show, asking Jennie McAlpine, Jason Watkins and Ore Oduba to `say what they see' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: A vet working at a Hawaiian zoo falls madly in love with a beautiful woman and pulls out all the stops to romance her. However, his attempts to woo her are seriously undermined by the fact that she suffers from short-term memory-loss, meaning he has to resume his courtship from scratch every day. Romantic comedy, starring Drew Barrymore, Adam Sandler, Rob Schneider and Dan Aykroyd.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.sub-title: The Graham Norton New Year's Eve Show
programme.desc: The comedian and broadcaster is joined by a star-studded line-up as 2018 draws to a close. Olivia Colman and co-star Nicholas Hoult discuss their new film The Favourite, which follows the battle of two cousins to be court favourites during the reign of Queen Anne in the early 18th century. Actress Keira Knightley chats about biographical movie Colette, based on the life of the French novelist, while Australian actor Guy Pearce talks about new historical drama Mary Queen of Scots, and Catherine Tate discusses her live stage show. With music from Rita Ora, who performs a medley of hits from her latest album Phoenix.

programme.title: That Was 2018
programme.desc: A look back at the major stories of the year set to a soundtrack of the biggest hits, covering everything from extreme weather to the UK's Brexit crisis and the abortion referendum as well as a controversial rape case in Belfast and a cancer scandal.

programme.title: Edge of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Premiere. An inexperienced military officer is sent to the front line in a war against an alien invasion, and dies within minutes. However, at the point of death, he is transported back in time to relive his last day again. As he experiences the same battle over and over again, the experience he gains turns him into the ultimate warrior. Sci-fi adventure based on Hiroshi Sakurazaka's novel All You Need Is Kill, starring Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt and Brendan Gleeson.

programme.title: Celtic Soul
programme.desc: Celebrated Canadian actor and funny man Jay Baruchel has an obsession with a sport and a team - far from home, in another continent: he is a massive fan of Glasgow's Celtic Football Club. And like millions of fans in Canada and around the world, Jay defies crazy distances and time differences to get his fix of European football. How did Jay's own obsession begin - and what is it about football that inspires such fanaticism in every far-flung corner of our globe? Celtic Soul follows Jay on an epic road trip with his new friend, well-known Irish soccer journalist Eoin O'Callaghan, to find out.

programme.desc: The blues legend teams up for the first time in 38 years with former Bluesbreakers Eric Clapton and Mick Taylor as well as jazzman Chris Barber to perform classics from a long and distinguished career. The backbone of the British blues scene since the mid-1960s, John's hard-working band was a nursery for the rock explosion of the 1970s, spawning countless spin-off groups, but always remaining true to the spirit of the roots music and finding new audiences as fashions came and went - as he does in this benefit concert at Liverpool's King's Dock Arena on behalf of Unicef.(n)

Jack Jessee and Ronald `Porkchop' Mangum cross swords when they are given jobs that require them to run in tandem and help each other offload, while Austin Wheeler drives a 100ft-long trailer as he takes some long pipes up to Prudhoe Bay.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Hugh Rowland is annoyed when Rick Yemm insists on taking an early night as the pair head to the remote outpost of Wasagamack in Manitoba, while Lane Keator asks Phil Krom to shadow Ronald `Porkchop' Mangum on a trip to Prudhoe Bay to make sure the rookie stays on the straight and narrow. Austin Wheeler opts not to stop and put on his winter chains to go up a notorious hill, but his decision backfires, while Alex Debogorski delivers a snowblower to help the department of transport reopen a blocked road.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski has to negotiate the recently reopened Hurricane Alley as he hauls a volatile load of compressed gases used for welding, while Austin Wheeler readies a trailer holding a huge digger he is to carry up the Dalton to Prudhoe Bay in Alaska. Hugh Rowland and his convoy partner Vlad Pleskot have to clean up the mess after Rick Yemm fails to strap down his load properly, while Carlile boss Lane Keator calls Ronald `Porkchop' Mangum into the office in Fairbanks for a talk.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The season is entering its final few days and the drivers are in a race against the weather and one another as the pressure at the top of the load-count chart intensifies. Darrell Ward and his main rival Jack Jessee are both carrying groceries and fuel to the remote settlement of Nuiqsut, while Hugh Rowland and Rick Yemm face their final trip of the year. Austin Wheeler fancies his chances of snatching the title from the other guys, but as he approaches Attigan Pass on the Dalton Highway, his truck starts to make a very unhealthy noise.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The drivers undertake their final deliveries, with Jack keen to fend off a confident Darrell's challenge for his load-count title. Meanwhile, Alex takes desperate measures when the sun melts the ice beneath his wheels, Austin is given another substantial load confirming his status as a heavy hauler and Ray tries to squeeze in one more run.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: VP Express finally delivers its first load of the season, but things remain frosty between owners Hugh Rowland and Vlad Pleskot and their employee Art Burke. Meanwhile, Polar Industries boss Mark Kohaykewych secures a lucrative new contract delivering the prefabricated pieces of a school to the isolated community of Shamattawa in northern Manitoba. However, the road is notoriously tough, with one incline so steep that truckers can find themselves going uncontrollably backwards - as Darrell Ward finds out.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Hugh Rowland responds to his fall-out with Polar Industries by setting up his own rival company with business partner Vlad Pleskot, pitting his new recruits against his ex-boss Mark Kohaykewych's team of old hands. Alex Debogorski is eager for the opportunity to wipe out Hugh's company before it gets started, while veteran trucker Lisa Kelly also signs up for Polar after a two-year break, looking to conquer the new terrain of the winter roads.

programme.title: Send in the Dogs
programme.desc: PC Dave Smith and his Belgian shepherd Kelly race to the scene of a burglary at a pet-food store, but when the suspects are found to have fled the scene, police helicopter India 99 is used to help track them down. programme.title: Send in the Dogs

programme.title: Send in the Dogs

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.desc: Bell-ringer Amanda Ballard is found hanged in the belfry with a suicide note left beside her, but Agatha is not convinced she took her own life and enlists a reluctant Roy to help her research the case. Mystery, starring Ashley Jensen.

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.desc: Parish council chairman Robert Strutters is found dead in Carsley's spring shortly before a vote over whether to allow a mineral water company access to the water. When a second body is found in the village, Agatha's competitive streak emerges and she enlists Gemma's help to find the killer before James and Mary.

programme.title: Agatha Raisin

programme.desc: Adaptation of David Walliams' book, starring Sheridan Smith. Zoe's new pet rat is in danger when burger van man Burt (Walliams) earmarks it for his menu.

programme.desc: Orphaned teenager Jennifer Strange is running an employment agency for sorcerers when she discovers her destiny is to become the last dragonslayer. Feature-length fantasy drama based on first of Jasper Fforde's series of novels, starring Ellise Chappell, Ricky Tomlinson and John Bradley.

programme.title: Football's Funniest Moments
programme.desc: Another selection of laugh-out-loud incidents from the football world, with a line-up of famous fans singling out their favourite funny moments from the beautiful game.

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.sub-title: Agatha Raisin And The Quiche Of Death
programme.desc: It's all about the quiche in this tasty whodunnit starring Ashley Jensen as Agatha Raisin, a PR whizz caught up in a murder mystery.

programme.title: Flying Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the world of the pterosaur, a flying creature that occupied the skies 200 million years ago. Visiting sites around the world, from the Dorset coast to New Mexico, he explains how the reptiles evolved to defy the forces of gravity, and examines the features of their anatomy that can still be seen in present-day descendents. He also discovers why they became extinct after dominating the skies for millions of years.

programme.title: The Bachelor King
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of king penguins, filmed on the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia over five months. The programme imagines what one penguin's life would be, following it during the challenging, awkward time between adolescence and adulthood. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Big Cats: An Amazing Animal Family
programme.desc: Part one of two. Biologist Patrick Aryee explores how cats have evolved throughout the millennia, learning to thrive in inhospitable environments, as well as becoming the world's most popular pet. In the first edition there is spectacular footage of caracals jumping three metres to catch flying birds, and a rare Bornean bay cat, which was thought to have been extinct. Patrick finds out how tigers made the transition from South-east Asia's steamy jungles to the -40C temperatures of Siberia, and meets `lion whisperer' Kevin Richardson.

programme.title: Big Cats: An Amazing Animal Family
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee concludes his two-part exploration of the feline family tree, revealing how the Canadian lynx learned to thrive in the snow and spread out, evolving and inhabiting new parts of the Americas. In Belize, he mounts an experiment that showcases the margay's supersharp senses and gravity-defying acrobatics, and heads to the training track with a cheetah to find out what speed it is capable of. Finally, Patrick tells the story of the cat's domestication in Essaouira, Morocco, believed to be one of the first places where one particular species first gave up life in the wild in return for food, warmth, security and a home.

programme.title: Z Nation
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic drama, set three years after a zombie virus swept America, where a ragtag team of individuals must transport Murphy, the only known immune survivor, from New York to the world's last known functioning research lab in California.

programme.title: Brit Cops
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of police officers in Lincolnshire as they tackle crime.

programme.title: Ed Stafford: Left for Dead
programme.desc: Ed Stafford is dropped into Bolivia's Atacama plains - the world's highest, driest desert - where he must navigate his way to safety through perilous canyons in the blazing heat.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers Revisited

programme.title: Classic Car Rescue
programme.desc: Bernie Fineman and Mario Pacione are working to a tight deadline - and even tighter budget - to restore a Mercedes 450SL that has seen better days back to its former glory.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers Revisited
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer track down their restored Mazda MX5 in Surrey, and the mechanic takes it for a test drive to see if their hard work paid off.

programme.title: War and Peace
programme.desc: Andrew Davies' adaptation of Tolstoy's epic story of five aristocratic families experiencing Napoleon's invasion of Russia. Paul Dano stars as Pierre Bezukhov, an educated misfit out of place in St Petersburg society, who inherits a fortune as the illegitimate son of a wealthy count. His closest friend, Prince Andrei Bolkonsky (James Norton), is eager for the challenge of war, while sought-after heroine Natasha Rostova is desperate to experience life and love. Also starring Lily James, Jim Broadbent, Gillian Anderson and Rebecca Front.

programme.title: War and Peace
programme.desc: Andrei and Nikolai celebrate a victory, before preparing for an even greater battle with the French. The Tsar himself steps up to lead the troops, but General Kutuzov fears the ruler has misjudged the situation and that Napoleon is setting a trap for them. Back in Russia, Pierre is now married to Helene, but finds their life together harder than expected, while Natasha anxiously awaits news from the front line. Prince Vassily tries to arrange a marriage between Anatole and Andrei's sister Marya - but finds her father is not happy with the idea.

programme.title: War and Peace
programme.desc: Pierre fights a duel with Dolokhov, and the outcome inspires him to make changes in his life. Helene re-enters high society and pursues a new relationship, while Andrei is consumed with guilt and seeks seclusion in a country house he has built. The count tries to keep his spending under control, while Natasha and Sonya both receive unexpected marriage proposals. Nikolai makes the mistake of placing his trust in a dangerous friend, and a treaty between Russia and France leaves the future looking uncertain.

programme.title: War and Peace
programme.desc: Natasha agrees to Andrei's father's demands that they have a lengthy engagement, but encounters temptation during her fiance's long absence. Countess Rostova and Anna both try to find wealthy wives for their sons, but Nikolai and Boris have their own plans for the future. Pierre is frustrated with his marriage to Helene and longs to find some purpose in his life, while Marya's father becomes increasingly cruel in his treatment of her.

programme.title: War and Peace
programme.desc: The nation prepares for a decisive battle as Napoleon's forces invade Russia. As the French army marches eastwards, Marya realises that her family are in terrible danger, but her father refuses to listen to her grave warnings. Natasha falls ill, and Pierre takes it upon himself to looks after her - only to make a decision that opens his eyes to the horrors of war. Andrei struggles to forgive Natasha, and swears to have revenge on his rival. Helene struggles to remain in control of a compromising situation.

programme.title: War and Peace
programme.desc: Chaos descends on Moscow as the French army attacks the city. The Rostovs realise they are in danger and flee for their lives. Natasha finds herself with an unexpected travelling companion, and sees a last chance to make amends. Sonya is asked by the countess to make a sacrifice for her family. Traumatised by his experiences on the battlefield, Pierre resolves to stay behind and fight the invaders, and as he struggles through a hard winter, the scenes of horror and kindness he witnesses change his outlook on life.

With Kaye Wragg, Jason Merrells, Sylvestra Le Touzel, Matthew Lewis and Gary Lewis.

programme.desc: Documentary about British people arrested overseas, including an amateur drug dealer who blundered into the centre of a war between Greek and Albanian gangs.

programme.desc: The cases of a woman imprisoned in Dubai for having sex in the back of a taxi and a man who got into a fight in Thailand, and found himself sharing a prison with his opponents.

programme.title: Young, Dumb and Banged Up in the Sun

programme.title: Snitch
programme.desc: A man learns his estranged son is facing 10 years in prison for a crime he did not commit, so makes a deal with the authorities. In return for the charges being dropped, he will go undercover as an informant in a drug trafficking operation, putting his life on the line to bring the cartel down. Crime thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson and Susan Sarandon.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates how to recreate outdoor food at home, with recipes inspired by summers spent in beer gardens and cooking on the barbecue. He puts a southern-fried twist on the classic chicken in a basket he enjoyed as a teenager, heads to Cornwall to make a fish burger with freshly caught mackerel, pollack and lobster, and makes a maple cake baked on the barbecue.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates dishes inspired by food found on the menus of British pubs fit to celebrate special occasions. Tom shows how to cook the perfect slow roast duck, served with potato pancakes and braised lettuce, as well as spiced monkfish with smoked aubergine puree, and a gin and tonic granita for dessert. Later, he heads to Whitstable in Kent to whip up a seaweed mayonnaise to use as a dip for deep-fried oyster fritters.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates dishes inspired by classics of the British pub menu. He begins by making a simple Caesar salad, before showing how easy it is to whip up bar snacks such as pickled eggs, spicy nuts and pork scratchings. As a twist on the traditional roast, Tom cooks pork belly, lentils and cabbage salsa, and heads to Suffolk to prepare his take on fish and chips with locally caught brill. He finishes off by preparing a date and toffee pudding with a caramelised banana topping.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates how to make two roast dinners that provide an alternative to the average British Sunday lunch. He begins by marinating beef in treacle for 24 hours before serving it with crispy roast potatoes and Yorkshire puddings, before moving on to a recipe of turbot wrapped in puff pastry, providing a meat-free take on beef Wellington. He finishes by creating a chocolate cake with muscovado cream, along with a light lemon posset.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to the Greek island of Ikaria, where he forages for wild greens and herbs with local cook Tula, before preparing a healthy hilltop feast with four generations of her family. In Okinawa, Japan, Jamie joins local people for their early morning exercise and discovers the wonders of a local ancient ingredient.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is on the Greek island of Ikaria, where he helps 84-year-old Giorgios work the land and enjoys a lunch overlooking the sea, before visiting a Costa Rican cattle ranch where he eats black beans - a superfood packed with protein and fibre. Recipes featured include sweet potato, chilli, cheese and seed muffins, carbonara with smoky bacon, peas, almonds and basil, and smoky black bean stew with squash, peppers, rice and chili salsa.

programme.title: Gary Rhodes' Local Food Hero
programme.sub-title: Gary Rhodes' Local Food Heroes 2008: Wales
programme.desc: The chef's quest to seek out the finest local food takes him to Wales, where he meets award-winning chef Matt Tebbutt.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates recipes inspired by classic British pub fare, beginning with dishes perfect for serving up to groups of friends. Tom shows how to prepare slow-cooked shoulder of lamb with pommes boulangere, and a salt beef bagel prompted by a trip to a stall at Maltby Street market in Bermondsey, south London. He also prepares pollack, chorizo and chickpea stew, and a creamy plum fool, as well as giving advice on how to source the best UK produce.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food

He finishes by creating a chocolate cake with muscovado cream, along with a light lemon posset.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef makes family dishes inspired by British pub fare, preparing smoked haddock and parmesan omelette and giving the traditional roast chicken a farmyard twist by baking it in hay. He also demonstrates his take on the classic baked beans on toast and creates an apple toffee crumble pie for dessert.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver studies the diets of the places that have the most centenarians in the world, before providing healthy recipes that can be cooked at home. In Costa Rica, he meets, cooks and eats with five generations of the same family, including 106-year-old Jose, while on the Greek island of Ikaria 84-year-old goat farmer Nikos gives him clues to the secrets of the locals' long lives. Back in the UK, Jamie creates a day's worth of nutritious and tasty meals, including griddled steak with toasted nuts and grilled peppers.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Nicoyan Peninsula in Costa Rica, where he joins fisherman Otto for a meal of freshly caught fish with family and friends on the beach. In Okinawa, an island 400 miles off the coast of Japan, Jamie joins a 74-year-old grand karate master to learn some moves before lunch, which features popular local ingredient sweet potato. Back in the UK, Jamie creates nutritious and tasty meals, including cheese and corn pancakes topped with smoky bacon and caramelised banana; fish tacos, and chicken and sweet potato cacciatore, with mushrooms, tomatoes, olives and bread.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to the Greek island of Ikaria, where he forages for wild greens and herbs with local cook Tula, before preparing a healthy hilltop feast with four generations of her family. In Okinawa, Japan, Jamie joins local people for their early morning exercise and discovers the wonders of a local ancient ingredient.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is on the Greek island of Ikaria, where he helps 84-year-old Giorgios work the land and enjoys a lunch overlooking the sea, before visiting a Costa Rican cattle ranch where he eats black beans - a superfood packed with protein and fibre. Recipes featured include sweet potato, chilli, cheese and seed muffins, carbonara with smoky bacon, peas, almonds and basil, and smoky black bean stew with squash, peppers, rice and chili salsa.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: In Japan, Jamie Oliver harvests and eats seaweed - a superfood packed with immune system-boosting iron - before exploring Costa Ricans' love of fruit. Could it help to explain why they live so long? He then demonstrates recipes including baked eggs with cherry tomatoes and ricotta on toast, miso and chicken and mushrooms with wild rice, and prawns with vegetables and salsa.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver finds out whether wholegrain cracked wheat is a possible reason so many residents of the Greek island of Ikaria live for so long. He then heads to Okinawa in Japan to explore the secrets behind local fruit, vegetables, herbs and spices, and learns about the concept of nuchi gusui - `let food be your medicine'. Recipes include black-rice pudding with mango, lime, passion fruit and coconut, green-tea roasted salmon with ginger rice and sunshine salad, and seared turmeric chicken with hummus, peppers, couscous and greens.

programme.title: Jamie's Super Food
programme.desc: In Costa Rica's Nicoya peninsula, Jamie Oliver learns the importance of enjoying the simple things in life from a group of fisherman, as well as the benefits of adding fruit into classic recipes. On the Greek island of Ikaria, he discovers that adding a handful of nuts might boost longevity and in Okinawa, Japan, he finds out how locals treat food as medicine. Back in the UK, Jamie demonstrates recipes including pork and apple sauce, glazed carrots, brown rice and greens, Asian crispy beef, noodles and salad, and a healthy curried fish stew with a spicy kick.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates recipes inspired by classic British pub fare, beginning with dishes perfect for serving up to groups of friends. Tom shows how to prepare slow-cooked shoulder of lamb with pommes boulangere, and a salt beef bagel prompted by a trip to a stall at Maltby Street market in Bermondsey, south London. He also prepares pollack, chorizo and chickpea stew, and a creamy plum fool, as well as giving advice on how to source the best UK produce.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help families with their food shopping, beginning with the Booths from Lancashire. Mum Jenny claims to be cautious at the supermarket, always looking out for the best deals, but dad Howerd's impulse buys mean they always end up paying more than they should. Now they want to save £40 a week so they can build a home extension. Gregg and Chris start out by spying on the couple during their weekly shop - and are surprised by what they see.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help families with their food shopping, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their current bill, continuing with the Warners from Stratford-upon-Avon, whose weekly spending is out of control. With their limited cooking skills, Hannah and Tim rely on pre-prepared food, and assume that if something is expensive it must be better. Gregg and Chris spy on their shopping habits to see where the couple are going wrong, then give them further advice on cutting their shopping bill while ensuring their food is healthy. Plus, dietician Lucy Jones reveals the difference in the amounts of sugar present in various jars of tomato pasta sauce.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin spy on Maidenhead couple the Stantons, who turn out to be spontaneous shoppers - not only do they have no list and buy a lot of pre-chopped fruit and vegetables, they also don't purchase frozen food - and it seems that everything three-year-old daughter Sophia points to goes in the trolley. Gregg and Chris set to work swapping some of their favourite brands and showing them the benefits of using their freezer. Will they save enough money to get the dream holiday they deserve?

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help the Scott-Dent family in Newport with their food shopping, showing them simple and effective ways to save money. Kate and Chris have three children under 10, they both work, and Kate hates cooking, so relies on freezer food, Gregg and Chris secretly watch them on a weekly shop to see where they are going wrong, and their mistakes include buying sliced and grated cheese, pre-prepared fruit and veg, and overpriced frozen food. The couple are shocked when they are told that they are spending twice the amount of an average family of five. Plus, Chris tries to allay Kate's fear of using food near its sell-by date, and investigates how safe our food labels really are, while dietician Lucy Jones investigates the nutritional differences between margarine and butter.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Sainis from Sutton Coldfield, who are addicted to supermarket offers and have a tendency to over-indulge on snacks and sweet treats. They buy so many crisps in a single shop that Gregg is left wondering what they actually eat for dinner. The family are vegetarian, so dietician Lucy Jones looks at the nutritional difference between beef mince and soya mince, and Gregg visits a factory to find out how meat substitute is made - but can he and Chris persuade the Sainis to change their ways?

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Austens from West Sussex, whose income has reduced by a third since mum Denise recently gave up work. However, the family are guilty of stockpiling food to the point where they cannot open the fridge door without items falling out - and they are utterly devoted to high-end brands, refusing to buy anything other than their favourite labels.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help Clare and Richard from Hatfield, Hertfordshire, who are so busy with work and looking after two young children they have found themselves stuck in a rather unusual rut - seven years ago they devised a weekly meal plan - Monday is pizza, Wednesday is spaghetti bolognese and so on - and it hasn't changed since. Not only this, but they always buy big brands and premium supermarket ranges, which is an expensive way to shop for what has become a boring way to eat. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: The Guests from Loughborough eat a diet of convenience food that is not only unwholesome, it is also very expensive. Mum Lisa is aware she has to make her family more healthy, but is going about it the wrong way, buying into costly `superfoods' rather than good old-fashioned fruit and veg. Can Gregg and Chris help the Guests bring more variety to their plates - and in turn, knock a whopping 50 per cent off their shopping bill? Along the way, they also investigate how canned fish compares to fresh and which oil is best for cooking, as well as the diet cons to watch out for.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help families with their food shopping, beginning with the Booths from Lancashire. programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Gary Rhodes' Local Food Hero
programme.sub-title: Gary Rhodes' Local Food Hero 2007: South West
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Michael Caines as he searches for the finest local produce in the South West.

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah
programme.desc: Following staff at the Brighton-based chocolate shop, beginning as actress Whoopi Goldberg asks them to build a giant cake for a fundraising event.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers set out to discover why French chickens have gained a reputation for being `the poshest birds on the planet'. Beginning their quest in Lyon, the pair discover the origins of haute cuisine, before heading to a farm for an introduction to the famous poulet de Bresse. They also enjoy chicken dishes created by some of the country's finest chefs, and then head for Dave's new home in Northern France to prepare a feast for his neighbours. Finally, the boys arrive in Paris, where they cook an iconic French casserole, coq au vin, against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower.

programme.title: James Martin's Mediterranean
programme.desc: On the first stop of a Mediterranean tour the chef visits Ibiza, where he samples sobrasada sausage and cooks local dishes.

programme.title: James Martin's Mediterranean
programme.desc: James travels to the Italian fishing port of Pisciotta, where he learns the art of anchovy fishing.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a series of extended culinary breaks, visiting markets, restaurants, wineries, cafes and bars, looking for food excellence and also some innovative recipes that will encourage viewers to cook at home. He begins his first adventure in autumnal Bordeaux, where he helps judge a local wine contest and hires a 2CV for an excursion to the coast - abundant with mussels and oysters. At home, he cooks a memorable dish of steak frites with Bordelaise sauce.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef heads north towards the Arctic Circle to explore the culinary delights of Reykjavik, coastal capital of Iceland. His aim is to enjoy the perfect winter break, enriched with a smorgasbord featuring the best ingredients the country has to offer - fjord-reared roast lamb, rye bread baked in volcanic sand and langoustine soup. Rick also resumes his search for the perfect cod.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers set out to discover why French chickens have gained a reputation for being `the poshest birds on the planet'. Beginning their quest in Lyon, the pair discover the origins of haute cuisine, before heading to a farm for an introduction to the famous poulet de Bresse. They also enjoy chicken dishes created by some of the country's finest chefs, and then head for Dave's new home in Northern France to prepare a feast for his neighbours. Finally, the boys arrive in Paris, where they cook an iconic French casserole, coq au vin, against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower.

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: Calabria and Bambinone
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo return to Italy, where they continue their culinary journey. They begin in the southern region of Calabria, where they reminisce about their favourite childhood meals. Antonio reveals the secret of his hot packed-lunches while Gennaro shares his memories of the ritual pig kill. Featuring recipes for orzotto - a pork and pearl barley risotto - fish stew, and rice cake flavoured with orange.

programme.title: The Little Paris Kitchen: Cooking with Rachel Khoo
programme.desc: The pastry chef displays her passion and flair for the cuisine of Paris as she tries to prove that simple cooking can produce sensational results. In the first episode, she prepares her own take on a croque madame, makes a batch of madeleine cakes, shops in a Moroccan food market, and explores the French capital's rooftops to find honey created by Parisian bees.

programme.title: Donal's Irish Feast
programme.desc: Donal Skehan cooks up a different feast each week using local produce, beginning with Connemara Smokehouse salmon, Connemara Hill lamb, and Cuinneog buttermilk.

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi continues his culinary journey as he visits four of the Mediterranean's most beautiful islands, including Sardinia, Majorca and Crete. He begins on the French island of Corsica, where he discovers how its lush green landscape flavours the food, from cheese to honey, and meets its most celebrated chefs. He also prepares recipes including roasted fish with aromatic Corsican olive oil, Swiss chard and herb tart with local cheeses, honey and apricot trifle with walnuts and lavender, chestnut cake and a rich veal stew.

programme.title: James Martin's Brittany
programme.desc: The chef travels to France to retrace the journey he made as a student. In the first edition, he is joined by cooking duo the Hairy Bikers, and visits the market at Concarneau to source seafood, meat and vegetables.

programme.title: James Martin's Brittany
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of Concarnau market, and is joined by the Hairy Bikers to conjure up meals from the fresh seafood on offer.

programme.title: James Martin's Mediterranean
programme.desc: On the first stop of a Mediterranean tour the chef visits Ibiza, where he samples sobrasada sausage and cooks local dishes.

programme.title: James Martin's Mediterranean
programme.desc: James travels to the Italian fishing port of Pisciotta, where he learns the art of anchovy fishing.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers set out to discover why French chickens have gained a reputation for being `the poshest birds on the planet'. Beginning their quest in Lyon, the pair discover the origins of haute cuisine, before heading to a farm for an introduction to the famous poulet de Bresse. They also enjoy chicken dishes created by some of the country's finest chefs, and then head for Dave's new home in Northern France to prepare a feast for his neighbours. Finally, the boys arrive in Paris, where they cook an iconic French casserole, coq au vin, against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower.

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: Calabria and Bambinone
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo return to Italy, where they continue their culinary journey. They begin in the southern region of Calabria, where they reminisce about their favourite childhood meals. Antonio reveals the secret of his hot packed-lunches while Gennaro shares his memories of the ritual pig kill. Featuring recipes for orzotto - a pork and pearl barley risotto - fish stew, and rice cake flavoured with orange.

programme.title: The Little Paris Kitchen: Cooking with Rachel Khoo
programme.desc: The pastry chef displays her passion and flair for the cuisine of Paris as she tries to prove that simple cooking can produce sensational results. In the first episode, she prepares her own take on a croque madame, makes a batch of madeleine cakes, shops in a Moroccan food market, and explores the French capital's rooftops to find honey created by Parisian bees.

programme.title: Donal's Irish Feast
programme.desc: Donal Skehan cooks up a different feast each week using local produce, beginning with Connemara Smokehouse salmon, Connemara Hill lamb, and Cuinneog buttermilk.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a series of extended culinary breaks, visiting markets, restaurants, wineries, cafes and bars, looking for food excellence and also some innovative recipes that will encourage viewers to cook at home. He begins his first adventure in autumnal Bordeaux, where he helps judge a local wine contest and hires a 2CV for an excursion to the coast - abundant with mussels and oysters. At home, he cooks a memorable dish of steak frites with Bordelaise sauce.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef heads north towards the Arctic Circle to explore the culinary delights of Reykjavik, coastal capital of Iceland. His aim is to enjoy the perfect winter break, enriched with a smorgasbord featuring the best ingredients the country has to offer - fjord-reared roast lamb, rye bread baked in volcanic sand and langoustine soup. Rick also resumes his search for the perfect cod.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Chicken and Egg
