programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy digs into a late-night spot all about breakfast in Los Angeles, and a barbecue joint serving smoked pork belly dumplings in Phoenix.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples a poutine burger in Colorado, potato chip pie in Dallas, and killer clay-pot chicken in Phoenix.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri meets a mother and son team in Boulder serving up Chinese specialties such as dan dan noodles and steamed buns.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri uncovers some surprising culinary discoveries. In Columbus, Ohio, a hidden gem tucked away in a grocery store serves out-of-bounds Nepalese-Tibetan specialities.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Rosemary Chicken and Happy Cow Burgers
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare rosemary chicken, grilled polenta and porcini tomato sauce, as well as burgers with old-school coleslaw and corn on the cob.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Sticky Squid Balls and Sausage Fusili
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to cook sticky squid balls, grilled prawns and noodle broth, plus sausage fusilli and creamy garden salad, all within 15 minutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing smoked salmon with Yorkshire pudding, beets and asparagus, as well as cooking Greek chicken accompanied by sweet pepper and pea couscous with tzatziki.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing glazed sizzling chops, and sweet tomato and asparagus lasagnetti. Plus, mushroom soup and stilton, apple and walnut croutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare two quick recipes. This time, he rustles up seared Asian tuna, coconut rice and jiggy jiggy greens, plus ricotta fritters, tomato sauce and courgette salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Falafel Wraps and Spiced Chicken Lentils
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare two quick recipes. On the menu are spiced chicken, with bacon, asparagus and spinach lentils, plus falafel wraps with grilled vegetables and salsa.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Dishes include grilled tuna, `kinda' Nicoise salad, Thai chicken laksa and mildly spiced noodle squash broth as Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Lamb Tagine and Chicken Caesar Salad
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, revealing how to prepare lamb tagine, pan-fried aubergine and cumin crunch as well as crispy polenta chicken Caesar salad, each within the space of 15 minutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Fettuccine and Black Bean Beef Burgers
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a selection of dishes including fettuccine, smoked trout, asparagus and peas, black bean beef burgers, noodles and pickle salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up pork Marsala, porcini rice and spring vegetables, plus Koh Samui salad, chilli tofu and Thai noodles.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Crispy Pork and Grilled Mushroom Sub
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food, showing how to prepare crispy Parma pork with minted courgettes and brown rice, plus grilled mushroom sub, smoky pancetta, melted cheese and pears.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a selection of dishes including sizzling chicken fajitas, grilled peppers, salsa, rice and beans, plus prawn cocktail, king prawns and sun-dried pan bread.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Sizzling Beef Steak and Mighty Mackerel
programme.desc: In another demonstration of how to create tasty meals fast, Jamie Oliver prepares sizzling beef steak with hoi sin prawn and noodle bowls, and mackerel with mixed tomato and quinoa salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Steak, Liver and Bacon and Mexican Tomato Soup
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares a selection of dishes including Mexican tomato soup, chilli nachos and veggie and feta sprinkles, plus steak, liver and bacon, bubble and squeak mash, and red onion gravy.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a hearty fish pie, helped by his son Buddy, with a fish curry using coconut milk and spinach for the sauce. He also makes gnudi - like gnocchi, but lighter - served with a butter and sage sauce, and hummingbird cake, an American sponge with pineapple, banana and cinnamon among its ingredients.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food
programme.desc: Popular chef Jamie Oliver's latest menu features ham, egg and chips with a Jamaican jerk rub and caramelised pineapple, chicken kebab served with houmous and mango amba sauce, and a three-tiered chocolate sponge cake complete with nougat frosting.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives more of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, continuing with lasagne with roasted duck, the ultimate bacon sandwich and, from rural Mexico, huevos rancheros - cooked eggs with a spicy tomato salsa, black beans, avocado and a soft tortilla.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food
programme.desc: Over the past seven editions, Jamie Oliver has given some of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, reinventing British classics like shepherd's pie, rustling up outdoor treats and transforming old-school desserts such as pavlova and sticky-toffee pudding. For his final menu, he makes fish and chips with an India Pale Ale batter, a treat for vegetarians with his version of the Indonesian salad gado gado, and a speedy crab linguine.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver teaches guest Martin Clunes how to cook a paella, just like the ones the Doc Martin actor enjoyed on holiday with his father as a youngster. Jamie also cooks the most beautiful lamb rack and potato al forno, while co-host Jimmy Doherty turns plants into root beer and countryside cocktails. This week's food fight concerns sustainable fish.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Accomplished diver Tom Daley assists Jamie Oliver in cooking sweet-and-sour chicken, while Jimmy Doherty goes abseiling for seaweed. Hosts Jimmy and Jamie also demonstrate the proper way to treat an old cow.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty are joined by Pirates of the Caribbean and Three Musketeers star Orlando Bloom, who shows off his sword training when he rustles up a Moroccan tagine. Jamie prepares fragrant, aromatic Asian seafood parcels, while Jimmy takes on the great British banger, showing how to make a DIY version that can be trusted. The presenters also uncover a by-product of the goat dairy industry - delicious meat that is currently being binned.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Hollywood star Goldie Hawn drops by the cafe to cook fettuccine Alfredo, her favourite Italian comfort food dish. Jamie Oliver makes a slow-cooked shoulder of lamb, perfumed with Middle Eastern spices, that's so tender after seven hours cooking that it simply falls apart. Not to be outdone, co-host Jimmy Doherty takes on smoked salmon, using a DIY smoker made out of a cardboard box. The duo unite to showcase an array of often overlooked British seafood - and bid to get Scottish langoustines placed on the menu.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant learns how to cook a Croatian black cuttlefish ink risotto. Jamie Oliver prepares an epic Italian feast arrosto misto, including roasted duck, chicken, partridge, pigeon and quail, while Jimmy Doherty demonstrates how to make stone-baked sourdough bread and builds his own wood-fired oven from bricks and paving slabs. Plus, the hosts investigate why small-scale UK pig farmers are being left with huge amounts of meat they are unable to sell.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Hosts Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty are joined by actor, writer and award-winning comedian Jack Whitehall, who is taught how to cook a mega-indulgent chocolate pizza. Plus, Jamie makes an epic Gurkha chicken curry, while Jimmy prepares a smoked ham using a DIY smoker built out of plant pots, baking trays and a colander. And the boys are on the trail of an innovative solution to the UK's most wasted household food product, bread, meeting some inspiring Belgium brewers turning discarded loaves into beer.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a deli in Santa Barbara, California, famous with locals and celebrities that serves traditional pastrami.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy samples some ramen in St. Petersburg, Florida, before visiting a New Orleans smokehouse putting out favourites like spicy shrimp boudin.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of saving the Wagon Wheel in Smyrna, Delaware from failure in just two days and with a budget of only $10,000.

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Marigny Brasserie, New Orleans has noticed an influx of rowdy tourists at his `locals' bar', so the Mystery Diners investigate who is profiting from the new customers.

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing rumours of his restaurant's signature cocktail being served at other bars, the owner of Victory, New Orleans contacts the Mystery Diners for help.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree throws a cocktail party for the crew helping to open her store in town.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree spends time with her son, Bryce, making beef fajita nachos, white chicken chili for dinner and orange-vanilla monkey bread as a breakfast treat.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares money-saving ideas for transforming random cuts of beef into four delicious dishes, including slow cooker Sunday stew, and teriyaki beef stir-fry.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up some crazy and fun ideas for game night food. She prepares pull-apart pizza rolls, over-the-top Hawaiian burgers, and taco quesadilla.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree shares the epic tale of opening day at The Mercantile while making three get-ahead dinners.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree shares the good stuff with the chocolate lovers in her life, starting with a triple chocolate tiramisu, and crispy chocolate dippers to use in a chocolate shake.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond welcomes a new cowboy to the ranch with a frontier-style dinner kit of his favourite food, including short rib sandwiches, and salted caramel frosted brownies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up tuna noodle casserole, meatballs in sweet and sour sauce, glazed apple dumplings and Welsh rarebit.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes beef noodle salad bowls with peanut sauce, kale pasta Mason jar salad and a cowboy bento box packed with chicken wings in BBQ sauce and creamy lemon basil potato salad.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a hearty shepherd's pie, roasted carrots with vinaigrette, and for dessert, a raspberry cream pie.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a simple chicken and dressing sheet pan supper, lemon, basil and shrimp risotto in a skillet, the easiest ramen pho and a layered portable Greek salad in a jar.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a warming lunch, demonstrating how to make a chunky beef chili, and cheesy quesadillas.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares her daughter's favourite Kung Pao chicken, and spicy Sriracha popcorn is a winner with the entire family.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares speedy shrimp tacos, pork chops with wine and garlic, zesty lemony green beans, pepperoni chicken and crispy grilled cheese sandwiches.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree fills the fridge with her kids' favourite foods while they all help out at the Merc. She prepares Paige's quiche, restorative chicken noodle soup and berry yoghurt parfaits.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares shortcut chocolate chip hazelnut pancakes, omelettes in a bag, cheesy wafflemaker hash browns and mango smoothie packs.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cleans out her fridge and uses up the food that's on its way out. She makes lemon rice pudding, fridge gazpacho, Tex-Mex chicken and chicken Alfredo.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree elevates mundane store-bought ingredients as she turns angel food cake into a stunning baked Alaska, and conjures up fruit tarts from cookie dough.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes a breakfast platter with fried eggs over easy, honey-glazed ham, fried sausage, bacon and crispy bits potatoes and sticky buns.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: The Way Things Used To Be
programme.desc: Ree prepares a cowboy spread for her husband, Ladd, and his father, including juicy breakfast steaks, cheesy breakfast grits with bacon and classic apple dumplings.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree whips up grab-and-go breakfasts for the kids, including Amish baked oatmeal, apple granola stackers and individual ham casseroles.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree rustles up strip steak sandwiches and fun cowboy dippers. Then, she makes frozen summer coolers after a hot morning of work.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Alex is home from college, and the cousins are getting together for a street taco feast. Ree prepares Texas braised beef, ranch chicken, avocado lime crema, and salsa diablo.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree and her daughter Paige reminisce over an afternoon tea for two, as they enjoy ham and leak mini quiches, garden spread finger sandwiches and lemon raspberry tarts.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver meets former gangsters, cowboys and high-society women as he embarks on a culinary journey to discover the heart and soul of America. He begins in Los Angeles, where he departs from the glitz and glamour of Hollywood to sample Mexican dishes away from the bright lights.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. The chef also gets the chance to ride a bucking bronco on rodeo night and meets rancher Hip Tillet, who teaches him how to prepare local speciality Rocky Mountain oysters.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Just weeks after Hurricane Gustav wreaked havoc on Louisiana, Jamie Oliver visits the state, hoping to understand how food helps to maintain people's spirits through adversity. In New Orleans he calls at a Creole restaurant run by a self-styled gumbo queen, and is given the opportunity to learn the art of alligator hunting.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having sampled some of America's most diverse dietary offerings, Jamie Oliver sets out in search of the country's cheapest culinary treats. In Georgia, he meets family members who have been growing, killing and cooking their own food for generations, and asks them to lend him their expertise at a barbecue contest in Florida. He also encounters the cake-baking Sex and Savannah women, and visits a soul food restaurant struggling to survive in harsh financial times.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The crusading chef reaches the final stop on his tour, a Navajo reservation in Arizona. Here, he encounters some of the country's oldest culinary traditions, and is given a crash course in the tribe's spirituality. However, he is disappointed to see the extent to which Navajo children are becoming reliant on junk food, and sets out to help them embrace their heritage by introducing them to Native American versions of fast food.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri digs into all kinds of meat when he visits Miami, Florida, and Modesto and Stockton in California.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri checks out the food scene in Cuba, including a Soviet establishment serving authentic Russian fare.

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives more of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, continuing with lasagne with roasted duck, the ultimate bacon sandwich and, from rural Mexico, huevos rancheros - cooked eggs with a spicy tomato salsa, black beans, avocado and a soft tortilla.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food
programme.desc: Over the past seven editions, Jamie Oliver has given some of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, reinventing British classics like shepherd's pie, rustling up outdoor treats and transforming old-school desserts such as pavlova and sticky-toffee pudding. For his final menu, he makes fish and chips with an India Pale Ale batter, a treat for vegetarians with his version of the Indonesian salad gado gado, and a speedy crab linguine.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver teaches guest Martin Clunes how to cook a paella, just like the ones the Doc Martin actor enjoyed on holiday with his father as a youngster. Jamie also cooks the most beautiful lamb rack and potato al forno, while co-host Jimmy Doherty turns plants into root beer and countryside cocktails. This week's food fight concerns sustainable fish.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Accomplished diver Tom Daley assists Jamie Oliver in cooking sweet-and-sour chicken, while Jimmy Doherty goes abseiling for seaweed. Hosts Jimmy and Jamie also demonstrate the proper way to treat an old cow.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty are joined by Pirates of the Caribbean and Three Musketeers star Orlando Bloom, who shows off his sword training when he rustles up a Moroccan tagine. Jamie prepares fragrant, aromatic Asian seafood parcels, while Jimmy takes on the great British banger, showing how to make a DIY version that can be trusted. The presenters also uncover a by-product of the goat dairy industry - delicious meat that is currently being binned.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Hollywood star Goldie Hawn drops by the cafe to cook fettuccine Alfredo, her favourite Italian comfort food dish. Jamie Oliver makes a slow-cooked shoulder of lamb, perfumed with Middle Eastern spices, that's so tender after seven hours cooking that it simply falls apart. Not to be outdone, co-host Jimmy Doherty takes on smoked salmon, using a DIY smoker made out of a cardboard box. The duo unite to showcase an array of often overlooked British seafood - and bid to get Scottish langoustines placed on the menu.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant learns how to cook a Croatian black cuttlefish ink risotto. Jamie Oliver prepares an epic Italian feast arrosto misto, including roasted duck, chicken, partridge, pigeon and quail, while Jimmy Doherty demonstrates how to make stone-baked sourdough bread and builds his own wood-fired oven from bricks and paving slabs. Plus, the hosts investigate why small-scale UK pig farmers are being left with huge amounts of meat they are unable to sell.

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Hosts Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty are joined by actor, writer and award-winning comedian Jack Whitehall, who is taught how to cook a mega-indulgent chocolate pizza. Plus, Jamie makes an epic Gurkha chicken curry, while Jimmy prepares a smoked ham using a DIY smoker built out of plant pots, baking trays and a colander. And the boys are on the trail of an innovative solution to the UK's most wasted household food product, bread, meeting some inspiring Belgium brewers turning discarded loaves into beer.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver meets former gangsters, cowboys and high-society women as he embarks on a culinary journey to discover the heart and soul of America. He begins in Los Angeles, where he departs from the glitz and glamour of Hollywood to sample Mexican dishes away from the bright lights.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. The chef also gets the chance to ride a bucking bronco on rodeo night and meets rancher Hip Tillet, who teaches him how to prepare local speciality Rocky Mountain oysters.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Just weeks after Hurricane Gustav wreaked havoc on Louisiana, Jamie Oliver visits the state, hoping to understand how food helps to maintain people's spirits through adversity. In New Orleans he calls at a Creole restaurant run by a self-styled gumbo queen, and is given the opportunity to learn the art of alligator hunting.

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having sampled some of America's most diverse dietary offerings, Jamie Oliver sets out in search of the country's cheapest culinary treats. In Georgia, he meets family members who have been growing, killing and cooking their own food for generations, and asks them to lend him their expertise at a barbecue contest in Florida. He also encounters the cake-baking Sex and Savannah women, and visits a soul food restaurant struggling to survive in harsh financial times.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: With cameras now recording life on two busy maternity wards in Leeds, the documentary features the stories of Stacey and Ramona. The former is expecting her second child, but every time she thinks she is in labour, it turns out to be a false alarm and staff send her home. Meanwhile, Ramona wants to give birth naturally with husband Marvin by her side, having had an emergency C-section in the past. Elsewhere, the hospital is promoting `active birth' and trainee yoga instructor Sara wholeheartedly embraces the idea.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The stories of two strong women offering their daughters plenty of support during labour after unplanned pregnancies. Twenty-three-year-old Sam went off the rails as a teenager, running away from home and ending up sleeping rough, before meeting her partner Biaggio, and the couple are grateful to have Sam's mum by their side. Claire, 20, always knew she wanted her mother to be there in the delivery room, but deciding whether boyfriend Clint should be present wasn't as easy.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Two strong-willed first-time mothers give birth at Leeds General Infirmary. Alexandra is 25 and left her native Latvia in search of adventure. She believes her child is the missing piece in her life, even though the father is not around anymore. Surbhi is from a warrior Hindu caste and knows what she wants, while her husband will do anything to please her, especially as he feels responsible for a motorcycle accident that left his wife paralysed in one arm.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows two couples on a busy maternity ward in Leeds. Father-to-be William, who met his wife Belem online, shoots a video with a running commentary in Spanish for his family in Colombia, while Kerry has set aside 84 colour co-ordinated outfits for their new addition, explaining that if she isn't fully prepared for something she panics. However, when her baby's heart rate drops in labour, it's her partner Dan who starts to worry.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Midwife Linda Abbott comes out of retirement to return to Leeds General Infirmary, while two fathers with very different attitudes await the arrival of their newborns. Joel dotes on wife Rachel and the couple grow more anxious with each day on the labour ward, having lost their first son who was born prematurely. Meanwhile, Chris admits he doesn't have a clue what to do in his role as birth partner, and his attempt to use humour to deal with his nerves fails to go down well in the delivery room.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives at Leeds General Infirmary deal with a September baby boom and have to send some of the expectant mothers to St James's Hospital across the city, which means a last-minute change to birth plans for those affected, like first-time mum Rachel. Natalie and Shane also have to be transferred to a different maternity unit, while Kate and David experience a long wait for her Caesarean due to the number of emergency cases going to theatre.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Extreme Love
programme.desc: In the first of two documentaries focusing on neurological conditions, Louis visits a school in America for people with autism - a developmental disorder characterised by difficulties with social interaction and communication. The DLC Warren in New Jersey is one of the most innovative centres of its kind, with specialist intervention designed to help both the students and the families who care for them. He meets 13-year-old Joey, whose mother Carol is finding it increasingly difficult to cope with his explosive tantrums, 19-year-old Nicky, who has written a novel, and 20-year-old Brian, whose extreme behaviour has led to the decision to place him in residential care.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: America's Medicated Kids
programme.desc: Louis visits one of America's leading children's psychiatric treatment centres in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, to discover why drugs are taking the place of old-fashioned parenting. He gets a glimpse of what life is like for 15-year-old Kaylee, diagnosed with ADHD, when she suspends her medication for a day.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: America's Most Dangerous Pets
programme.desc: The World Wildlife Fund claims there are now more tigers in captivity in America than there are living wild in the rest of the world. Armed with this statistic, Louis Theroux travels stateside to meet people who give house space to animals normally found in Africa and Asia, including big cats and dangerous primates. Among the owners he meets is Joe Exotic, a policeman-turned-animal rescuer who has bred and collected more than 150 tigers, and Connie Casey, who shares her home with her `family' of 20 chimpanzees.

programme.title: Into the Fire
programme.desc: A dog that weights 14 stone needs rescuing after falling 100 feet down a ravine, and more than 30 firefighters tackle a huge blaze at an industrial unit.

programme.title: William and Harry: Brothers in Arms
programme.desc: The relationship between the two princes, examining how they have been shaped by a life in the public eye and the tumultuous events of their childhood.

programme.title: More Sex Please, We're British
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on Britain's thriving sex-toy industry, which is estimated to be worth £250million. The film goes behind the scenes at Lovehoney, one of the nation's leading online erotic retailers, to discover how founders Neal Slateford and Richard Longhurst set up a 70-strong team to provide people around the UK with everything from sexy lingerie to adult toys, literature and games. Cameras follow the work of several staff members, including Annabelle Knight, who presents the company's online videos.

programme.title: Ground Force
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a garden in Buckinghamshire with a living willow arbour and a purple-draped pavilion. Featuring Charlie Dimmock, Tommy Walsh and Will Shanahan.

programme.title: Ground Force

Alan Titchmarsh lays a local slate stone path while Charlie Dimmock adds some colour with flowers and shrubs, but the central feature is the two-tiered viewing platform - to surprise motor racing fanatic Mark.

programme.title: Ground Force
programme.desc: The team creates a wheelchair-friendly garden for a farmer and his wife in Longney, Gloucester, adding raised floral beds and a water feature, plus a resin-bonded path for easier access. Meanwhile, on day two, Alan Titchmarsh whirls away in a helicopter to keep an appointment with Prince Charles at the Chelsea Flower Show.

programme.title: Ground Force
programme.desc: The green-fingered gang spends a sunny two days in Sheerness on the Isle of Sheppey in the Thames Estuary, transforming a tiny garden into a patio and pavilion for newlyweds Nina and Dave.

programme.title: Ground Force

Although a little more modest than anticipated and with few changes to the original design, the team sets to work on a pergola, water feature and a wall, hoping to make the best of the garden's heavenly hilltop views.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall cooks using produce from Britain's abundant spring harvest, including asparagus, artichokes and lamb. The shepherd's pie recipe is taste-tested against Delia Smith's cheat version with surprising results, and five Bristol families are challenged to turn an acre of city land into an urban smallholding. Plus, an update on the Chicken Out! campaign.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall prepares dishes using seasonal lettuce and spinach from his kitchen garden, and dandelion and burdock grown in the hedgerows. The experimental Bristol smallholding receives four saddleback pigs, and vegetarian Susan accepts the task of butchering a whole lamb's carcass. Plus, the chef's country honey is pitted against the city variety at a taste-off in Broadway market.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: The potatoes and radishes are ready for picking and the broad beans are de-podded for a luxurious dish of beans on toast. Jess chooses a batch of hens from a battery egg farm as the Bristol experiment to turn an acre of derelict city land into a smallholding continues. Back at River Cottage, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall organises a foraging competition and finds his ducklings hatch days early.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the arrival of summer with a fair. He prepares elderflower champagne and the Bristol families spit-roast pigs, lamb and goat. The final crops he still has to harvest are peas, gooseberries and wet garlic, at which time he will have experienced all that his land has to offer during his favourite season of the year.

programme.sub-title: The Case of the Discontented Soldier
programme.desc: A retired major who seeks advice on spicing up his mundane life soon finds himself involved in an adventure. Drama, based on a short story by the novelist, starring Maurice Denham and William Gaunt.

programme.sub-title: The Case of the Middle-Aged Wife
programme.desc: A dowdy wife whose husband has become besotted with a young secretary discovers that age difference need not be a barrier to romance. Drama based on a short story, starring Maurice Denham and Gwen Watford.

programme.title: The Agatha Christie Hour
programme.desc: On a visit to a family estate, a man has a vision of a woman being strangled, but forgets about it when he goes off to war. However, years later, the events he apparently witnessed seem ready to be played out. Drama, based on a short story by the novelist, starring Nicholas Clay and Emma Piper.

programme.title: The Agatha Christie Hour
programme.desc: When a penniless man takes a holiday, he is shocked when a beautiful girl flings herself into his railway carriage, begging to be hidden. When she asks him to take care of a package and then leaves, the man becomes embroiled in an adventure.

programme.title: The Agatha Christie Hour
programme.desc: A disaffected wife planning a new life abroad with her lover faces divided loyalties when she learns her husband's business has collapsed and he may be charged with embezzlement. Drama, based on a short story by the novelist.

programme.title: The Agatha Christie Hour
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Blue Jar
programme.desc: A young man haunted by a woman's cries for help over a murder - which only he can hear - finds his search for their source leads him to a priceless blue vase bought by his uncle. Drama, based on a short story, starring Robin Kermode.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's A Caribbean Mystery
programme.desc: Miss Marple arrives in the Bahamas for rest and recuperation, where she encounters a retired army officer with a secret to reveal. He claims to have proof that a guest at the resort is a killer, but before he can specify who, he is poisoned and the incriminating evidence disappears. It falls to the indomitable amateur sleuth to unmask the culprit. Drama, with Helen Hayes, Barnard Hughes, Season Hubley and Swoosie Kurtz.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Sparkling Cyanide
programme.desc: Modern reworking of Agatha Christie's classic murder mystery, starring Pauline Collins, Oliver Ford Davies, Kenneth Cranham and Susan Hampshire. A football chairman hosts a glitzy party to celebrate a new signing, but as the guests raise their glasses to toast a successful future, his wife suddenly drops dead. A pair of MI5 agents are called in to investigate, and it's not long before the finger of suspicion points at the victim's husband - until he too is murdered.

programme.title: The Agatha Christie Hour
